Tossing it this time and replacing with a waterproof/dustproof unit.Otherwise, it was a great camera...good image quality, geotagging a nice feature and great zoom.  Kind of like "Other than that Mrs. Lincoln, how was the play?".

Reviews.Title: One of the Best All-in One Point & Shoots
Reviews.Author: J Anthony "tinglassman"
Reviews.Content: I have been an avid photo nut for 30+ years. I wanted a small point & shoot for trips to places I've been before where I didn't want to carry around me DSLR.  The short of it is, this is one of the top, by most reviews. I think the ZS10 is now available, but the ZS10 actually lowered some of the features to lesser quality.Why this Point & Shoot? There's lots of features on this P&S;, but here are the more notable features I love compared to other P&S; cameras:1) It's one of (2) P&S; which allows not only Manual Settings, but full manual based on Aperture, Shutter & Picture. Many don't offer the ability to manually alter the Shutter Speed, let alone the Aperture. To those of us who are photo nuts who want full manual control, this camera delivers.2) While just about all P & S cameras offer 12 or 14 megapixels, there is one small aspect they don't tell you. If you raise ISO settings (to allow more light) above 800, 99% of all P&S; cameras default to only 6 megapixels. Meaning: you don't get that shot in 12 or 14 you thought you were taking.  Panasonic has put a ton of money into fixing ISO issues with P&S; cams, thus when you raise the ISO settings to 800, 1200, 2400, even 3200, the shot is still in 12 Megapixel.  Only Nikon has one P&S; that comes close to this.3) The 12x optical zoom is more than you'll ever need, but covers a great focal length4) Dual Stereo mics & GPS tagging. Love both features. It's nice to get full sound recordingI've used this camera on many travels and love it.  I recently searched this camera and see the prices are, at times, higher than when it was introduced; it's in that high of a demand.  I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, lousy warranty
Reviews.Author: C. Marder
Reviews.Content: I've taken very good photos with the camera and love the zoom and compactness BUT the camera malfunctioned after 8 months.  They had me ship it back and sent me another one.  What I didn't know was that under warranty, they send back a refurbished camera.  That would have been fine but the one I received was banged up and scratched to the point where the model & serial # were barely readable.  After the year warranty was up (5 months later), the camera malfunctioned in 5 different ways.  I had bought a 5 yr extended warranty when originally purchasing the camera but even the camera repair shop had trouble fixing the camera.  In the end, they fixed 4 out of 5 problems and one of the fixed problems has gradually gotten worse - ie. trying to get the camera to focus on closeups have a 65% chance of NOT working.  I could send it back for repair again but I will be out the cost of shipping it back again, plus paying the $10 service charge each time it's serviced and I am without a camera for each "repair time".

Reviews.Title: DMC-ZS7 & DMC-ZS10 Great Picture and Video Poor GPS
Reviews.Author: Peter P. Strawn "Peter"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic DMC-ZS7 and DMC-ZS10 both take excellent still and video photos.  Their picture quality is the best I've experience in a point-n-shoot camera.  However, the GPS functionality is quite frankly poor.  In testing the accuracy ranged from 15 to 185 yards, significantly worse than the 3-5 yards experienced with the Casio EX-H20G, Sony DSC-HX7V, or Nikon P6000.  The buyer needs to ask themselves what is most important, the picture quality or the accuracy of the coordinates.  In a perfect world it would be great to have both in a small point-n-shoot camera, but so far I've yet to find that ideal combination.  If you value still and video image quality then buy the Panasonic DMC-ZS7 or DMC-ZS10.  Both provide excellent picture and video quality.  The other options tested so far provided these results:  Nikon P6000 - accurate GPS, fairly quick satellite lock after an initial lock-on in the area, good quality pictures, and mediocre video quality at best.  Casio EX-H20G - GPS fairly accurate (within 3-5 meters) and also has a feature when used with the Nikon ViewNX2 program that shows the direction the camera was facing when the photo was taken.  Still images:  - produces photos taken in sunlight with auto WB that have a pronounced yellowish cast (probably resultig from poor auto WB controls)  - non-moving images the focus is good and sharp  - moving images are frequently out of focus because of the shutter lag in shooting  - tends to over-expose photos 0.3-0.7 f/stops (you can set the exposure offset to compensate for this BUT the setting is lost every time you power down  - it appears to not save any of the menu system settings when you turn the camera off)  Video  - zoom function does not work (digital zoom off) after you've started a recording, before pressing start it does work  - quality is OK at minimum zoom settng but not as good as the DMC-ZS7 or DMC-ZS10  - using the digital zoom function produced very poor quality video  Sony DSC-HX7V  Still images:  - produces the worst photos of any of the GPS cameras  - the white balance is never correct and there is no easy way to correct this in the camera  - the sensor has very high contrast and this cannot be adjusted in the camera  - the exposure settings choose to grossly overexpose images, even with a manual offset of -1.3 f/stops the pictures still had overexposure issues due to the sensor's high contrast  Video:  - the videos are OK at the higher resolution settings though the colors are muted  - the zoom function works in the video mode  - the camera has a very good macro capability

Reviews.Title: Beware-camera internal lens vulnerable to dust
Reviews.Author: W. Oman
Reviews.Content: I would seriously reconsider buying another Lumix camera until Panasonic fixes this design flaw.  The camera was working flawlessly for 6 months until I noticed dust spots showing up on my photos. I could see spots on the viewfinder screen when I used the zoom.Apparently, this "pocket camera" should not be placed in your pocket unless you put it in plastic to prevent dust from entering the camera through the zoom.  No camera shop was willing to open the camera. Sending it into a company for repairs came back with an estimate that exceeds half of the cost for a new camera.  On line searches revealed similar experiences with dust by other users.My attempts to open the camera and remove the dust ended in the camera becoming inoperable.

Reviews.Title: SLR QUALITY CAMERA IN COMPACT FORM!
Reviews.Author: JMJ "All things by Gods Grace"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my husband's birthday gift. I am no longer the best photographer in the family, LOL!SIMPLY PUT:PHOTO QUALITY:AMAZING. The photo quality is on par with an SLR. . . . and it DOES what you WANT it to do! Sunrise, sunset, bright sun, low light, rain . . . whatever the conditions . . . this camera EXCELS.EASE OF USE:Considering the photo/video quality and features this camera is very easy to use. The zoom capability is unheard of in a point and shoot. You literally won't believe your eyes.VIDEO:It's HD baby! TOP quality video with NO noise - and not a visual blemish to be seen.Again, very easy to use. Nice zoom here as well.ATTRACTIVENESS:It's not a nice looking camera, but what's on the INSIDE is simply BEAUTIFUL ;-)SIZE:Conveniently pocket sized (but large on quality!)BATTERY/MEMORY:You will need to purchase a better battery and more memory: THAT IS A DEFINITE.VALUE:FOR the price you cannot ask for more: this is a PHOTOGRAPHERS QUALITY camera.Your photos will look professional, and that is putting it mildly. Thumbs are all the way up on this purchase! :)Enjoy and God bless :)

Reviews.Title: A  camera that's a pleasure to use
Reviews.Author: George C Lassetter III
Reviews.Content: A capable point and shoot that has all the features we'll ever need. Been on two trips with it so far and the picture quality has been fantastic in all light and weather conditions. It is now my wife's camera and I've been relegated to the Sony DSC W90 (A fine camera also). Looking forward to using the GPS functionality on our cruise to the Eastern Med (Istanbul) and with two cameras should not miss any shots or 'forget' where the pictures were taken!

Reviews.Title: AWSOME great camera
Reviews.Author: SurfMaiden "WaterGal"
Reviews.Content: I researched cameras for months!  i knew i wanted a Lumix but didnt know which one.  I settled on this one due to the reviews.  it is SUPER ez to use.  i have not even read the instructions yet!  it has incredible zoom and there is NO shake with this feature!i am having a little issue with taking pix of myself.  but i will get that 'down'.  oh, there is something a little odd, when zooming in to view a photo already taken, the zoom has sorta 'pre set' zooms identified....i cannot get it to smoothly zoom in, it zooms to where it does (hope this makes sense).  i do like that the photos all make themselves upright to view/store. This is handy (i believe) when using those digital frames.  this way you wont have to fix each photo to the upright position for viewing as it will already be that way!to download photos is totally ez.  just hook the usb to the computer.i am writing this review and have not even fully checked out the camera but merely used it and shared photos.  but from that standpoint alone it is a terrific camera!

Reviews.Title: Excelente cámara y razonable precio
Reviews.Author: Arnaldo Silva Alvarez
Reviews.Content: La cámara Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 es un producto que no defrauda. Las fotos son nítidas con colores brillantes y fieles al objeto fotografiado. Con la función Macro se pueden obtener imágenes tan cerca como te lo propongas y con unos detalles asombrosos. Es de verdad fantástica esta función. Igualmente el zomm de 12X. Todo lo acerca con mucha nitidez. Es una cámara para descubrir. Tiene una amplia gama de funciones que aún desconozco, pero estoy seguro que me brindarán nuevas opciones a la hora de salir a fotografiar. La construcción de la máquina es muy sólida y ni hablar de los lentes, de cristal fabricados por Leica. Posee un GPS que geoposiciona las fotos con bastante precisión. Pienso que si en algo hay que mejorar esta cámara Panasonic, es en la duración de la carga de las baterías. Es mejor comprar dos baterías, no te vayas a quedarte sin pilas. Resumiendo: sumamente recomendable la Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7. La recomiendo ampliamente.

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love this camera
Reviews.Author: tj "luvs shoes"
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing.  Every time I think, "I wonder if it could do this" I look at the (online) manual and can figure out how to do do it.  And I am just a regular person, not a photographer.  My friends can't believe the pictures I get on this camera.The ONLY downside is that the battery has to be charged with a Panasonic charger.  This became a big deal while on vacation in Hawaii and I realized I left the charger at home.  I could not find a store on Maui that carried a Panasonic battery or charger and was left with a lot of 'mental memories' instead of pictures.  Other cameras are able to use a universal charger.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: carefulshopper1
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a European vacation. I am pretty much a point-and-shoot photographer, but I wanted high-quality photos to remember a special trip. I was looking for a camera small enough to readily fit in a pocket or small purse, but with a good lens.This camera more than met my expectations. The zoom is amazing - I was able to get great detail on buildings and scenery. It's quite easy to use - like other reviewers, my only quibble with the design is that it's easy to inadvertently press the video button. I found that the amount of picture-taking I did during a full day of sightseeing usually ran down the battery (and that was without using the GPS), so I carried a charged spare with me each day.A camera like this makes me a better photographer. I took almost a thousand pictures on my trip, and the vast majority of them came out beautifully. I also took a little video - very good quality and great sound. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-Zs7
Reviews.Author: hfroeh
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for our trip to Hawaii and I must say the pictures are impressive, the 12X zoom surpasses most of these cameras. The antishake feature is great. But best of all, the GPS feature when turned on tells you exactly where you are and the time of day your taking the picture. It is also compact and easy to store.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: Daniel L. Obrien "Dan"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Lumix with Leica 12X optics and took it the next day to China, along with my old Canon just in case.  Still in China 3+ weeks later.  No complaints, optics great, zoom range great, larger than the Canon, but SO much more capability, it still fits in a shirt pocket.  Haven't used the old camera.Small things need improvement... battery door lock may open from handling, no big deal, it doesn't fall out.  You may inadvertantly press some buttons on the back when using one handed... don't know how the fix that one.  These are not serious.This is a great camera folks.  Buy it, and never feel limited by focal length in a pocketable camera again.

Reviews.Title: awesome job
Reviews.Author: samsydzan
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful.  I had a two Cannon Powershots before the older one took forever to take a picture, the second one went through batteries every 5 pictures which is not that much of an exaggeration!  This camera is wonderful.  The battery holds a charge, the pictures are beautiful, and it takes the pictures in rapid succession.  I am very pleased.  All the reviews I read on this camera hold true.  It is a nice point and shoot with professional quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: Best alternative to a SLR
Reviews.Author: DRDDS
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer. I wanted to buy a compact camera which is easy to carry while travelling and yet gives me crisp quality pics. This is one of the best cameras I have had...The picture and video quality is the best amongst the compact cameras family in my opinion. However, if you are a MAC user, the software could be a problem for use. You cannot watch the HD videos recorded on ur laptop. In fact you cannot watch the HD recordings without installing the software...something i was not aware before buying the cam. I had a spare PC which I use for this purpose and once the software installed, the HD recordings were running great and were actually phenomenal....That is the only reason why i give it 3 stars in the software tab.Be sure to carry an extra battery and memory card.....coz battery goes down very fast and the memory card wil be full very fast with HD recordings....To save the battery power keep the GPS mode off...There is one turn off to this cam...that is the pictures taken at night.....they are not great...I had done a lot of research before pinning down to this cam( after reviewing Canons, Nikons, Sony) but trust me, You would not regret your decision with this cam.I would still highly recommend this cam.

Reviews.Title: A great pocket size camera with BIG zoom!
Reviews.Author: W. Raffel
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera. Well, it is actually over 8 months old now and I have take over 3,000 photos and over 250 videos. I love the results.In the past, I would carry a much bigger camera with me when I traveled, but I wanted to down size. With the state of technology today, I was able to down size, without a big sacrifice in quality of the photo! I do not make large prints of my photos, so a very slight amount of distortion of the image at max zoom, does not both me. I use the camera to take photos and videos that I assemble into travel photoshow DVDs. The photoshow DVDs capture the true flavor of our trips and let me keep my memories for a lifetime! (If you wish to see a sample of the work I do with this camera... [...])I highly recommend this camera to an average photographer, or to a pro, that understands that this camera will not give you the quality of an SLR, but is a spectacular value for the money!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 - Awesome
Reviews.Author: Edwin J. Elefante "Elefantdude"
Reviews.Content: I have been a Canon fan my whole life. My last Canon was the PowerShot SD-790, which I am sure most of you know, is a GREAT camera. I have had the SD-790 camera for 3 years and I was ready for something new, so I can pass the Canon to one of my kids :-)  After lots of reviews and research, I decided on the Panasonic Lumix DMS-ZS7.  I hope that I save you the time of doing the research and reviews with my review here. It rated high for Picture Quality and Ease of Use from most of the reviews I have read. I consider myself an intermediate photographer, so I like playing around with manual settings on a camera. This Panasonic allows you to do that, so you can get creative with your pictures. If you like to just point and shoot, this camera performs that as well and I must say, it is easy. With this Panasonic, you can set custom settings and other camera modes, depending on the environment you are in. With the simple turn of a dial, you can have your saved custom setting come up quickly and you will be ready for action.  While playing around with my Panasonic settings, I discovered a FOOD setting, which I did not know it had. I love to take pictures of the food I ate at restaurants and post it on my Facebook account. I also like to BLOG with pictures of recipes I cook. So as you probably are thinking, I was VERY excited to find that setting on this camera! The 14X Optical Zoom is another awesome feature I like about this Panasonic camera. If you know cameras, the better the optical zoom range, as opposed to digital zoom, the better :-)  If any of you already own Panasonic Digital Cameras, you probably are aware how nice these cameras are. I would rate this one up with the Canons and Nikons, for point and shoot cameras.  :-)

Reviews.Title: One of the Best point & shoot cameras available
Reviews.Author: tgarners3
Reviews.Content: We're still learning to use all the features of this camera but, overall, are very impressed with its performance.  The picture quality is amazing for a camera of this size and price!  I've been using point & shoot cameras for 15 years and this is the best so far!

Reviews.Title: Great close up shots
Reviews.Author: Peggy E. Hill
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Really captures close ups. Great in most lighting. Perfect to capture pictures of my new grand baby.

Reviews.Title: Great Point And Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Rick Shehorn "RLS"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 is a very capable camera with a high quality wide angle to 12X zoom lens.  It has excellent features and numerous fun and useful mode settings. The pinhole and the film grain effects are two of my favorites. It should be noted that these special effects can also be applied to the full HD video also.  The video recording utilizes full time auto focus and you have full use of the cameras optical zoom, this with the great image stabilizer makes for excellent video quality. There is a full range of manual settings on this camera as well, however, for some reason they did not include manual focus. For the person who is not all that up on how to make custom camera settings/adjustments, the Intelligent Auto setting makes using this camera a breeze... There are some quite advanced capabilities in this mode that are beyond the scope of this review to expound upon. let it suffice to say that it really does an excellent job of analyzing the environment you are taking the picture in and making the appropriate setting adjustments so your pictures turn out looking great. The built in GPS is useful for tagging the location of your picture for future reference. The only real negative issue I have with this camera is the small size of the image sensor. As with many cameras in this category, the small sensor does not lend itself to the best low light photography. In low light situations, you will notice some digital noise in the picture. However, in normal light this camera has excellent photo quality. I have been using this camera for a couple months now when I don't want to lug around my other equipment. I am quite happy with the on the fly performance. For the money, it is a great buy! Check out this review at Cameralabs on this camera:  [...]

Reviews.Title: It produces nice pictures under good lighting conditions
Reviews.Author: Sushi Chef "Tad"
Reviews.Content: ZS7 gives me more than what I expect from ~$200 camera. It is an excellent camera for taking casual outdoor snapshots while I travel. It is small and light enough for carrying anywhere all day. The intelligent automatic features works well in many occasions I encounter while I travel. The GPS works as advertised. If I use it under a good condition and give it ample time to catch up, it is very accurate. It is so much fun, because it tells me the name of a landmark that I am shooting at (even if I don't know what I am looking at...). I'm sure I will appreciate even more in 5 yeas when I forget what I shot. Automatic time zone adjustment is a subtle but nice bonus that comes with the GPS. To me the battery is ok, but naturally the GPS uses power and that is something you need to pay attention. I cannot do without a spare battery on any camera anyway.Like any other camera, the camera doesn't give everything I want under all conditions. ZS7 does not give me a good pictures under poor lighting conditions. That is a fact, and you should know before you buy it - either accept the fact or look for something else. I am not complaining about it at all though, because I am quite happy with my ZS7. I just use one of other cameras when I know I want to take nice pictures under poor lighting conditions.

Reviews.Title: Great camera....horrible manual
Reviews.Author: Bsl
Reviews.Content: I rated ease of use for ONE REASON!!!!!!!!  The use manual comes only on a DVD.  Many people do nor use a computer!  It is very  difficult to depend on a computer to find use directions.  One can print them off but in large sheets.  A small booklet much more convient.  I can buy a manual in hard print for $45,00'. I just  paid hundreds for their camera.My husband's new Cannon came with two hard copy manual...one English and one Spanish.

Reviews.Title: Best value out there
Reviews.Author: johnrg
Reviews.Content: With so many cameras available in this class, making a choice was tough. After spending some time on the web, finally decided on this Lumix.Besides a great 3" screen which makes composition much easier, the quality of the photos is nothing less than impressive. Unlike so many similiar cameras, the controls on the Lumix are simple and clear....bordering on the intuitive. Oh, yes. The battery lasts and lasts before requiring recharging. Actually, I bought a couple of extra just to have on hand. Probably didn't need to do it. Transferring to photos to my MacBook Pro is a breeze via USB. By the way, use the LumixPanasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Blue) in our business and have started do photography ourselves instead of hiring a photographer. Am still not sure how they've packed so much in for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera packed with capabilities
Reviews.Author: J. L. Pitts
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional but I have used cameras for over 40 years graduating to digital with a good little Canon point and shoot years ago.  I just passed along my Sony Cybershot to my son as he needed an upgrade.  I prowled over the Amazon site thinking I would get an Canon or Sony but I was won over by the write ups on the Panasonic.  It is not a DSLR so you need to set your expectations as such but having said that you will find this camera stunning.  It is really a camcorder in disguise.  The video capability is really impressive, one button pushing but you have enormous control over the recording capability.  I really like the quick startup, the battery life is adequate, if you have a rechargeable battery you need to get a back up regardless of the battery life so just step up and get one.  This is a very easy to use camera for a novice and a professional/enthusiast will have plenty of control to boot.  The 12X optical zoom is simply awesome.  With 12 megapixel it is hard to imagine needing anything more.  The macro close up capability is very impressive.  You do need to read the instructions because it has so much capability but you could just leave it on Ia mode and you will be happy with terrific pictures.  The big LCD screen is sharp, it can be difficult in real bright sunlight but the trade off of small compact size is worth the trade off. This thing really does fit in your shirt pocket if you want to carry it like that.  Get it and you won't be sorry, it is awesome.  The Leica lens is a huge advantage up against any other camera, you don't have to take a backseat to any other camera. The 25 mm wide angle is everything you could ask for.  John

Reviews.Title: Don't look any further - GET THIS ONE
Reviews.Author: Merlin "Merlin (BPZ, MD)"
Reviews.Content: I've been, and am, a Canon user (currently have the EOS 7D), and have gotten Canon pocket cameras for ALL my kids, but was recently looking for a new son-in-law gift, and he desperately needed a camera upgrade.  After doing my homework for a week or so, settled on this one, and when opened on Christmas, was BLOWN AWAY by the build quality and the feature set.  Superb point and shoot image quality, great video, unmatched zoom, f3.3-4.9 Leica lens, and the features just never seem to stop.  The photos are also automatically geotagged with GPS location, and videos are sharp and clear.  AND - it FITS in your pocket.  You CANNOT beat this for value, IMHO.  Recipient is thrilled - and has spent an inordinate portion of his life taking photos with his new camera.

Reviews.Title: Little Red Camera
Reviews.Author: The Wizard
Reviews.Content: So many settings but when set right, it takes great pics. I found no problem in low light as long as the white setting was done first.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: shutterbug
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas and it proved to be fantastic at our gift opening.  I captured all kinds of shots that I previously would have missed.  I am not very technical and this  camera  is easy to point and shoot.  The instruction disk is extremely helpful.  I have not uses the video as yet; but if it works as well as the still pictures it should be excellent.  It is small and light and easily fits into a pocket or purse.  The battery life seems long.  There are enough pixels for large prints; which is one reason we bought it. I would recommend it to anyone.  Great quality pictures that capture lots of depth and color.

Reviews.Title: The Daddy of Compact Travel Zooms (4.5 / 5)
Reviews.Author: Sacha Potter
Reviews.Content: I've owned a Panasonic TZ3 since 2007 and while it has held up well, it was starting to show it's age.  I was looking at the ZS7, Sony HX5V, Samsung HZ30W, and Canon SX210.  I decided to replace it with the ZS7 based on online reviews and my past experience with the TZ3.  Here are my impressions so far.What's Good:-Solid build quality (but does not feel as solid as my old TZ3)-Attractive design-Compact enough to carry in a pocket or purse-Easy to use menus and controls-Great zoom range-25mm wide lens-Good movie quality with stereo sound-Auto display brightness-Good bright light performance-Manual controls-Control over some in-camera processing like sharpness and saturation-Q-menu is useful-GPS can be turned off completely-Dedicated video record buttonWhat Needs Improvement:-On screen display information seems large and clunky-Exposure and video record buttons are a little small for frequent use buttons-No mini HDMI - HDMI adapter included-Only average battery life-Typical low-light performance from a small sensorWishes For The Next Version:-RAW file format option-Larger sensor for better low-light performance-Higher res screen-Rubberized grip-A more modern looking interface-Faster lens-AVCHD software for Mac included (Voltaic HD is a good payed version though)So far I am very happy with the camera, it does well in the areas that count.  While it certainly has some nice new touches over my old TZ3, it is not a revolutionary product.  But why mess with a good thing right?I definitely recommend this camera for someone who needs a dependable camera that you can bring anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic camera
Reviews.Author: Progers
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I have heard such good things about the quality of pictures.  You cannot find a camera in this price range that will beat the DMC ZS7. I have only had the camera 2 months but have put it through the pace and have found nothing I do not like... It is very extremely complicated camera.... but easy to point and shoot and if you want more ..... it is available

Reviews.Title: Best Compact Camera, Ever!
Reviews.Author: ALL THAT AND ZENSOME
Reviews.Content: I researched all kinds of cameras and finally ordered the ZS7 based  on the major reviews here on Amazon. I have not regretted my purchase. The pictures are fantastic . I have no issues with low light as some reviewers have commented on. All my friends after playing with my camera agree that it is the best. Highly recommend the ZS7.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Point And Shoot
Reviews.Author: Kenneth E. Epperson "Kenneth E. Epperson"
Reviews.Content: not only is this the very best point and shoot I have owned it rivals a lot of DSLRS for picture quality, the high definition video is fantastic and it will fit in your jeans pocket! If that is what you are looking for  - look no further - Ken Of Gulf Shores

Reviews.Title: What a camera for the price!!!!
Reviews.Author: MTP
Reviews.Content: I paid $250, and it is a great value for the quality that you get.Fast focus even in the dark, great zoom and the auto function, usually I hate them, I love in this camera.Videos are good too, but I do not like where is the button, I pressed it so frequently.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a novice
Reviews.Author: Charles "Chuck"
Reviews.Content: I am not a photo expert so please know that this review comes from a novice.  The camera delivers wonderful pictures and has impressed with its zoom.  It is a fairly rugged product and has given us issue-free performance.  I have had some issues trying to figure out the GPS function, but the issue is likely due to my ignorance of the feature.  A very good camera with great HD video.

Reviews.Title: Wow!  12x zoom, pocket size, and way better picture quality than the $350 Sony I got last year!
Reviews.Author: ksatellite
Reviews.Content: Due to hand tremors, my parents' pictures always came out blurry, when using other cameras.  Power image stabilization on this camera fixed that problem.I have a much larger, older Panasonic with 12x zoom, and previous image stabilization technology (which was still very good).  I've always been amazed by its image quality and color, but hated carrying a big camera.  I've tried many pocket sized cameras, including a top rated Sony, but picture quality suffered (relative to my Panasonic).  This camera may be the best of both worlds...if only it had a swivel screen like my big camera.  Read experts' reviews.  Panasonic's new power image stabilization and compact super zoom put it in a class by itself.  You won't find another camera this small with a 12x zoom.  Even a 5x or 8x zoom is worthless without excellent image stabilization.

Reviews.Title: Second Panasonic Lumix!  Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Tom Jr
Reviews.Content: These cameras are awesome!This is my second Lumix - both blue :)  My first had the 10x zoom and 7.2 MP.  It just got better with the 12x a and 12.1 MP.  Great screen.  Light enough that I carry it on my belt everyday.My Lumix cameras have been to Kuwait, Iraq, Germany, and all over the US.  Marvelous shots!Love it so much I  bought the same camera for my mom -- but red :)Absolutely terric camera!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera overall for the price of $250
Reviews.Author: JC "none"
Reviews.Content: the camera is good. the IA function is nice. Like others say, it could do much better in low lighting situations. the picture in low light is good only if you use a tripod (or similar) and the timer. when travelling is not always possible to find a flat spot to put the camera. You can also play with different knobs for low lighting. everything else seems to be really good so far. Overall a good camera

Reviews.Title: ZOOM Baby!
Reviews.Author: J. Hall "Eddie"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it is my 3rd Panasonic camera in 5 years.  I sold my first panasonic camera which was a dmc-fx 9 because I upgraded to the fx-10, then I lost the fx-10 but I was looking to upgrade anyways.  During my research I wanted everything my fx-10 could do but have a much better optical zoom than 4x, this camera has some sort of intelligent zoom which is 16X to 24X. With my old camera the zoom was horrible, I attended some events in the past and all the zoomed pictures were horrible and I had to delete the pictures.  With this camera I stood at ground level at the beach and was able to max out the zoom to see and take a great picture of my wife on a 10th floor balcony waving, the I captured her from head to toe.  Picture quality is great, the recording in HD is excellent, ease of use no problem for me the functions are set up like my old fx-9, and fx-10.  I feel certain if this camera is not damaged or lost I will be good for at least 3 years before seeing the new bells and whistle.  If I did not have a young family or take pictures every week this would be a very long term camera.  My past two cameras were silver but this BLUE looks great.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: Jman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased the camara before the birth of our child. One of our friends had this model and gave a great review on it. She really enjoyed the GPS as she went on a trip to Europe and found that feature very helpful. We have only been using the camara for a few weeks, but are happy with the camara overall. The large display screen is very nice and the zoom works well. Pictures have looked very good on the display screen. Over time, as we become more verse with the camara, I believe we will enjoy it even more.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Harold R.
Reviews.Content: Who needs a big camera when you can have all this capability in such a small package.

Reviews.Title: Nothing to dislike!
Reviews.Author: MTBmofo
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Prior to purchasing this Camera I had the ZS3 which I absolutely loved. Fortunately/Unfortunately I lost that camera last spring. Once I had the budget to replace it i began shopping for it all over again which is when I discovered the ZS7. The ZS7 has all of the features that I wished my ZS3 had had including a Manual exposure option to help improve the creativity and range of the device. I'm also enjoying the GPS feature. Something that I hadn't really been aware of when I made my purchase but nice nonetheless. I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants something above a basic point and shoot but doesn't have the budget or inclination to buy and SLR. This is the one point and shoot camera that really can do everything you want! Enjoy your purchase.

Reviews.Title: good all-round point and shoot
Reviews.Author: dragon lady
Reviews.Content: Needed to upgrade a first generation digital camera, wanted something I could just pick up and start taking decent quality pictures with. This fits the bill nicely, fits easily in a pocket, the battery and card stay clean and secure in an accessible compartment. The color, clarity and overall picture quality exceeds my expectations as does the zoom lens. Sometimes the face recognition feature focuses on the wrong point in the photo but am certain if I actually sat down and read the manual, that problem could be addressed. After much consideration, reading reviews and examining what's available, consider this a winner.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic ZS7
Reviews.Author: rsmithedmond
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use during vacation.  It replaced a Panasonic TZ4.  There is no cpmparison between the two cameras.  Almost all photos were taken using the Auto setting.  Still photos were sharp and detailed.  The videos were excellent!  The camera evens zooms while taking video!  I took pictures in low light, bright light on the beach, and everything in between.  A video of fireworks on the beach came out great!  I can't say enough good things about this camera.  I have a Nikon D40x and the pictures from the Pansonic a very close to the same quality.  I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool!!
Reviews.Author: G. SCHEELER
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera prior to taking an Alaskan cruise.  Needed a new camera that had high resolution, was fast, and small in size.  This camera does it all!I've been very happy with the quality of the photos...  I especially like the built in GPS (although it does take a bit of time for the camera to figure out where it is sometimes).  It's great posting my pictures using Google's Picasa and having the map showing right where I took the picture.  This is especially handy for scenery shots.The HD video is also quite good.  I was amazed at the quality!Overall, this is a good camera.  A good combination of form, function, and features.

Reviews.Title: Takes AMAZING photos
Reviews.Author: D. Hancock
Reviews.Content: I had the previous version of this camera but my LCD screen shattered on the inside after just 6 months and it is not warrantied.  I baby my cameras and always keep them in a case, so I'm not sure how it could have even happened. I was NOT happy that my $379 camera needed a $160 new screen after just 6 months!  However, the camera took such amazing photos, I bought this new version anyway.  LOVE IT!  Everyone comments on what great photos it takes, so hopefully my screen will last years this time.

Reviews.Title: A Solid Camera
Reviews.Author: Maxwell
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product because I'm expecting my first child! I needed something that would take high quality photos and also HD video. This camera does both of these well. However, out of the box you might be dissapointed if you try getting great shots right off the bat. You need to practice using this (and every other camera you will buy). The camera will not make you a good photographer. Get to know the settings inside and out before passing judgement. Once you learn this camera (which really isn't hard) you will be pleased. This is my first digital camera and it was purchased with a lot of research and much consideration from all angles. If money wasn't a factor I would have gone with the Panasonic FZ100. Just couldn't justify the cost and for my purposes, the convenience of having a compact camera with a 12x optical zoom was better than having the megazoom and bulkier camera of the FZ100.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Gabi
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son, and he LOVES it!  He and his wife just had a new baby and he was able to take pictures and videos and can't stop saying how much he loves the camera.

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal point and shoot
Reviews.Author: K. Strode "kendrizzle"
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching cameras before making this purchase.  I have many friends who are independent photographers who swear by their digital SLRs, but I needed a camera that was more compact to be my primary travel camera - meant primarily to capture memories and events.  However, I did love the quality of the SLR photos and hoped to find a camera that could approximate that.This camera is absolutely phenomenal and consistently surprises me with the photos it takes.  In situations such as high speed or low light this point and shoot out performs the Canon I previously had by a long shot.  For more controlled settings, the images are crisp, and well focused.  The color it can capture is rich and more true to life than any other point and shoot I've ever used or seen - sunsets on this camera actually show up with the rich oranges, pinks and purples.  The video also works quite well - I went to a concert and was able to zoom all the way to the stage which was quite a ways away and get a really decent video of the performance - even with the strange lighting and noticeable distance.There are a few button layouts that aren't immediately intuitive, but can be figured out with a bit of tinkering and experimenting.  The special scene settings, again, work WAY better than any I've used in the past.  The general intelligent auto setting is actually quite intelligent - from macro to portrait to landscape it usually identifies the scene correctly, and within a couple attempts I've been able to get the exact shot I was trying for.I had been certain I would purchase a Nikon or a Canon, but I was impressed by the photos others shared, taken by this camera and can pleasantly report that it requires no skill or special knowledge to take similar photos.3 October 2011 -I STILL love this camera.  It is a great size, has excellent battery life, takes great snapshots, usable video.  It is by no means professional photography quality, but for a small, affordable point and shoot, it has exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: A good choice for a multi-purpose camera
Reviews.Author: Bob Allen "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Although the wide range of settable options may make the operation of this camera appear complicated, the intelligent automatic setting works very well, making manual settings unnecessary in most circumstances.  With automatic "point and shoot" mode, it usually takes fantastic, sharp shots.  The zoom range is great, and it takes good videos, with zoom.  The screen is large and bright, except in sunlight.  Cons:  I guess no camera can be perfect or be all things.  This one's main shortcoming is its lack of a viewfinder, which makes it a multi-purpose, not an all-purpose, camera.  I made the mistake of taking mine to an air show.  Even with the screen brightness on high, I could see absolutely nothing in it in the bright sun.  It took excellent pictures if I happened to aim it in the right direction, but forget taking video of moving objects.  I erased a lot of pictures of nothing.  A few other weaknesses:  Buttons are very small.  There is no manual focus.  It rarely happens that the camera doesn't focus better than can be done manually, but it can happen.  The camera is heavy for its size.  I wonder if plastic is really all that bad.  It certainly would be lighter.  It does have a good grip/feel, though.  The wide angle does produce some "fish eye" effect, especially noticeable in panning video or with buildings in the picture.  Unfortunately, there is no indication of "normal," and if you change the zoom, it returns to wide angle if you turn it off and back on.  There is only a brief printed manual; the main manual is on the disk in PDF format.  It would be a book if printed (177 pages).  As with most all compact cameras, the flash is not powerful, but you could always use a slave flash.  Except for 5-second clips with pictures, it will not record sound without video, nor can you add sound to pictures after taking them.  Overall, the cons are minor annoyances I can live with to get the beautiful pictures and movies it takes.  It certainly has more capabilities than I will ever use.  I may find a few other picky things as I use it, but I would for sure recommend this camera to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Reader Mom
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful camera & very easy to use.  The pictures are startling clear & bright.  Lots of features I've begun to tap into, but easy to figure out.  The video comes out nicely too.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-7S7
Reviews.Author: Benny
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a Canon Powershot SD770 IS which I used for several years of European travel. Although the Canon was OK it was not great. The pictures were adequate but the zoom was not. I have used the Panasonic for about 6 weeks and am impressed by the quality of the camera, the pictures, and especially the zoom. Have not had an opportunity to use the GPS yet, but will be in Hungary shortly and it will be used there. As an amateur and mostly a point and shooter, I would recommend the product and for more experienced photographers, there should be enough bells and whistle to keep you happy.

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera I have used (ZS3)
Reviews.Author: Balaji
Reviews.Content: I have had Sonys and  Canons before, and was hesitant to purchase ZS3 (which was the earlier model of ZS7), as I did not have much experience with Panasonic products. My friend suggested this camera to me, saying it had good reviews. I did a bit of research and compared it with Canon SX110IS and similar Sony models. Everything was almost the same except for two important things (at least for me).First was that ZS3 had a very good macro mode (it is like a microscope built in a telescope!). Second was that it was a Japanese product with great outer frame (not made of cheap plastics).I went ahead and bought it. For one month I was wondering if I made the right decision. But when I took photos of the snow flakes (yes, an individual snow flake 1/20 of size of a quarter), I realized the power of this camera and never doubted it again.My friends are often amazed by the clarity of photos I get from this one, and often ask me whether I use an SLR. I have uploaded the picture of the snow flake here, have a look and decide for yourself.Pros of this camera:1) Advanced macro zoom (see the snow flake pic)2) High optical zoom3) Great outer metal frame4) Very compact5) HD video is a bonus.Cons:Uses proprietary battery (not the normal AAs).

Reviews.Title: A great camera
Reviews.Author: L. Schatzer
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing piece of technology. Not only does it take great pictures but the onboard GPS tags the location including not just the longitude and latitude but the actual name of the location. The 12X zoom is excellent and the image stabilization seems to work extremely well, even in video mode. The HD (720p)video looks excellent. There are tons of features and full manual control too. The intelligent auto mode works exceptionally well even with difficult lighting situations. For the most part you can just leave the camera in auto and shoot. But the are the P,A,S,M modes if you want to get more creative or are in difficult lighting situations that IA cannot deal with properly.All of this is packed into a pocket-able device so it is perfect for vacations and family events. The most important thing however is the quality of the photos and they are very good to excellent with this camera. The 25mm wide to 300mm tele lens range is very useful, especially the wide end.There are tons of features included with this camera so make sure to read the supplied PDF manual to get the most out of it. My only complaint is I wish there were a printed version of the full manual instead of just a PDF. Otherwise, this camera is a real winner.

Reviews.Title: Lumix is great
Reviews.Author: Raen Dear "Japan-o-phile"
Reviews.Content: So far we are happy with this product.  It arrived promptly and the pictures are excellent.  Downloading to iphoto works flawlessly.  Nice size.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC ZS7
Reviews.Author: Newman
Reviews.Content: After an extensive evaluation based on both professional and consumer opinion of this camera along with other similar cameras, I determined this camera was best for me.Some of the things that sold me:  Wide angle 24mm lens and it's telescopic range; stabilizing feature; 3.0 inch LCD screen; panoramic capability and camera weight; were among some of the key features that impressed me.So far, I've been very pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-ZS7, a great camera for the casual photographer
Reviews.Author: Father Dale
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera. As a mediocre (at best) photographer, I find that it consistently takes the shot I wanted, and often makes me look better than I am. The internal GPS is fun, since I travel a bit. The shots I took at the Great Pyramid in Giza are nothing short of astonishing. Not only would I buy it again, but when it gets old, I'll buy its successor.Pro: Great photographs, great zoom (12x optical), small enough to carry in a belt holster. Almost no shutter lag.Con: Battery life and charging options could be better. I would like a second battery, but I can't find them anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: jmb386
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  it does everything automatically or you can set all the manual parmeters.  I bought it and took it on a trip to Italy.  Worked excellent as a point-and-shoot. Produced very sharp pictures, even on max zoom.  Battery lasted about 1 day, or 450-500 pictures (no videos), so I charged the battery every night and used the spare batteries (I had brought 2 extra), as needed on longer days.  I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Tourist's Point of View
Reviews.Author: Red Rice
Reviews.Content: Cons:Enclosed CD did not work on my computer.Display difficult to see in bright light.Time to take picture after pushing button is too long, often causing loss of shot.Recovery time needed to take next picture in low light is too long.GPS did not work in several situations. (This function was not a selling point for me.)Battery life could be longer.  Be sure to purchase additonal battery.Internal memory is very low.  SDHC card very handy, holds lots of photos.Pros:Picture quality was great, even in low light.Automatic setting was great for majority of photos.So nice to have the wide angle to telephoto capability and range with no additional lenses needed.Close ups of flowers, insects, etc. ok.Plenty of settings to customize for special situations, if desired.

Reviews.Title: GPS not worth it
Reviews.Author: R. Slate
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera specifically because of its GPS functionality. My cell phone tags photos with the GPS coordinates, so I wanted the same functionality with a better camera. However, the GPS only updates every 5 minutes -- and only if it can find a satellite, which it usually cannot (like in most buildings).The result is that most photos are completely mis-tagged because it uses the last available GPS location for its tagging. My cell phone, amazingly, is orders of magnitude more accurate because it is able to locate a satellite very easily (even in buildings, like your house), and if it can't locate one, it doesn't tag the photo with incorrect information. That makes the coordinates basically worthless. The pictures are just fine, but if you're buying this for the GPS, my advice is not to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Best Lumix yet
Reviews.Author: Sheri
Reviews.Content: This is my third Lumix point-and-shoot, all have been great, largely because of the excellent Leica lens.  The optical zoom is what attracted me initially, my previous Kodak used a digital zoom but that degraded image quality - FAST.  I use this for a variety of photos, including video shooting in-doors and have been generally very pleased, the camera is able to auto-focus even in low light conditions and the video images remain crisp, not grainy like other cameras I've used.  I took it to Beijing last month and the GPS never refreshed, despite repeated attempts around the city.  I had to tag the photos once I returned to the States.  Otherwise I've had no problems with the GPS feature - which I really like since I maintain my library in iPhoto.  My only complaint is that the 2 previous Lumix cameras came with a basic case - something they dropped with this model.

Reviews.Title: New User to point and shoot
Reviews.Author: OCSan
Reviews.Content: This is PERFECT - Loaded with features and I appreciate the ability to manually chose my settings.  I am really happy with this little camera.  I "downgraded" and sold my older Nikon D70 for this camera because I can no longer carry the weight of the bigger DSLR and was not using it anymore.  This camera got great reviews and I didn't want to spend "too much" on my first point and shoot.  It is comfortable and "holds" well.  The controls are easy to understand and initial set up was easy. The GPS feature is really cool but eats battery life.  No surprises there, because Panasonic warns you of that, but the menu navigation is easy and so it's easy to turn that feature off when it isn't needed.  I wanted something small enough to carry easily all the time and I do.  I take this with me everywhere!  I was really convinced that I would not be able to photograph the compositions I saw, but it really captured what I was after.  The first photo shoot with this camera was at Mesa Verde in January.  I got great photos even though the lighting conditions were somewhat harsh (as in compositions with full sun behind ice and snow crystals). The color is true to what I see and the macro features are astounding.  I could not get the same photos on my DSLR without spending big bucks for additional lenses.  Buy this if you are in the market!  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: beas62
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something that would give reasonable results in those social or travel situations that made 3-5 pounds of DSLR equipment too cumbersome.  After a lot of research I chose the ZS7 with hopes that it would provide good bang for the buck in terms of usability and image quality.I found it to be relatively easy to use after a couple of hours walking through all the features and settings.  The metal body has a solid feel and despite it's size, it's not hard to handle.  I did find myself wishing that it had some rubber in the grip area, as the all metal and chrome body can become slippery.The number of options may seem daunting at first, but it didn't take long to figure out the shooting modes I would use regularly.  I noted that the "intelligent Auto" modes make it easy for a beginner to get good results with little fuss, but it was really the manual and priority modes that I found most useful.  Anyone comfortable with a DSLR should find the additional controls a welcome addition to a P&S.;  I found I could get superior results by working in the PSAM modes, primarily because I could keep the camera working in it's sweet spots as far as ISO sensitivity, aperture and shutter speed goes.Despite such a small package, the controls are easy to reach and don't interfere with shooting.  In shooting mode, the cursor buttons provide quick shortcuts to some features, like flash mode, macro modes and self timer, but I was surprised that these features were nowhere to be found in the GUI menu.I'm getting good to very good results in image quality at full resolution up to ISO 400.  ISO 800 will work fine for small prints, and ISO 1600 may be usable for web and downsized prints.  At ISO 1600, besides being grainy, I get significant color noise (mostly dull yellow blotches) throughout.  With the exception of the noise at higher ISO settings, the images seem clear and fairly distortion free throughout the zoom range.The 25-300 zoom range is very usable especially considing a package that slips easily in my front shirt pocket.  The image stablization is a must for long shots, and seems to do a very good job of reducing motion blur.  I was surprised that I could take photos at around 1/30 of a second without noticeable shake.I'm very please so far with the versatility and performance of this little camera.  It'll never take the place of my DSLRs where image quality or speed is critical, but for it's intended use, it more than meets my expections.

Reviews.Title: For its size and features, this camera is awesome
Reviews.Author: williaa
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking at the various cameras in this class, but ultimately had to settle on this one for its combination of features, picture quality, and ergonomics.  Having used the camera for a little over a month so far, it lives up to expectations.The zoom is incredible and does not diminish picture quality.  Scenes can be useful, but intelligent auto usually pics appropriate settings.  It is very easy to just turn on, leave in auto mode, and snap good pictures.  Works great with a 16GB SD card.  Camera can be controlled (for viewing pictures only) via HDMI and a TV remote.  The menu system on the camera works great once you get used to it.Picture quality is good for this kind of camera.  To my knowledge, all pocket superzoom cameras with high megapixel sensors suffer from noise.  In good light noise is only visible if you zoom into the image.  In dim light quality definitely suffers, but the images are still acceptable, just not as sharp as you would get with a different kind of camera.Compared to my old 5MP Canon Powershot S50 which only had a 5MP sensor, the images are noticeably more noisy when viewed on a computer and zoomed in. Whereas the Canon's images were blurred at the same magnification level. Neither took exceptionally sharp images (when magnified.) The trade off with these high megapixel cameras seems to be more noise for less blurring, but again, picture quality in good/decent light is more than good enough for normal size prints or viewing on PC.Video quality is decent.  Certainly not anywhere near the same level as the professional HD video shot for TV or movies, but good enough for a non-specialized camera.I looked very hard at the Canon SX210 IS before purchasing this camera, but ultimately chose this one for its ergonomics and button placement.  Unlike the Canon, this camera is very easy to hold with just one hand (when not taking pictures...) and is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: I Do Lots of Research
Reviews.Author: Zupper "What's all the hub, bub?"
Reviews.Content: I'm a tech-savvy Realtor and my main camera needs are as follows:1. Easy, yet feature rich should I want to get creative2. 25mm wide angle lens3. Min 10x optic zoom w/ability to zoom video4. Image stabilization5. Mac Compatibility6. SD** memoryI narrowed it down and compared it to:Nikon Coolpix 8100Sony' Dsc-HX5vFuji Finepix F300EXRCanon PowerShot SX210 ISThe Lumix won. I love it! Perfect camera for me & shoots great video! No regrets!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 Review
Reviews.Author: Ralfk "Dahlia nut"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about three weeks ago, and I couldn't be happier with it. I was looking for a compact camera that had a good telephoto range. This has a 12X optical zoom, equivalent to around a 340mm telephoto lens, I think. It also has a very nice wide angle capability, around a 24mm equivalent. Also, I can get very close with the lens, so one half inch away, and photograph a piece of text from the newspaper, very clearly. This camera is a little on the heavy side, for it's small size, probably because of all the lenses in it. This camera takes great pictures in low light settings without the flash. The flash works very well, also. I've tried taking photos in challenging lighting situations, and almost every time the auto mode takes a good picture. There is a dizzying array of modes and manual options to set and fuss with in the user interface. I was able to figure out most of the features fairly easily. The included manual is pretty skimpy on all but the most basic operations. The online manual is pretty good, but certain features I had to really hunt for. Overall I am completely satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nicest camera I've owned yet.
Reviews.Author: T. Fisher "troytunes"
Reviews.Content: Nice picture and movie quality, good solid feel to the hardware, small size yet big screen, shake reduction actually works, on and on...great camera.

Reviews.Title: A Great HD Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: MinnieWinnie
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed and owned many panasonic camera's, for years mainly DMC lumix because of not only good pictures, but to me they were the first for small camera's to have the best video footages. My last camera before the DMC ZS7 was the DMC FX 100. I love the compact but yet powerful megapixels of camera, but did not like the fact you could not use zoom in & out while using video. The ZS7 is just a touch larger but has plenty of features to accomodate one who loves that portability & now High Definition in one. In my opinion the ZS7 camera stability while using video feature surpasses all other brands panasonic invented... believe me I no because I have had a lot of different panasonic camera's, that image stabalizing is what you need in any camera feature. The extra's that comes with camera are pretty impressive too. Great photo software, and camera uses AVCHD format. The GPS is a plus. I use this camera for when I want to take quick campact picture & videos in tight areas or conditions. I also use it along side of my Sony Camcorder for again quick shots. I made a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Nice features for its size
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: I'm totally satisfied in the Panasonic.  Many features, of course, that I'll never use but it's always ready for a pic regardless of the situation and that, for me, is a great attribute.  I like that I can adjust the f-stop or shutter speed for special shots and that I can adjust the shot after it's taken to correct some of my errors.  I did find the manual a bit too advanced in terminology for me and the manual's length is intimidating too.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures,HD Video and PhotoFun software
Reviews.Author: burt
Reviews.Content: I have owned many Canon cameras, S30,S80,SD990,SX20,SX200 and the SX210. I have found that the panasonic ZS7 has same high quality pictures as the canon SX210 camera. In addition the ZS7 has better HD video (AVCHD). Also the Photo Fun included software is Great as it alows instant burning of DVD's, HD AVCHD or MPEG2 discs. I highly recommend the Panasonic ZS7.

Reviews.Title: Better Pictures than ZS6
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: If you are can't decide between ZS6 and ZS7 read this review.I initially purchased the ZS6 from my local warehouse store as a gift to my wife as it seem to be identical with ZS7 without the GPS, AVCHD video and the extra custom and record button. We had the ZS6 for 2 months. The pictures were good especially the outdoor picture but I always wonder why the pictures is not as good as the samples uploaded by the ZS7 users here on Amazon. I was thinking that it maybe because of different setting and/or lighting condition compare to what I have.To make the story short, my father-in-law recently purchased a ZS7 and when I looked at the pictures it took, I immediately noticed that pictures are much clearer than the ZS6. I took our camera out and shoot them both indoor and outdoor. Both camera uses the same settings 80% - 90% of the time but the pictures taken from ZS7 is always clearer than the ZS6 we have. He said that he purchased it from Fry's for a little over $300.00. Since our local warehouse have a 90 day return policy, I asked my wife if she wanted to change it, she said why not check their display first and compare the pictures to see if the problem is just with the unit I got. I went to our local warehouse and to compare the quality of my ZS6 to the one in their display and they are identical plus I noticed that the price went down by $60 dollars. So, I looked around and I found this on Amazon for $249 (as of Oct. 2010) with free shipping and no tax. I placed my order and once I received the package, I charged the battery and compare it again to our ZS6. The new ZS7 pictures still shows up clearer. I updated the firmware of the ZS6 to the latest 1.1 and compare them again but the ZS7 pictures still looks sharper both in the camera LCD and on my 24 inches monitor.I packaged the ZS6 back and returned it to my local warehouse 2 days ago. I have to buy a new case and memory as the regular retail package does not come with a case and a memory but I know that I am now getting a better picture compare to the discounted product I got from my local warehouse.  Also, I turned off the GPS to make it last longer, I will probably used it when we go on vacation.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS7 is the best compact non-SLR camera I have used.
Reviews.Author: John M. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera (Panasonic DMC-ZS7) after extensive research on the internet and in a local camera store.  I have had 3 different Canon camera's over the years, the most recent being the SD890is and have loved all of them for the time.  The feature that we liked on the SD890is was the longer than normal 5x optical zoom.  The only problem was that the shot to shot speed was slow.  So when this camera broke, we searched for an alternative.  We scrubbed our search down to the Panasonic and the Canon SX210is.  Based on reviews of the pop up flash on the canon and a slower shot to shot speed we went with the Panasonic.  This was a tough choice considering I know Canon cameras (quality is great etc) and had not heard much from others on Panasonic.On to the review:Right out of the box, this camera is easy to use.  It has a fantastic 12x optical zoom and incredible quality in the finished picture.  The Intelligent Auto is very quick to determine the appropriate scene and adjust settings accordingly.  There is even a cool tagging feature that allows you to register frequently shot individuals.  At that point the camera recognizes the face and puts the primary focus on them and also uses this tag in the software on the computer so you can sort by person if you would like.  The menus are extensive, although many of the maual controls such as balance, shutter speed etc are way beyond my understanding.In a snapshot:This camera offers the best possible zoom, picture quality and speed of a non-SLR (Big lense) camera.  I would absolutely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera with great HD video recording
Reviews.Author: Brian A.
Reviews.Content: I haven't used my new camera extensively yet, but I'm loving it.  The day after purchasing I used it with a tripod to record a 1 hour training session at work.  The battery only went down 1 notch.  It will record video as long as the battery hasn't ran out and there is enough storage on the card.  I wish it had the option to plug it in and run video, but as that isn't this camera's primary purpose, I can't complain about it.I picked up 2 spare batteries for an awesome price (knock off brands) and they work fine, despite having read that Panasonic had limited use of off brand batteries.  2 Pack of Panasonic DMW-BCG10 Replacement Batteries 1200MAH Each For Panasonic Lumiz DMC-ZS5 DMC-ZS7 + Free Pack Of LCD Screen ProtectorsThe quality is great.  The camera menu system took sometime to understand and it uses a lot of acronyms that I can't find the meaning of for quality sizes, but looking at storage availability increasing/decreasing told me which setting was higher/lower quality.  The Q. Menu (quick?) button is the lifesaver for the menu.  It makes it really easy to change the most important settings without going into the full menu system.  I also like the exposure button for the manual setting as it makes changes to the shutter and aperture settings very easy (easier than my Nikon D60!).It is not necessarily a small pocket camera, but it will fit easily into most pockets.  But as the bulk is for the great zoom length and the optics, it is fine by me as I want an easily portable camera that takes high quality pictures.I haven't had a chance to try the GPS geotagging yet, but as this is going with me on a week long backcountry kayaking/hiking trip (hence the 3 total batteries), it will get some use.I would recommend only that you watch for deals that keep this well under MSRP as it is listed elsewhere for way too much (Amazon rocks for this), they are out there and it's not worth overpaying for any product.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: David L. Earnest "fido72"
Reviews.Content: My wife bought me this camera for fathers day. This is the largest mega pixel camera I have owned, my last being a 7 a couple years ago and was lost or misplaced before I got real use of it. I have been using a film SLR camera which I loved, but having the convenience of previewing pictures before a moment was lost was greatly missed.  My wife did  a lot of research before buying this camera for me, and although I have seen where people are talking about the fancy lens and all, I can't comment on it other than it takes great pictures. I don't understand all the settings, but I am learning and until then the auto AI is awesome, love this camera. If you want SLR type features, but not the bulk, this is the camera for you, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Best little camera in the world
Reviews.Author: wddjr
Reviews.Content: This camera operates exactly as advertised.  It has a sharp focusing 12X zoom lens that also does a reasonable wide angle shot. The image stabilization allows you to get some great hand held telephoto shots with little or no preparation.  The 3.0 inch LCD is vivid and bright.  Coupled with the magnification feature it is easy to know how well the shot was focused.The video is awesome!  I do not think of myself as a videographer, but the camera makes me look like one.  I am more than pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: My first Lumix and I recommend it!
Reviews.Author: Bsmart
Reviews.Content: I've been using this camera for about 3 months and so far I'm happy with the images.The size is bigger that what I expected, but I found a camera case that is just perfect for this camera from Case Logic.Overall, this camera is an excellent point and shoot camera for advance users.PROS:-You can use manual settings and usually the results will be better than the auto mode.-The 12x zoom is very useful if you like to take pictures from a long distance.-Great video quality-Very nice design and easy to grip.And here are few things that I wish this camera can improve:-There is no view finder for this camera.It's hard to see the LCD under bright sun.-I noticed quite obvious barrel distortion on some of my pictures.-Low light photo quality is bad.This is my first Panasonic camera, and I'm very impressed. I was thinking to buy Sony HX5V but I think this camera has a more reasonable price with more or less same image quality. Plus, you don't have to buy Sony's SD card(which is more expensive than regular SD card).

Reviews.Title: Excellent P&S;
Reviews.Author: Ananke
Reviews.Content: Pros:Sharp lensWide close, long zoomVery capable anti-shake systemIt does have iris for apertureMetal body, excellent build qualityFast auto focus, good meteringIt creates beautiful colorful jpegs on iAutoManual modes for whoever wants to useHigh resolution displayGPSThe flash is good for P&S;720p video in AVCHD is pretty good, on par with camcorders, which are more expensive then this camera itself...and many moreCons:proprietary batteryvideo has streaks /white lines/ upon bright light sources, because of the CCD sensormicrophone is not on par with camcorders, it picks up ambient noise, but it is fine for narrating a videonothing else major...This is a compact super zoom close to perfection. Considering that I paid at Amazon on sale less then for a moderate camera, the ZS7 is just perfect. It does have good iAuto, it creates beautiful pictures with excellent sharpness and colors. It has wide lens and anti-shake works just perfect even in video mode. Being a perfect camera, it happens to be excellent camcorder too, surpassing any standard definition camcorder, and on par with entry level HD camcorders. AVCHD is handy, you can burn AVCHD disks and play on SONY or Panasonic TVs and BD players straight. I can recommend a software called multiAVCHD for authoring, it is free. Or you can play just straight from a hard drive through a video streamer to HDTV, if you don't like burning optical media. I found a good camera bag to fit - CaseLogic DCB-26. It does fit perfectly and it has soft inner line.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: wide angle
Reviews.Content: I researched all brands for nine months before I bought this camera, I have been a canon user for 20 years.  I wanted a wide angle camera that will fit in my pocket and HD video.  This camera on the video will zoom in and out where the canon will not.  We went backpacking two weekends ago and the picures were awesome.  The camera was able to zoom in mountains and flowers at ease, the photos were crisp and awesome colors.  I would recommend this camera for all users.

Reviews.Title: Really like this camera
Reviews.Author: Charles A. Barone
Reviews.Content: I bought this after much research and choose the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 over the Canon SX210 IS based on several professional reviews. I am very pleased with this camera and am having fun learning all the features. Picture quality is very good and the zoom is fantastic with image stabilization that eliminates camera jitter even when zoomed all the way out. I don't use the GPS feature but it does work well. There is only a very brief getting started manual included with a more extensive 91 page manual supplied on disk. The latter is very complete but not always easy to figure out. I printed the relevant sections of the manual out which makes it easier to use. Likewise the menus on the camera will take some getting used to. The software which is a source of many complaints was completely useless for me because it is not compatible with Windows 7 64 bit operating system. It took a week to get a response from Panasonic clarifying this. There are other software alternatives as suggested in various forums. Thus far I am quite pleased with this camera and I like that it fits in my shirt or jean pocket.

Reviews.Title: Very good pocket camera
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: I have seen some long reviews on this thing, so read them if you want all the spec's. My old Sony Cyber shot had seen better days, and I needed something smaller than my Canon 20D, and all the lenses.Very pleased with the camera. Yes there is a learning curve if you want to use all the features ( GPS, different modes ). But overall, it takes really good pictures in the auto everything setting, it is weak in low light, but the flash is adequate.The zoom is amazing, optical goes to around 16X, but the digital zoom in different settings goes to something like 63X. With the stabilization it takes a good picture, there is distortion when enlarged, but I am impressed when you consider it is a $ 300 camera. Wide angle is not bad either.I purchased a few 4gb SD chips, each holds 600 - 700 pictures in the best resolution setting, battery lasts a good lenght of time ( always buy an extra though ). Have not done too much video but the picture was good, zoom is slower ( but not bad ) and sound is clear.Overall, I am impressed with the camera technology, 12MP on this size camera is pretty good, controls are easy to use. It is my first camera without a viewfinder, but the LED screen is large and bright even in sunlight, so it was not hard to get use to. For any level photographer it is a fun little camera, more than enough for someone getting started, especially if it is more for kids parties, and vacations. Can not really point out any bad points when one considers the type of camera this is.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't Disappointed
Reviews.Author: laptophobo
Reviews.Content: Since I live on the road, I'm a Nu Nomad ([...]), I rarely have any extra room in my bags for anything not essential--or for a full-size camera, for that matter. So, I was very pleased to have come across the Lumix DMC-ZS7. I had followed several magazine reviews before the purchase and consulted with a camera expert friend of mine,  and all pointed to the DMC series. Though I've only had a chance to use the camera a few times since my purchase a few weeks ago, I'll say that I like it very much. The picture quality is outstanding. The battery life is good. The size and weight of the camera is near perfect (I don't think I could every be totally satisfied when it comes to size)and the controls seem logical enough. The only feature that I don't have on this camera that I had on my last (aside from a view finder) was the ability to manually adjust the flash. But so far, it seems to be doing a good job in the dark so I'm not complaining.If you are seeking a well built, (near) pocket-sized camera with manual features, this baby is for you.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: Candy Girl
Reviews.Content: Very nice pictures. Many features which can be daunting to my generation, but a great camera. Just wish a printed version of the full instructions was avaiable and not have to be printed from the CD. I would purchase this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be more pleased!
Reviews.Author: C. Levasheff
Reviews.Content: I first bought the Sony HX5V and did not like the quality of the photos I was getting and the stabilization was not fantastic.  Then I bought the Canon SX210 and liked the photos but it was incredibly slugglish.  Third time is a charm.  I bought the Panasonic ZS7 and have been using it for a month and couldn't be more pleased!  Great camera, excellent photos!!

Reviews.Title: Great PnS camera!
Reviews.Author: D. L.
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace my Canon SD800.  I must say I really love this camera and it has just about everything I need.  Here are some features/issues that's important to me.Pros:- 12x optical zoom + intelligent zoom- battery indicator- HD video that can be zoomed while recording.  Records video in the current selected mode.- Full manual modes- Wide-angle lens- takes great pictures except in low light.- GPS data - nice to haveCon:- Need special software to process AVCHD video.  The PHOTOfunSTUDIO that comes with it is simple to use but could be better.  My Window VISTA DVD maker don't work with AVCHD files.  I would need to convert it to MPG first but quality degrades.- Zoom motor is noisy. you could hear it in some of the recording.- Low light pics in IA mode are noisy.- purple vertical streak when recording in bright light.  This is a problem with CCD cameras but it seems to be more noticeable than my Canon SD800.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera , enough for that money
Reviews.Author: jms

Reviews.Title: Great camera when it works...
Reviews.Author: Sebastian
Reviews.Content: Picked it up from Amazon almost three months ago. The camera is great when it works. Low light not as good as it could be but not a big problem for me. HD video looks great.After about 5 weeks it stopped recognizing SD cards (tried four different cards). Got the replacement from Panasonic and same problem after only three weeks of use. I am waiting for my second replacement hopefully it will work.I've been using Panasonic cameras over the last few years and they were always very solid but this one is changing my view of the company. It will probably be the last Panasonic I will buy.
