Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 is great- works with Macs!
Reviews.Author: Mark Fagerburg "Kazakh Kid dad"
Reviews.Content: I received the DMC-ZS7 right before a short vacation trip. Didn't have a lot of time to read all the instructions (which are mostly on disk as PDF files only). But the camera is so simple to learn I really had no problems at all (disclaimer- I am a professional photographer). Great Leica lens; image stabilization works wonderfully, and HD video is quite impressive (780p).Using an Intel Mac running OS X 10.6+ and having iLife 09 installed allows you to import AVCHD-Lite HD video directly from the camera into iMovie, bypassing needing a PC to import and then converting files for editing. Older non-Intel Macs or those without iLife 09 will not be able to import from the camera.I will say that the Panasonic software on the PC does allow easy uploading of video to Youtube- unedited except for simple crops.Pros- ease of use; quality of video (still images are nice too); very compact size, can use with my Mac.Cons- Manuals are only on CD as PDF files; Panasonic software not the best/easiest to use on a PC.Would have given 5 stars if they had made Mac importing software or better software for the PC.

Reviews.Title: Great for video recording concerts..
Reviews.Author: David Doebler
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for one simple goal - recording concerts (especially with load volumes). It is a fantastic device for such use. It has great HD video quality and great sound recording quality. You can zoom up to 12x while recording, which is really nice - especially if you don't have close up seats. The low light picture quality is also quite good, although I haven't taken enough photos to be an accurate judge. I am typically a Canon guy, and have owned 5 of their Elph series over the years. But they have crappy sound recording, and you can't zoom while recording.The software that is included is decent, but it chews through a battery with video in a little under an hour. Definitely recommend a second battery !!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Pete "Pete"
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera primarily for the travel and it does what it advertise.The Gps works 99% of the time and when you use Picasa software it really tells you a location the picture was taken at. Specialy here in Arizona desert where sometimes you have no idea what's behind the next mountain.The body is well build but I have to admit that is too small for my hand.I prefer the old Canon with only 7.1 megapixels and a optical viewfinder for that matter.Most of new cameras are also being built without optical viewfinders and it is a must in a harsh desert sun.But I do like this camera for what it was designed for. It is fast.Pictures are sharp.Zoom is wide enough for landscapes and close enough for hummigbirds.By the way the non-brand spare battery works with no problem.Panasonic delivers and so does Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great while it works
Reviews.Author: Trader One "ogr4evr"
Reviews.Content: I have had three of these cameras and each of them have a quality control problem.  It is perfect size, takes great pictures and video - WHILE IT STILL WORKS.  The first one, which I still have and use extensively is for the most part just fine except for the white spec of lint or something on the inside of the lens. This does not persent a problem for still shots as the spot is outside the focus length.  But for video, it is another story as the spot shows in every video similar to a sun spot on the lens when that occurs.  I will live with this issue in fear of returning an otherwise perfect camera for a refurbished one, which is the normal procedure for Panasonic, that might not be as good.But the real reason for this post is to inform potential buyers that a quality control problem must exist with this camera as two of them failed in less than two weeks.  Both were purchased from Amazon, so an exchange or refund will be processed through their normal procedures.  I have never had two consequetive cameras fail completely in such a short period.  Don't bother trying to talk to Customer Service as they are clewless about this issue.  Camera works fine for several days both still and video shots then fails to turn on the next time you try to use it. Using a new Panasonic extra battery did not solve the problem and nothing would make the cameras restart.So, buyer beware as it seems there is a run of cameras from Panasonic which have an inherent flaw of some type in them.My ZS3, and FZ35 have been flawless as well as the first ZS7 but not the recent last two.

Reviews.Title: Not exactly an improvement
Reviews.Author: spin_nin
Reviews.Content: I had a Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ4S 8.1MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver) whose lens cover stopped working. Prior to that the pictures it took, in all conditions, were really good.I replaced it with the ZS7 hoping to have the same, if not better, picture quality. That has not been the case. Has the same great Leica lens as the older model but images are a little more distorted or pixelated on the ZS7. The video quality is far superior to that of the TZ4 and the LCD is much nicer on the ZS7.One area that concerns me is that the camera cannot focus / does not focus at the mid way point of the zoom. around 6x - 8x zoom it simply will not focus. Doesn't matter where I am, how the camera is set, or what the lighting conditions are. The mid way point on the zoom is useless. I have missed many photo opps because of this.The older TZ4 was less complicated but, like I said, it took good pictures 90% of the time on the auto or iA setting. The ZS7 requires a lot more know how and fussing about to get the same picture quality as the older one. Screwing around with the camera can lead to missing a shot. People complain about how long it takes to turn on a camera and be ready for a shot sometimes. Makes me laugh. If you have to turn it on and wait plus get all the settings right you are not really taking advantage of a point & shoot camera. Might as well go for the DSLR at that rate.Sure, I admit that this would have been capable of taking better pictures than the older model thanks to its adjustability but the new image processor gets in the way. The ZS7 still isn't going to give you DSLR quality pics no matter how much you adjust it. Without the option of storing images in the RAW formaat it isn't really worth all the adjustability. Not even close. I think this is meant to fill the gap between point & shoot & DSLR (leaning heavily toward point & shoot in my opinion). Gone is the VIVID color setting from the older model which is sorely missed on the new model. I have found the color reproduction to be much better with Canon & Fuji cameras. Fuji has really fallen off, more & more each year with their image quality - overcomplicating simple designs that, in the past, worked brilianty. The video button on the ZS7 is too easy to hit by accident (took a 2 hour video by accident without even knowing it).After being very disappointed with this camera and its completely useless GPS function and Panasonic's proprietary batteries (genius for them to make money but horrible for the consumer) which run down very quickly in this camera (yes, I turned the GPS off) I cannot recommend this camera to anyone.I did try out the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black) and found it to be fantastic. Simple, easy to use, great pictures, & at a fraction of the cost ZS7. Video quality is pretty decent too. I gave up some zoom but if you drop the MegaPixels down the zoom increases. 12MP is pushing it for the sensor size on both Lumix cameras. All the manufacturers out there need to stop the MP nonsense and get back to what matters - picture quality.*Update* I did a little more research & it seems that even the professional reviewers agree - older is better when it comes to the ZS7. ([...].). Don't get me wrong here people -I like Panasonic cameras! They had a great design and they changed it - not for the better in my opinion.I also purchased a Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD jst before the holiday. The picture quality is a vast improvement nut it has it's downsides as well.Is there a perfect compact camera out there? Maybe, but I haven't come across it yet. I also purchased a Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver). Like the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver) these are two VERY GOOD point and shoot cameras. I think the Canon gives you slightly more manual control but, really, were splitting hairs here. Both cameras give you very good picture quality out of the box while the Canon PowerShot SX130IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 3.0-Inch LCD does alright on auto it is capable of some phenominal pictures if you take the time to adjust it properly based on your given situations. While both the ZS7 and SX130IS are considered "compact" I really don't feel either belong in this catagory, especially the Canon SX130IS. Too big, too bulky, too much adjustabilty for the absolute best picture quality (the SX130IS is much less expensive than the ZS7 too). If Panasonic reads these reviews, I implore you to take a step back in order to move forward. What you had in the TZ4 & ZS3 wasn't broken but you fixed it and the image quality suffered. Go back and I'll be happy to give you guys another chance.

Reviews.Title: A disappointment
Reviews.Author: RB
Reviews.Content: This camera feels good in my hand, and I love the battery charger. To not have a long cord, but just a simple 2 prong arrangement is fabulous. And the big screen was great.But I was very disappointed with the quality of the camera. I particular the shots even in focus are not sharp, which really surprised me from a Leica lens, as i used to have leicas and the lenses were sharp as a tack. This must be their low end line. i'm a semi-pro, so i know wherefore I speak on this. In addition, the colors are not accurate, and the camera is just plain slow. i used it to shoot a party, and most of the shots were blurry.No wonder so many people don't think they can take photos-so much equipment is inferior.I was so excited to have a camera that I could just put in my pocket that I was willing to forego having RAW. But this is not for me.I tried the smaller one as well, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FH20 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch, and that was very Mickey Mouse. In comparison, the Nikon P6000 beats them both by a country mile, though it has a long cord on the battery charger, the battery runs out too quickly, and is a bit larger. Oh well. Worth the try but it's going back tomorrow with the other one..

Reviews.Title: Bad Design
Reviews.Author: R. Nykster "Rob"
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of giving Panasonic a second chance. My first panasonic camera stopped working because of a drop of sweat. My new DMC-ZS7 automatic lens shutter won't open or close anymore. The spring or something broke. I notice there are LOTS of people having problems with this lens cover on the camera. When the automotive industry puts out a product with a part that is bad, they replace it. When Panasonic designs a camera, they design it to break so you will have to buy another one. I'll never  never NEVER buy Panasonic again.

Reviews.Title: Never got good pictures
Reviews.Author: DB "Truly yours"
Reviews.Content: The usual: tonn of research, 1-2 month waiting, great anticipation and watching the five-star numbers growing. The camera worked overall and sometimes took OK pictures. But I was not happy with the quality of the most pictures it took. My take is that something was just not right with my camera and I returned (full refund with the Prime). Went to use my 4 y.o. Canon Elph630 and happy again, solid performance in camparison. For now I will be waiting for new 2011 models.I loved the wide angle lens. In fact it was so wide I tried to zoom to work around it. Nice feature that takes time to get used to.I dismissed people's complaints about the printed manual. Wrong, this camera needs one. The camera after all is not cheap so Panasonic should print one.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: MRB
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after reading many great reviews, It replaced a Canon sd870. This camera has a great zoom and reasonable features. Unfortunately its image quality is quite sub-par in both high light and low light conditions. What a disappointment, as it did not even come close to the old cannon and to make simple still images reasonable required alot of photo editing. I am not sure how this camera received the great reviews it did. The pictures lacked depth in color and often came out overexposed in both outdoor and indoor pictures.  I willl not buy another Panasonic. I was so disappointed with this camera I did not even try the video function, so I can not comment on this. In my opinion pick any Cannon, Sony or Nikon and do not waste your time on this one.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality does not match hardware
Reviews.Author: Judith Cox
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade for my canon D 1100 elph but was very disappointed with the picture quality. The 1100 is by far a sharper cleaner image in all light conditions and zooms. I did like the look of the camera and the controls. I only wish it took better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera, so far.
Reviews.Author: MAC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement for a 6 year old Canon "point and shoot."  I have been happy with the old Canon but after a lot of research, I decided on the ZS7 rather than a new, similar featured, SX210IS Canon. They seem similar enough so that it actually came down to the size.  I wanted a camera small enough to be easily carried while walking, with at least 10X zoom, ease of operation, very good picture quality, image stabilization and short video capability.  The reviews of the two cameras were very close as was the price in Dec/2010.  My wife likes the new camera's looks, features, operation and carrying ease.  She has used the camera for two months now without any problems.  We realize the camera's limitations (it's a point and shoot)and are very satisified with the picture quality and features.  I would purchase again - from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Ralph Furlong
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because it had a wide lens (24mm) and for its size.  The intent was to use this camera while riding a tandem and being able to take one handed pictures with it.  Most small cameras have too narrow a lens (28 to 30mm) which is fine for close up shots, but not so good for scenery shots.Overall, the camera works just fine.  The image stabilization is not as good as my Nikon, but then again, it did not cost as much as my Nikon.  The grip on the camera leaves a lot to be desired though.  There is not enough of a ridge to safely hold the camera with one hand and to take pictures with.Low level light shots are the worst I have seen short of camera phones and IPOD touch camera.  The pictures turn out very grainy.  If you are in low light levels, ensure that you are using a flash and/or using a tripod.My biggest complaint has to do with Panasonic Service (or lack of service) when there is an issue.  When the camera arrived, we took the camera and everything out of the package and it all looked just fine.  We started using the camera on a trip almost immediately.  When we got home two weeks later, we went to install the software so that we could download the pictures from the camera.  That is where the trouble started.  The software disk had a hidden flaw on it.  From the package, it looked just fine.  But remove the disk and look at the shinny surface where the data is recorded and you see a very large crack!  Well, we could either ship the entire thing back to Amazon since we were within 30 days or contact Panasonic. Since we were keeping the camera, we thought the best thing to do was contact Panasonic.  That was a BIG mistake!!  Panasonic took 2 weeks, several e-mails and phone calls to decide it was not there problem since it was now outside of the 30 day warranty from the ship date of the camera!  I reminded them that the first contact with their company was within the 30 days and they finally agreed to ship a replacement.  Well, many weeks later, still NO software!!!!!!!!I am currently using my Nikon software to take pictures from the camera, but I have no manual since that is on the disk and there is NO option to download a manual from the Panasonic website!!  I have been told that if I want a manual, I have to purchase the software!!!Overall, I would NOT recommend this company to anyone based upon their service response.  I would presume that the rest of their warranty on their camera is not worth much either.  This leaves me with the feeling that this is a throw away camera, and a very expensive one for that type of camera!If you buy this camera, CHECK the condition of the software disk immediately!!  If it is damaged, return the camera for a new one!!  Do NOT trust Panasonic to replace the disk!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Value!
Reviews.Author: David Solomon
Reviews.Content: I've spent the last few weeks researching cameras and decided that my needs were fairly basic. I was all set on the Panasonic FH-20 - a great little point and shoot, and then after further discussion with my wife, decided that it would be far better to get a camera that we could replace a camcorder as well - one which would allow us to record a decent amount of movie in HD. That meant going for one which would record in the AVCHD format. Having seen all the rave reviews of the ZS7 on Amazon I was sold. I then had to try and justify paying the price! Last week I was at my local Costco and they were selling this wonderful camera for just $199 (that's not a misprint!), and what's more, it came with a 2GB SD card and a genuine Panasonic Lumix case! They only had 4 left in the store and I was not going to miss out.The camera itself has been a joy to use. It has a quality feel to it. I like the fact that it is a little weighty. The buttons work with a precision that I appreciate. The Leica lens is just amazing and I never would have expected it on a camera of this price. Panasonic really have nailed it with this camera. I've mostly taken indoor photos and have found that those without flash have been absolutely great. I've used macro quite a bit. Occasionally it takes a while to focus in macro zoom but once it does, pictures are razor sharp. With flash it can be variable but try different settings until you see what works best for you. I also like the black and white grain setting for that nostalgic look. I also can't wait to experiment with the Starry Sky scene mode once I get my tripod.I haven't taken too much video but the quality is very high and I don't have a problem with the AVCHD format since I have never edited my video's in all the years I used a camcorder.I took the advice of a previous reviewer and experimented with the digital zoom. It really is up to 63.8x zoom - amazing.I did not buy this camera for the GPS and have it turned off permanently. I chose this rather than the ZS5 because of the AVCHD format and the slightly larger screen, and as it turned out, the deal from Costco on this camera was CHEAPER than the ZS5!To anyone looking to buy this camera I would give 2 pieces of advice: go to Costco - no - run to Costco before they sell out! Secondly, read the manual thoroughly, and work through all the features in the first few days. I got so frustrated with the negative reviews from people who were too lazy to do so, and then returned the camera after a few days, or had complained because they had unrealistic expectations and were comparing it to their DSLR. This is not helpful at all to those looking for an honest review. As for the battery, I'm fine with it. With the money you save at Costco, go an buy a 2nd battery or use the money you've saved in not having to buy a case or card, to do so. Honestly, this is a stunning camera in looks and ability. I carry it around with me all the time (the case is designed to fit on my belt). As your photography skills grow, this is a camera that will grow with you. All the manual settings will see to that. I've had SLRs in the past, before the digital age, and I'm done with all that. This camera does everything I want and much, much more. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: Caroline A. Bennetti
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after looking at a lot of reviews on other cameras.  I can't say enough about this camera.  I love the GPS feature which you can turn on or off. The GPS knew where I was even as far as which point I was at while in the Grand Canyon.  The zoom is so incredible!  We went to the grand canyon and we could hardley see the Colorado river, but I zoomed in and you wouldn't believe how clear the zoom was, as well as how close!  Also the video and picture quality is really clear!  I am 120% satisfied as I usually am with Panasonic. Another interesting picture I took was traveling 75 MPH (speed limit in Azizona) I clicked a picture out of my side window and there was NO blur - perfectly clear!  LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: Thank you!
Reviews.Author: ed
Reviews.Content: I want to thank all the reviewers here on Amazon for helping me choose this outstanding camara. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Good cam but not for all
Reviews.Author: Jey
Reviews.Content: I bought this point and shoot after much deliberation and going through every review i could possibly find. This is my first panasonic cam and i own a Sony DSC-H1. The camera was shipped ontime and reached as expected.Was very impressed with the first look. I used mostly the IAuto mode and in well lit conditions pics were awesome, but when i started to take pics at places that had little less lighting like cloudy out door and little shadowy places, it was difficult. The IAuto mode started selecting scene's that made pics looks less impressive. everyshot at the same subject it chose a different scene and gave different results.This is where it got little frustrating as i had to take several shots to get the ideal result. Also the color's were little saturated..making it look little unnatural. I did take the same pics with my sony and panasonic to compare the results and definitely sony had a notch above the results of panasonic.I think to get the best out of the cam you had to tweak the settings.. Well my wife was definitely not happy with the cam and so had it returned.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: Hamdi El-Sissi
Reviews.Content: I bought this Camera in Dec. 2010 from Amazon. The picture quality in normal indoor light conditions is very poor. After six month of limited use, the camera died {System Error (Focus)] after a trip to the sea side. I have read about this problem before I bought the camera and did not put much credence in it as a Japanese manufacture would not be that sloppy. Sure enough, it is a poor quality design.Now I am having trouble finding if the warranty still covers this mishap.Update in 2/2013: It was fixed under warranty. After I went to a trip with the ill-fated Camera, the problem returned again (seems to be extremely sensitive to dust and humidity). I got it fixed in Cairo Egypt for $30. But sure enough, I lost the camera shortly after.I am relieved to have lost the camera! Never again a Panasonic!

Reviews.Title: broke after 6 months of use
Reviews.Author: La Quebecoise "Nat"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera in January and it just broke on a trip to Canada last week.  The shutter cover won't open or close and the focus is broken.  Now , I have to mail it to Texas to possibly get a refurbished one... What a pain, unhappy about quality/price... 6 months of use is 40.00/ a month for my camera...  let see if I even get a refurbished one now.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the size, price, and functions
Reviews.Author: Tyekim1
Reviews.Content: I shoot with Digital SLR, but that's bit much for my 70 year young Mother. This camera does it all. The controls are intuitive and easy to use. The camera does quite a bit more than my DSLR at a fraction of the cost. I can't wait to see the pictures when my Mother returns from her trip to Alaska. What can I say, I did the research, and it's a great camera at a great price. Be sure and get an extra battery the 3" monitor uses a bit more power, but it's also very easy to see and compose shots. Great little camera!

Reviews.Title: great camera with only minor complaints
Reviews.Author: crinum lily
Reviews.Content: I bought the ZS7 at the end of 2010 to replace an older Panasonic camera that I really liked. Deciding between the ZS7 and the cheaper ZS5 model was a challenge. In the end, I choose the ZS7 because it has the AVCHDLite video (in addition to the MotionJPEG video). It has stereo (vs. mono on the ZS5). And supposedly has a better screen resolution.The good:It takes excellent, sharp photos.Simple to use.The Intelligent Auto function is great.It's sturdy and has a weight to it that I like.The screen resolution is indeed really nice.It powers on quickly.It doesn't seem to have a noticeable shutter lag at all.The not-so-good:The GPS feature. Period. I live in Indianapolis (which is a fairly major city) and the GPS can never seem to locate where I am. It takes upward of 5 minutes for the GPS function to "locate" anything. And, in my experience, it never does. While it is searching, you cannot use the camera.  Once done searching, it always tells me it can't find anything. I've only once (in six months) had the GPS successfully find a location. I didn't need or want this feature in the first place, but wanted the other features the ZS7 offered, so I really had no choice. Out of curiosity, I tried the function several times. And, in my opinion, the GPS is completely useless.Overall:I would recommend this camera for all the reasons I listed, but don't count on the GPS feature to work. The GPS is the only reason I gave this camera 4 stars instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: Dmc-zS7 Xcellent
Reviews.Author: Santiago Cohen
Reviews.Content: I took this camera to Brazil because I wanted a small and powerful camera that I could fit in my pocket. The results were incredible. I even took High res videos of the carnival at night with an incredible quality.The Leica lens is sharp and the 12x zoom with an amazing 25mm wide angle makes a superior camera for a compact size.The controls are easy to use. the only thing I missed was an optical viewer besides the screen for bright light and composition, but that only happens in bulky cameras. the shooter could be more instant but it wasn't bad. If you are going to buy only one camera this is the one for you, trust me it is great.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Travel / Backpack Camera
Reviews.Author: Sparky San Diego
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a seven year old Canon that was going to cost more to fix than this camera cost me new. I am an avid backpacker, hiker and enjoy travel and sightseeing. After several months of researching I settled on the Panasonic Lumix Sx7. I wanted a camera that had an adequate optical zoom, built in GPS or capable that provided at least 10 mega pixels. I read all the reviews, went to various camera stores and handled several others and decided to take the plunge and buy the Panasonic.I have yet to find anything about this camera I do not like. The pictures I have taken thus far have been amazing. I have used the GPS to test it and found it to be very accurate and easy to use. Battery life has been acceptable but I have ordered a spare for longer trips. The camera fits nicely in a small case I wear attached to my waist belt for easy access. I have been able to get 270 photos out of a single charge over a three day period. This is with the GPS on and using the flash for 40-50 photos. The optical/digital zoom is perfect for long range shots. The macro is awesome and provides very nice up close photos. The facial recognition feature works like a charm. I am not a fan of video but have used the video feature a couple of times and find it acceptable and viewable. The sound is fair when using the video feature.I would recommend this camera to anyone who seeks a compact camera for travel or someone who just wants a good camera for all around use. I'm planning a six week trip of the John Muir in September and can't wait to take this camera along.April 2, 2011 update:I have taken over 1000 pictures now and have yet to find anything I do not like about this camera. I have purchased two additional batteries. I have found the GPS cuts the battery life in half when left on all the time. The drain when the camera is turned off but not the GPS is neglagible. But when using the camera with GPS on the drain is noticible. If you have a spare battery it should not be a big deal. I have two.The optical and digital zoom is fantastic. I have played with the zoom at various lengths and am completely satisfied with the results. The close up and macro features work well but take some getting use to using.All in all I am pleased with the decision to purchase the Panasonic Lumix ZS-7.

Reviews.Title: Best Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Antonio Menendez
Reviews.Content: I have owned and reviewed many digital cameras.  By far this is the best picture quality, even in full zoom mode,of all the brands I have owned including Nikon and Sony.  If you are looking for picture quality, do not look further.

Reviews.Title: Pretty much what I expected for the price
Reviews.Author: misterjman
Reviews.Content: This is pretty good for a point-and-shoot.  Obviously you're never going to get the photo quality of an slr with a small sensor like this has.  However, the low-light shooting is better than some other point-and-shoots I've used.  The lens is great.  It takes awesome zoomed in pictures in daylight.  Not so much inside unless there's a tripod set up.  GPS is pretty accurate (the test shots I did came up like 200-300 feet off when I viewed it in Google Earth.  The battery life could be better but it is not terrible.  The video looks to be really good quality, but I have not really used it much.  Manual controls are nice once you figure them out, but it takes a while to set up for the shot.

Reviews.Title: Great image stabilization
Reviews.Author: D. Stanhope
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a pocket sized camera that had a high zoom range. The ZS7 fit the bill beautifully. I have had problems holding other light cameras steady at higher zoom levels. A review of several cameras at dpreview showed the ZS7 to have outstanding image stabilization. I can now confirm that is correct, and I am able to get clear handheld shots at 12 or even 16x zoom. Shots of birds or butterflies reveal excellent detail. The iZoom feature giving 16x zoom at full resolution is good enough to leave on all the time. Although the camera has a plethora of manual settings the iAuto setting is so effective in a wide variety of situations anyone looking for a simple point-and-shoot should be very happy with it. After about 200 shots so far in a variety of lighting situations both indoors and out, I find the picture quality to be excellent and consistent, autofocus to be very reliable, and I consider the camera to be a real keeper.I am used to having a viewfinder on a camera, and find using the LCD screen only in bright light to be a bit of a challenge but not limiting. I haven't tried the GPS function yet so can't say how useful it is. My only real quibble is with the software delivered. It always creates a new folder when downloading shots, and can't delete images from the camera. I liked the ZoomBrowserEX s/w that came with my old Canon better and fortunately it workes perfectly with the Panasonic camera. It is much faster and more versatile than the s/w delivered with the camera.I am using a Transcend Class 10 8Meg SDHC card which writes very quickly. I had heard concerns about being able to use aftermarket batteries with the ZS7 but I have a spare battery from MaximalPower which is working very well.

Reviews.Title: Not Mac friendly
Reviews.Author: fototraveler
Reviews.Content: The camera is pretty great, but the software is NOT Mac friendly. It only works on PC. You have to be careful what format you film in as the AVCHD can only be played on a Blue-Ray or PC. You have to remember to shut off the GPS as it drains the battery even when the camera is turned off.  The zoom is pretty great and the camera does quite well in low lighting. I'm pretty happy with the camera overall. They just need to come out of the dark ages with compatibility.

Reviews.Title: I've tried many, this is the best!
Reviews.Author: gsxrjoe
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I've written but I felt compelled to after trying to find a suitable point and shoot camera for the past several months.I had an older Panasonic Lumix that I "lost" in a lake after only a few weeks, and for a replacement I purchased a Canon SD1400 as I wanted something a little smaller with most of the same features (I had hoped.)  I've always been partial to Canons as they were the first digital cameras I had owned but the picture quality and lens were completely outclassed by the Panasonic.  I returned it and then went to the new Nikon S8100 (probably just because of the commercials) which I kept for several weeks, but again I was disappointed with the lens and picture quality.  The "wide-angle" of the Canon and Nikon were not even close to as wide as the Panasonic, although they claim the same specifications.  I can say firsthand the Panasonic gets more of your subject into the phot than the other two.  The photo quality was not nearly as good on the Canon or Nikon either, and the Nikon has an annoying pop-up flash that seemed very flimsy and wouldn't always latch into the down position which got to be very annoying.  I then went back to the next generation Lumix and couldn't be happier - great photos, super easy to use, cool features, great lens, and I almost forgot to mention it's best attribute - when you press the button, it actually takes the picture!  No more telling your friends to wait while you press the button and wait for 15 seconds and try to guess when the camera will actually take the picture - this camera takes it almost immediately, which was another issue I had with both other cameras but especially the Canon.  There is also a "burst" picture setting which is great for getting action shots - neither the Nikon or Canon offers this.I will say the size and styling of the Panasonic are not perfect - it's much more bulky than the Canon and not as stylish as the Nikon, but the ease of use and fantastic photos more than make up for it in my opinion.I haven't used the GPS function yet (does anyone really need this?) so I cannot review that aspect.All in all this is a great camera for the price and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good travel companion
Reviews.Author: Photobug
Reviews.Content: I have been a Canon user all the time, worn up 3 Canons since 2001.  This time, I thought to get a change.  The Lumix zs7 caught my attention because of raving reviews by others and the built-in GPS tracking capability.The first surprise I got is that Lumix ZS7 doesn't have a viewfinder.  The screen is the only thing that you use for framing.  It works well most of time, since this is the habit of most point-of-shot camera users.  However, during a ski trip under sunny blue sky, I cannot see the display at all, especially through  the ski goggles.The quality of pictures is good under sufficient light, but become grainy and noisy under low light.  Comparing with Rebel XSi, the picture quality is underwhelming. But I may be asking too much.The video quality is very good, even under low light.  Battery life is also acceptable.Overall, it does the job ok.

Reviews.Title: Surprising Power In A Small Package
Reviews.Author: Rocky Sunico
Reviews.Content: I've been dealing with these bridge camera megazooms for a while now and I've been very, very impressed with the Lumix ZS7. Beyond it's intimidating 12x optical zoom in a classic point and shoot frame, it offers excellent on-board color correction capabilities, a variety of shooting modes and easy to access video controls.The camera comes with a lot of preset shooting modes that will get you through most of your everyday camera needs. And for those looking for finer control, the camera still provides options for manual settings for the budding photo enthusiast.Video quality is great although I'm not 100% happy with the video format. But you should easily find a video converter online that will convert the output file into something a lot friendlier in terms of readability options.The GPS function is a neat added feature, but not very essential though. Expect to burn through your batter life a lot faster should you keep this own all the time plus getting synced with the satellite takes a fair amount of time.Overall, this still an amazingly good camera that combines the convenience of a point and shoot with the robustness of a entry level DSLR.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera for Learning Photography
Reviews.Author: Zingaro
Reviews.Content: I carry a camera with me at all times, and I'm always taking pictures and making videos. I would describe myself as an advanced amateur and an avid photographer, who is constantly honing his craft. Also, my photo album is a computer, an iPad, an iPhone, or a web page. I seldom make prints. What is most amazing to me about this camera is what it can do. It has features that many entry level D-SLRs don't have. I and don't mean just Manual mode. This camera has Bracketing, which the new Nikon D3100 doesn't have. With Bracketing, you can experiment with High Dynamic Range photography. And the zoom lens covers 25-300 mm (35mm equivalent). So you don't have to buy another lens for telephoto shots like you would have to do with an entry level D-SLR. The camera will zoom in movie mode, and there's no audio noise when it does. And image stabilization also works in movie mode. It does have it's limitations. Image quality is best at the lower ISO levels. ISO 80 is best. A high ISO photo of foliage shows the camera's biggest image limitation. But I've taken some very sharp low-light photos at ISO 400, with a shutter speed of 1/4 second. You can get away with the longer exposures because of the image stabilization. Image quality is also good when making low-light videos. All in all, if you want a camera that will take you a long way in learning photography, I would recommend this camera above a low-cost, entry-level D-SLR.

Reviews.Title: Best in Class!
Reviews.Author: lux
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking for a point-and-shoot camera that would take good quality photos in a range of conditions yet still be in the ~$250 price range. This Lumix absolutely delivers on that promise and I'm thrilled with my purchase.If you spend a little time testing out the various settings and learning how to get the best out of your camera you'll be very happy. I agree that the "intelligent" settings on this camera that are supposed to take great shots automatically can leave a little to be desired, especially indoors in low light. A few tweaks, though, and you're good to go.Battery life is excellent. And as an added bonus - it's red! Not only is this a rocking good camera but it's cute too! Can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: mg in kc
Reviews.Content: I've used a lot of point and shoots (Canon, Fuji, Sony, Nikon, Olympic), and I've had a Nikon D100 from the time they were released. This leaves all of them in the dust. Got it for my wife, who takes a lot of shots of her students (first grade). She loves the ease and the quality of the photos. Plus, she can shoot videos for parent night without a separate device. Excellent and fast face-finder and focus. It's first rate. Best camera I've ever bought(and I've owned a bunch). Got it from B&H; for $300, free three-day shipping, and no tax. What a deal!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: YL
Reviews.Content: After reading many great reviews for this product, I decided to purchase the Lumix ZS7 to replace the Canon powershot SD800 I had lost. I am thoroughly disappointed with the quality of the photos. It does an okay job in daylight settings but the pictures are quite dull. Especially in low light settings the photos are horrible and grainy, comparable to performance of camera attached to my cell phone. The features of the camera such as GPS, 12x optical zoom, large LCD screen, numerous auto intelligence settings and many manual settings (aperture/shutter priority) are alluring but they do not make up for the lack of quality in the photos... I have to say I miss my old Canon! I am stuck with it since I am now traveling abroad. I took over 1000 photos on this trip and none of them compare to the photos I took with my old SD800. When I'm back I will definitely be going back to a Canon. If you are looking for a photos with clarity and quality I do not recommend Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera Ever!
Reviews.Author: M. Williams
Reviews.Content: I don't normally rave about ANY product, but this is an exceptional product deserving of plaudits! The Panasonic Lumix is AWESOME! THE PICTURE QUALITY IS PROFESSIONAL ENOUGH THAT I AM OFTEN QUESTIONED AS TO WHO I HIRED TO TAKE THE PICTURES!  The ease of use, the 3" view screen, and the ample zoom feature are all deserving of praise.After numerous other so called "user friendly" cameras, I am throughly sold on this one.  I think so highly of this product that I'm even giving one to each of my daughters this Christmas!

Reviews.Title: Not All That
Reviews.Author: Ardan "ardan"
Reviews.Content: When I saw the reviews and the list of features I was really looking forward to this camera, the problem is that it isn't all that.Problems:GPS - Slow to acquire, If you carry the camera in your pocket it has no idea were it is and most pictures end up with an incorrect GPS tag.GPS software - On the pictures that do end up with a gps tag there is no way to display them on a map through the included software. Only through a tree structure.Battery Life - Not Good, I am not sure if it is the GPS or not but you have to charge every few hours, a real pain.Picture Quality - Pictures look good but colors are very washed out, most of my pictures to the mountains didn't show the reds hardly at all.Camera Size - To thick to pocket, to small for most cases. Still haven't found a case I like for it.Things I like,Zoom - Very goodStart up - Fast, no issues hereMovie Button - Dedicated movie record button, do not have to go though menu.I still haven't decided if I am going to keep it or not.......My old cannon is just as good on everything but the zoom.

Reviews.Title: good camera, but...
Reviews.Author: bran
Reviews.Content: I've read lots of reviews before finally bought this one. Just got it today and overall it seems good, but I found that the image is sort of distorted at the edge (barrel distortion?) when I use 1X zoom (the distortion disappears when I use higher zoom). I've not seen this issue discussed in any of the reviews I read.. Does this seem normal to everyone else or is it just the problem with my camera??? Thinking about returning it and got a SONY HX5V now...

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ivan Kesja
Reviews.Content: This camera I've messed around with to get the hang of it and see how far away i can get a clear picture, and wow even with a far away shot you still get a really sharp picture where even if you don't really see the person or object you zoom in on the saved picture and you will still have a clear and clean picture. But just wish the price was a bit lower.

Reviews.Title: Best Point & Shoot I have ever used.
Reviews.Author: Robert Gilbreath
Reviews.Content: I have used several point and shoot cameras including models from Canon, Olympus, Sony and others. Without question, this camera delivers the sharpest image quality. It has since become my primary point & shoot camera. I also have a Nikon D60 DSLR for times when I really want high quality photos but as with any DSLR, the D60 is a bulky camera. The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 fits nicely in a pocket. Controls are very easy to use. One of the main reasons that I purchased this camera is because of the built in GPS. I have read many other reviews here that indicate that the GPS really drains the battery. I have NOT found that to be true at all. Battery life is at least as good as other cameras that I have used (if not better) - with or without GPS enabled. I do wish that it was a little faster to establish a link with the GPS satellites but it's not too bad - usually no more than a minute or so. Once it has locked on to a satellite, your are good to go and all photos will be geotagged. I don't use the included software. Instead, I use Google Picasa (along with a few other free image editing tools). Picasa reads the geotag info on the photos and indicates on a map where the photo was taken. An added plus is the HD video that this camera takes. The video quality is impressive. I had recently purchased a Canon HD video camera that I may wind up selling on ebay because I just don't need it now that I have the ZS7.I love this camera!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, excellent photo quality
Reviews.Author: M. Morales
Reviews.Content: Pros: I'm not a pro, but I've been interested in photography since eighth grade. This camera takes great pictures for a point and shoot. Comparable to a digital SLR of only a few years ago. You might not even need an SLR if you learn to use all the settings in this camera. The menus are easy to use and there are a ton of settings you can adjust. Excellent optics. I'm really picky about having things in perfect focus. I hate even slightly blurry pictures. This camera can take extremely sharp pictures if you use it correctly.Cons: No manual focus. Proprietary battery and USB cable. If it had manual focus I would have given it five stars, but the auto-focus is excellent if you set it up right.Other Thoughts: Make sure to read the manual and practice with all the menu options. Some of them are VERY important if you want to take the BEST possible pictures. I recommend learning to use the various ISO, focus, (spot vs. multi-point) and exposure settings (spot vs. multi-point). You won't get the best pictures in all situations unless you know how and when to change these. The fully auto mode is very good 90% of the time, but a trained human will always get the best results with any camera (at least for now.) Spot focus is VERY important for good macro pictures!Make sure to get a big, fast memory card (at least class 6 speed) for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Low Light photos are poor, Proprietary cables - std USB would have been helpful
Reviews.Author: D. K. Billet "dkbillet"
Reviews.Content: The camera is beautiful and feels well made. I was so hopeful. Stereo mic, GPS, fast burst! I have had it a week. Am replacing my Canon SD870 (in waterproof housing-awesome) that went into the Pacific Ocean near Tonga (have you seen it?)I am really fussy about proprietary nonsense put in technology by the manufacturers. I went to offload my pics and Voila! I need a cable with an unrecognized appearance. Sure there was one in the box, but this means I have one more cable to keep track of on vacations and with my 4 computers.Also I read about not being able to buy OEM batteries. Now, I'm really irritated.All this would be fine if the pictures were awesome. Not so. I have used it in low light situations (coffee house/comedy club) and the photos are atrocious, and there was camera shake (which I rarely ever got on my Canon). Most of the photos were useless because of blur or poor lighting. I was using the zoom feature. I also had my Lumix FX75 on me and it's photos were just fine. No blur and lighting adjusted very well. That just seems wrong. I'll keep the FX75 (which uses a normal USB cable) and I'll be returning this one even though I love the feel and appearance; that is not what I bought it for.CONS: having to switch between PLAY and SHOOT, that is just dumb in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Mita
Reviews.Content: I'm a total amateur photgrapher but you rarely see me without my camera- I use it all the time. After extensive reading of the consumer reviews including the comments to the reviews,and my own list of why I want a new camera after 5 years of using a Canon Powershot, I bought the ZS7 Lumix. It has enough zoom for me, a metal case, and first of all a great Leica lense. The only bad reviews of this camera turned out to be things like "Can't turn GPS off so it eats your battery, or "Can't buy a generic battery for it"- none of it is true. I immediately turned off the GPS, and if I ever need it, I know how turn it back on. I have taken beautiful pictures of flowers, great night skylines. Tried the party setting, candle light setting and pin hole setting and liked the results. It doesn't wash out the colors like my old Canon, it takes decent low-light pictures but the most amazing is the 12X plus zoom. I also like to mention that the quality of the color blue is close to reality- a real problem with my Canon before. For a camera that's easy to carry, easy to use under $300 I am just thrilled.Ok, it's May 2011 now, and I have had and LOVED the ZS7 since end of August 2010. Took it to Europe and Mexico and everywhere I go, always carrying it in a well protecting case with a screensaver over the 3 inch display, since the day I started using it. But recently the display had two stripes across. I wondered about it but it didn't affect the quality of the pictures, so I didn't care too much about it for about a month, when yesterday taking it to the mountains there appeared more lines , until pretty much the whole display disappeared. It slightly reappeared, but failed shortly after again.For a 'travel' camera that was never dropped or handled rough, it seems too soon for something this big to go wrong. Amazon doesn't tell you this unless you call them, but Panasonic has a 1 year warranty on their cameras.After still taking beautiful pictures yesterday inspite of having lost the display, I sent it to Panasonic, who will replace it with a new one. I was lucky this happened within the one year warranty.

Reviews.Title: hdl
Reviews.Author: Harry D. Lane "HDL305"
Reviews.Content: Photo's are of good quality. I'm still learning how to best use the available settings. The LCD screen can be viewed on sunny days.I'm not crazy about the GPS due to the drain on the battery and

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: Mary B. Dickson "Mary D"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after reading reviews about many other cameras of this type. I was influenced to buy by the screen size, the GPS feature, and other reviews. I also looked at photos taken by other photographers with the camera.Although I have not had the chance to sit down with the manual (which you have to print out--bummer!) and go through all of the features, the point and shoot photos I've taken have been outstanding. I like the video feature and the better microphone than my old Nikon. I look forward to learning to use this camera to its full capacity before I go to Japan in December.Lightweight, good screen, easy to use so far, many features--what's not to like?  It's a little more spendy than I had planned, but not bad, considering all the features.

Reviews.Title: Full featured travel camera
Reviews.Author: T. Owen "little brown smurf"
Reviews.Content: Okay, take this for what it is; I have owned this camera for 3 hours. But I have too many cameras to count, and I know what I am looking for. I found it here. I travel, and primarily shoot with a Canon 5d Mk II SLR. But I need a digital note-taker; I need to know where I am, what is interesting, and why. I carry too many devices; a Garmin Oregon 550 GPS, a USB voice recorder, the 5D, a Flip video camera ... ridiculous. I might have eliminated several right here. Why? I can take a snap shot, record location, and then (thank god) this Lumix still has the nearly obsolete feature to record a voice memo after each shot, a 5 second .MOV file actually, so I can say what I just photographed and technical details. Perfect. Okay, not really - there is no way the GPS is going to be as accurate as the Garmin and acquire satellites as fast. And I can't use the voice memo feature to make long notes. But that is good enough for me. Image quality seems fine, movie, etc. If you are looking for a certain feature set that is hard to find, this camera might just have it. Manual on CD is fine - not sure why anyone would complain about that when you can use a FIND in your PDF reader and locate exactly what you are looking for. I needed a digital note-taker and this is it. Now I have to return 2 other cameras that supposedly had voice memo, but only by browsing serval layers through the view menu every time you needed to use it. Useless!

Reviews.Title: Lots of Features
Reviews.Author: Spudman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of its size, zoom, and the many favorable reviews here and elsewhere. My other camera is a Panasonic FZ18, so I am familiar with the controls on the ZS7. With four extra megapixels on this camera, I thought I might see a difference in clarity between the pictures taken on the new camera and the two-year-old FZ-18. I thought with the new camera I'd still have viable pictures even with extreme cropping. My initial reaction was to return this camera and buy a different one, but I just didn't see another one with the same combination of features for the price.Likes -Great feel and aestheticsThe instant start movie mode buttonThe great 3-inch LCD screenThe perfect pocket sizeThe far reaching zoom in such a small camera, a zoom that works quite well.Multiple scene modesMenu is intuitive and extensiveEnough user control options to keep photographers of various levels contentGood focusMetal body and metal buttons and controllers are a refreshing feature that gives the camera a look and feel of substance and quality.It's probably my doing, but my main complaint has been the inconsistent quality of photos taken with this camera. I tried many of the scene modes  and used the menu to make lots of tweaks with random success. I took pictures of the same subjects with the same lighting conditions, and the pictures taken with the older camera were sometimes better. Readers are probably thinking, "Then use the other camera, you big dummy." Maybe, but that two-year-old Panasonic has been sold on Ebay.I will say that with learning and practice, the number of keeper photos I've been taking has been increasing.A few pictures of apples taken with the food scene mode were outstanding, clear and sharp, but not all of the other pictures have been impressive. I just may have unreasonable expectations. The zoom mode is quite good, however. Wedding pics I took at an outdoor venue mostly turned out clear and vivid.Effects like Happy mode and pinhole can be achieved with better control by using the free Picasa photo program. I love the transform mode and have had lots of fun with it. Using this mode one can thinnify or widen the subject. Most of my subjects like their pictures taken in the thinnify mode.If you are trying to decide between this camera and the less expensive ZS5, I'd say spend the extra bucks for the ZS7. You'll get a larger viewing screen, a very convenient movie button on the back of the camera, two designated favorite scene choices on the dial, and the ability to capture still pics from motion pictures.This camera was an Amazon Warehouse buy, a camera returned by a previous buyer. It arrived within a week and was in excellent condition.UPDATE - Three years later I still have this little camera and like it as much as ever.

Reviews.Title: Slim, Great Images, Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Marginal HD Guru "MHG"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my last panasonic P & S. This is clearly better.The HD video quality is excellent.My only grip is that face detection doesn't work too well unless the face is 100% facing forward.I would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: N.J.Mc
Reviews.Content: After dropping an older version of this camera into the Atlantic while in Portugal, I did my research and found that this was exactly what I needed.  It's easy to use and takes great photos!  I'm a point-and-shoot photographer, so it thoroughly meets my needs!  I used it for the first time this weekend at a college graduation.  The HD videos captured the special moments perfectly!

Reviews.Title: costly batterys need frequent replacement with GPS
Reviews.Author: James Passe "Jim Time"
Reviews.Content: I ordered the ZS7 as a replacement for an ealier panasonic camera. As noted by others reviews, the folks at Panasonic, without letting folks know in their specifications or literature, have blocked use of any battery but theirs. While generic batterys will work fine in their older cameras for 10 bucks the panasonic battery for the zs7 is 50 dollars. One can find it for around 30 dollars on sale online but thats still 3 times the cost. Theres another consideration. Tthe GPS function chews up the battery and battery life fairly quickly compared to previous cameras. I use my camera a lot and wear out a couple batterys a year without the GPS in a camera. That means i am spending 40 to 80 bucks a year more to use this camera than if i could buy generic batterys and double that cost if i use the GPS function. With that in mind, for the average 3 years i have a camera before i lose break or retire a camera, i could have a camera twice as good as the ZS7 for the same overall cost.If money is no object buy a better camera. If it is, buy a competitor you can get batterys at a competitive price. I am returning my ZS7 for a different camera. Panasonic has lost a loyal customer. I won't be recomendng any of their products again. When i called customer service i basically got a tough beans approach.Back to the Nikon for me.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Ronda J. Holtom
Reviews.Content: Three years after I purchased this camera, it is still the best camera I've ever owned.  Picture and video quality are superb, it's easy to use, lightweight and just plain fabulous.  Hope it lasts forever!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Pictures
Reviews.Author: Marcia Carlock
Reviews.Content: It takes awesome pictures very user friendly easy to use! Would definitely recommend it to all my friends! Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Dust in the lens, all I see is dust in the lennnnns
Reviews.Author: S. Guzman "darkl0rd p1mpdaddy"
Reviews.Content: Ugh, this lens mechanism is faulty.  The lens cover leafs get stuck and won't open all the way when powered on... won't shut all the way when powered off.  When I look past the first lens I see a nice buildup of dust appearing on the second lens.  How do I clean it?  Well, the warranty ended after one year, so I need to take a screw driver to it.  I will either end up getting it clean or destroying it all together.

Reviews.Title: The first of my purchases from Amazon
Reviews.Author: abusara
Reviews.Content: The first of my purchases from AmazonKamira beautifulWas a unique experienceI benefited from many ChimeraPhotography was considered beautiful in the time of the Chimera

Reviews.Title: loved it
Reviews.Author: Kaizen
Reviews.Content: this was THEE most amazing camera I have ever purchased.I loved this camera and took something like 60,000 photos within the first 2 days I had it.I treasured it, and babied it for many years, and for many years I carried it around in my coat pocket, using it for school, note taking and just snapping shots.Let my parents borrow it for one day and the dog ate it...its currently sitting in my dresser, batter, stand, cables, and camera. It can probably be used for parts... but it doesnt work anymore.Still, I loved this camera and would like to buy it, or a more recent model of it whenever I can afford to.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC ZS7
Reviews.Author: DES
Reviews.Content: This has become my favorite digital camera!!! Easy to use. It replaced an older HP digital camera, this one is so much better. It has made several trips to Europe and Disney!!! It's easy to pack and has lots of excellent features. I bought a couple of extra batteries and never worry about running them down. The battery actually lasts much longer than I expected. I use this one more than my Canon EOS Rebel.

Reviews.Title: awsome
Reviews.Author: Zeke
Reviews.Content: i love this camera. i've had several panasonic  point and shoots and last year i got the FZ200. just love panasonic.still always use ZS7. panasonic rules. ZS7 is my everyday walk around go to camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera was replacement for one lost
Reviews.Author: G. Layer
Reviews.Content: This Camera was as advertised.  It was a replacement for one lost.  Since I, previously owned one it was easy to check outthe operation.  I still have a charger, some SD chips and a manual CD. so I am up and running.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Joe Otto
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this camera.  The GPS feature is great.  Pictures are clear and precise, and it offers many nice features.

Reviews.Title: Fast, small and fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Fits in a breast pocket, fast to power up, good focus, color and details.  My go to everyday camera.  Great for HD video too.  GPS function is accurate, although if you leave it on it will drain the battery in 2 days regardless of shots fired.

Reviews.Title: Good Product
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Best Camera i have bought. It fulfills all my needs in a camera. For starters, this is a complete package. For seasoned user, there are enough functions to play with.

Reviews.Title: The entire transaction went like clockwork.  I had the unit as promised.  It works as expected.
Reviews.Author: Sandy Layer
Reviews.Content: My Lumix DMC-ZS7 was stolen about6 months ago.  I still have the accessories, some batteries and the CD of theManual.This was a reasonably priced replacement.It was received and worked as advertised.  I am happy.  G. Layer

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Elaina Pitre "Dill Rider"
Reviews.Content: this is a great quality camera in a small package. my husband uses it for taking pictures at work for defects in furniture and it gets close enough to see those small defects. its a great camera

Reviews.Title: Lens cant focus just like previous Lumix I own
Reviews.Author: Kevin Collins
Reviews.Content: Don't drop or if its in a backpack, don't drop backpack on hard surface.  Don't shoot video into the sun -  the lens cant adjust and then shuts down.  Keeps telling you to turn the camera off and on.  Other than that great camera, big lens pulls in a lot of data and high resolution photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but what happens if the LCD breaks?
Reviews.Author: feather797
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, but Im very sad that I broke the LCD monitor so quickly and cannot afford to fix it!!!! Ug!!! Anyone have any advice??

Reviews.Title: If you want to capture some memories then this is a must have.
Reviews.Author: toxicavenger
Reviews.Content: Honestly this is one of the best cameras I have ever owned for the price. Usually I take super crappy pics and NO a cell phone isn't a replacement for a true camera. This camera takes all of the guess work out of good picture taking. Worth price and also it can't take some really great distance shots.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera!
Reviews.Author: Onebeachbumm
Reviews.Content: Great camera, just wish my HP keyboard worked as well.  I added the water proof case and have taken it everywhere and put it through the wringer and it keeps working.  I would buy another one tomorrow if I lost this one.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Julie R. Pomerville
Reviews.Content: Several family members own the same camera...we all love the zoom, and pictures come out great.  Lots of options - this specific model has the video record button right on the back, great if you want to quickly capture something the kids are doing.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera With Many Manual Features For The Skilled Amateur
Reviews.Author: Bubbalicious
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.Nearly everything about it from the manual settings to the zoom and GPS is great.  I take alot of panoramas and the assist is great.  The videos are HD.  The light sensitivity is also good.The only downside is there is no range finder, so you must use the LCD display which can be difficult in bright sunlight.  This is true of all digital cameras without a range finder eyepiece.I have recommended this cameras to other who also love it.  I recently sunk it in a pond I was crossing and it failed, so it is not waterproof.  But I liked it so much, I bought another one right away.

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures but Gets Dust inside Camera Easily
Reviews.Author: Trey Griffin
Reviews.Content: We have had this camera for a couple of years and have enjoyed good quality pictures and videos on numerous trips, with family, etc.  After using it for about a year we noticed black spots on many of our pictures.  After more looking we realized every picture and video over the past several months had them.  I took the camera apart and cleaned the sensor.  Pieces of dust/dirt had gotten inside the camera housing and on the sensor, causing these spots on the pictures.  After cleaning, things were great again.  But again, within 3 months it happened again.  I've never had this happen with any camera I've owned over the past 30 years.  Very frustrating.  I picked up a compact Canon, which is what I've used in the past and has worked great.

Reviews.Title: Great features, but it developed a problem
Reviews.Author: James Galbreath "Elder Jim"
Reviews.Content: We like this camera, which my wife uses, and have taken great pix on trips and for events.  But following a trip to the Philippines we discovered a strange mark in some pix.  Closer examination showed 2 marks in each picture.  It's clear that there are some kind of inclusions within the lens systems, so we can't really use the camera anymore for more that the most casual snapshots in the brightest conditions. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: I love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Gustavo Fring
Reviews.Content: I have had dthis now for maybe 4 years, it still works just as well as day one. The included battery still holds charge, takes great outdoor photos, and decent indoor.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Blue)
Reviews.Author: jon "jon"
Reviews.Content: After combining my son's and my research, we decided on this camera for the family Christmas present.  It has not disappointed yet.  For a fairly simple point and shoot, this has taken wonderful pictures that everyone has been happy with.  We are certainly no experts in photography, but it has several different modes and has allowed us to experiment a bit.  Continue to do your research, but I recommend trying Best Buy or any place where this or similar cameras are on display so you can hold it and play with it a bit before deciding on exactly what you want.

Reviews.Title: DMC-ZS19 Camera great - especially for night shots
Reviews.Author: Karol
Reviews.Content: Not actually reviewing the DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP as we did not receive it, supplier provided a substantially cheaper model, and did not advise us prior to sending.  The DMC-ZS19 actually received turned out to be a good camera, taking exceptional night shots. We were not automatically credited with the difference, we had to ask for it and when we did get the credit it was for about half of what should have been credited, and when we pointed out the retail price from another supplier, the balance of the refund was credited.  Our very disappointing experience with the supplier does not reflect on Panasonic's quality product.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!!
Reviews.Author: WOW!!!
Reviews.Content: Quality Quality Quality. Well as expected from Panasonic. Thank you for an awesome camera. Took it to our honeymoon and we had no problem.

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: nittany
Reviews.Content: I enjoy not only the features of this camera, but also the quality of the pictures.  Some of the pictures taken rivals those taken from my DSLR.  The size also makes it very portable.

Reviews.Title: Not the model I wanted.
Reviews.Author: SheriRinTX "SheriTinTX"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to replace a Lumix DMC-ZS7 I already have, but which won't zoom properly any more.  So I ordered this one...it is the same model but does not have the GPS function.  Sent it back.  Stupid Panasonic...why make 2 different cameras with the same model number?

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: mark
Reviews.Content: I read about this camera at length before buying it. I have a professional camera that I take on vacations most of the time and I purchased this one as a second "point and shoot" camera to carry along with us for quick shots or to use when I did not want to carry the larger camera. I admit, some of the photos that I have taken with this camera rival the ones that I have taken with my professional camera that costs a whole lot more! It is very easy to use and has a lot of features, including the GPS. Buy an extra battery, though. The GPS does eat up the power....

Reviews.Title: Great P&S; Camera
Reviews.Author: Seth Johnson "KEHTABP"
Reviews.Content: Panasonic has really outdone itself with this little camera.  Main reason I got it was because of the built-in GPS unit.  I got tired of shooting 300 pictures on my vacation and then trying to remember where each one was taken.  This camera solves this problem.  I was also amazed at the quality of the pictures overall.  So much so that I stopped using my DSLR altogether.  I know this is an older model, but I've read that image quality went down somewhat with successive models.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix dmc-zs7 12.1
Reviews.Author: Michael  P.
Reviews.Content: I bought this used on Amazon and am so happy with it. I only paid $100 for it and am so impressed with the picture quality and the functions.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful possession
Reviews.Author: Colin Floyd
Reviews.Content: Have had this camera for at least 2 years with no issues. Takes great shots. Love the wide-angle lens. I like the manual overrides although both auto modes give good results. Very good quality. Splurged for a custom leather case only available from Japan. I do not use the GPS function much - too conscious of battery usage. This replaced a Canon - in my opinion the color in the Panasonic images have so much more life.

Reviews.Title: Great camera except for the dust/dirt that got into lens
Reviews.Author: John  Blonsick
Reviews.Content: GREAT CAMERA ... but for the bad seals on the lens housing that allowed dust/dirt to enter the lens complex ... no help from Panasonic and costs more to have it fixed than buy a new one ... and I won't.Have had the camera for 2 years now - dirt or dust has found its way into the lenses and now a constellation of black dots appear in all my pictures.Just spend some time with Panasonic "service" rep who eventually told me I have a rather pricey paperweight on my hands - I'm sorry but your product is out of warranty and even though it is an issue with the lens casing seal we are not responsible for repair. The camera was never dropped nor exposed to unusually high dust or dirt levels but still the dots are there.For a $300+ camera and the used to be good reputation of Panasonic I would have expected a better response in support of their product. Sadly, it is considered a disposable product to them as is their reputation for a quality camera.I will not buy another Panasonic product given their obvious lack of pride or support for the products they sell. Too bad because I really liked the camera before the black dots ruined every single photo - its a crap shoot - if you're lucky you either won't have any issues with the seal or you will have it when you take the camera out of the box - not after actually using it.

Reviews.Title: Low Light, Bad. Good Light, Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mongyaj "Panasonic ZS7"
Reviews.Content: This camera works great with a lot of lighting, that is it, but the HD video is ok. Also using the HD video. It shoot great but also in low light, it is bad for it. Don't shoot video under the 640x480 mode because it sux. So bad that my Fuji 640x480!!! was better. If you want a camera to use it for HD video. Buy a 99.99$ HD camera that are now available because I know it would outperform this zs7. Also to remind ya. Dust collect inside the lens and cannot be remove. If more dust are collected. It will cause the auto focus error, and would make your zs7 camera render-useless... Mine is like that now. I will have to open it up and see how it goes from there. If this camera was market for 99.99$. I would rate it four.half star. Most online has dis-continued this item. My Fuji camera is 7 years old now and still operational. Bottom-line, the ZS7 shoot great photo's under normal or great lighting. The Zs7 shoot nice HD video under normal or great lighting only. Anything lower than the HD. BAD!!! But don't use auto. Use m mode so ISO can fix some of my problem which I have not try it.

Reviews.Title: Love it till iPhone 4S
Reviews.Author: Michelle "mishmish74"
Reviews.Content: I wish they would make a decent upgrade. This was my favorite camera till I got spoiled on the quick speed of the iPhone camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: NikBoston
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing this camera, I already own an SLR but wanted something easier to travel with. This camera takes great pictures and I'm very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Design flaw
Reviews.Author: C. Steven "genki-denki"
Reviews.Content: It was a good camera for a couple of years, then dust began accumulating behind the lenses. It seems that this is a common problem with this line of cameras. Dust might be brought into the camera from the sides of the barrel as it retracts. Removing the dust is a tedious dis-assembly process.

Reviews.Title: Couple years into ownership and still love it.
Reviews.Author: CMinRichVA
Reviews.Content: Had a Zs3 prior to this and lost it :(  Bought this on Amazon a couple of years back and must say this camera takes GREAT photos and is rugged.  HD vids are amazing as well.

Reviews.Title: Not yet ready for knowledgeable rating
Reviews.Author: lwilly
Reviews.Content: 5 stars go to the shipper; (hello_reader) for the very fast shipping of this camera!  It came super fast as I wasn't even looking for it at the soonest, Apr 4th, but it was in my mailbox on the 28th of Mar!  Nicely packed in the original box w/everything they said was there.  One very very minor scuff on the very top of the right side.  (Used)Camera really looks and feels nice. Only had it for a day so figuring it out is going to be major for me!  No prior experience with such a versatile P&S; so many things are going to be a struggle but that's what I wanted.  The settings even I can comprehend, auto everything, and also many things I'll have fun learning after time.  I don't think I'm getting just how to open up some of the menus yet as I've seen screens in the manual, (which I hate by the way), (very confusing because it refers to more than 1 camera)!!! so I really don't even know if they pertain to my camera!  Hopefully, someone, w/some kind of influence in that way of thinking, will straighten that fiasco out!  Anyways..time will tell whether or not I'll use this forever or I'll just get frustrated and trade it for something less technical.  I could stand to have been born a couple of generations later, maybe I'd understand a whole lot more and much quicker! :(

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: Bob W Bailey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reviewing several point and shoot cameras.  It is lightweight, easy to carry and the rechargeable battery lasts a long time.  I don't use all the various functions and generally use it as a basic point and shoot camera for grandkid shots.  I shoot action shots of kids playing sport using the zoom and I use the flash and close up mode.  I have had good results and am happy with the camera.  The shutter speed is better than most lightweight point and shoot cameras I have tried but still not as fast as the larger digital 35 mm Canon and other brands. But for lightweight, ease of use, batter life and good pictures it is a good buy.  It is very easy to carry in your pocket.  While I have a smart phone I rather use the Lumix for times I know I am going to be taking pictures such as sporting events or Disney World.

Reviews.Title: Still my favorite camera
Reviews.Author: Vicki C Swartz
Reviews.Content: I can slip the camera into my coat pocket and go all day without recharging the battery. No matter how many pictures I take the battery never fails me.  Pictures are sharp and colors are true.  I have received many favorable compliments on the pictures I have taken.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Haerting
Reviews.Content: It makes the best photos I have made with a simple point and shoot camera. The standard approaches and in some instances surpasses my large cameras. (only caveat: do not drop, it wil brake.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMV-zs7 digital camera
Reviews.Author: chuckn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife, we take it on all of our trips. It takes great pictures and has a rechargable battery which makes it very convenient.

Reviews.Title: My go to camera
Reviews.Author: Edgar A. De Jesus "eadejesus"
Reviews.Content: I have used and abused this camera and I have taken it to the beach and have carried this mountain biking.  It still works.  Love the optical zoom.  12x means I can take pictures without the subject knowing I'm taking pictures of them.The body is already corroded from the sweat from my hands, but there's not damage as to the function and the crispness of the shots.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice.
Reviews.Author: osu69
Reviews.Content: Brought this as a gift and he really enjoyed it. He is 15 so needed something simple to work. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Setternut
Reviews.Content: My husband hunts with our Setters and he loves the size of this camera to take with him.  It takes good pictures and the size is such that he can hang it from his belt on a case or tuck it into a pocket to use quickly.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic loses another customer...
Reviews.Author: LocalHero
Reviews.Content: The camera, when working is pretty good.  I loved the 12x optical zoom and thought picture quality was very good when shooting in good light.  It suffered a bit in low light situations but I learned to live with that.Like several other reviewers here, my camera stopped working right as the 1yr warranty expired.
