I got Panasonic to replace it with a refurb camera but only after repeated phone calls and some bitching, and now 8 months after they sent me the replacement, it too has stopped working with the same "system focus error" message.It wasn't too expensive ($200 or so at Costco) and would be well worth that if it would last, but as it stands I'll be looking to another brand for a replacement...

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: D. Merritt
Reviews.Content: I haven't had any problems with this camera. A great point and shoot that does 720p video as well. I have made DVD's from the video that looks great on my 40" Sony widescreen.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Penny
Reviews.Content: Love the zoom though I am not very technical I can still take good pictures.  I'm sure there are more features to explore.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Jorge Jimenez
Reviews.Content: Excelente cámara, con un lente de primera, fotos de gran calidad y con un sistema inteligente que permite seleccionar el mejor enfoque para un resultado mejor. Me siento muy complacido con el producto.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME camera
Reviews.Author: cold in the dakotas "book hound"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. It takes great pictures and is easy to use. I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent optics, great manual mode with very long exposure possibility, but severely under-powered flash
Reviews.Author: Dancing Feet
Reviews.Content: This would be my perfect camera except for the fact that the flash is unuseable for over 6 ft (2 m). Forget about taking any group pictures in non-daylight settings over this distance without software brightening later (with consequent image quality loss in other areas). Exposure compensation does not help at all in flash mode. This is a real shame a really bad decision on the part of the designers. I've had much more compact and cheaper cameras from Nikon and Casio that were useable to double that distance, i.e., 4 times the light output (in the case of the Nikon)!Aside from this (major for me) limitation, it's an exceptionally good camera. The optics are better than any other compact camera I've had (it's is not super-compact, but reasonable considering the optics). I REALLY like the fact that it's much wider angle that most cameras at the widest angle setting, which makes it much more useful when you're struggling to get everything in, especially for videos.The manual mode allows exposures to 60 seconds; I've taken photos of a starlit sky and can see stars on the photo that were invisible to the naked eye! Really like this feature.ACVHD video mode was not useful to me--can't find software to play it back properly and needs a lot of CPU to decode which makes the video stutter. But if you're willing to play back on the camera and connect to a TV, it works fine. But the standard non-ACVHD modes are fine for my purpose.GPS was also not useful to me (it tagged family wedding photos with that of a cemetery some distance away because that's where it last locked to a satellite ...) and drains the battery unnecessarily. Battery life is otherwise very good though.

Reviews.Title: Camera basically died just at around 12 months
Reviews.Author: The Judge
Reviews.Content: It one day decided to give Zoom Error or Focus errors and when it did boot up everything was fuzzy. Spent days trying to use online troubleshooting tips to no avail. Prob the last time I buy a panasonic camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Nature Photos, but Photos of People look Terrible
Reviews.Author: Dmitriy Zasyatkin
Reviews.Content: There is something about the color processing on this camera that makes the photos of people look terrible, compared to a Cannon. We have tried all the different settings, but I could still never get the photos to come out looking like the ones take by my Cannon camera.We have gotten some stunning photos of nature, like colorful birds, that I was amazed by, but I wouldn't recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Bought it cause it was on-sale and I thought I would use it.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Gribble
Reviews.Content: Well, I'm writing this review well-over a year after the purchase and I will admit I didn't end up using this camera that often. However, from my limited use of the camera, I'd say it was an alright digital camera for the average consumer. My main gripe was with the battery life which was terrible. It's performance seemed only alright, as well.

Reviews.Title: Product Review
Reviews.Author: Just Another Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera.  I only take pictures here and there, but for that end, it does an excellent job.  The auto functionality makes it simple to take great quality photos.  Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good surprise!
Reviews.Author: Flavio
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to my father and it was a very good choice. At the time of the purchase I was looking for a camera which can fulfil the basics and for a reasonable price, but this product really exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: When life hands you a lemon
Reviews.Author: JP Toon
Reviews.Content: My Panasonic Lumix DMC ZS7 was only a camera for fourteen months.  Now it's a paperweight.  After 14 months of fairly easy duty, with no excessive exposure to moisture and/or no accidental drops or shocks to the camera, it's auto-focus feature has stopped working.  A very expensive paperweight.

Reviews.Title: Great camera until it broke a couple of months after warranty expired
Reviews.Author: kottobahn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Costco for a reasonable price after comparing several different manufacturers and deciding this was the superior choice. The camera took great pictures and was easy to use. I was very happy with it. At my daughter's graduation the camera's lense began to stop functioning. I could hear the motor turning and trying to retract and extend the lense but the lense wouldn't respond. I then received an error message on the camera screen stating there was an error and to restart the camera which did not resolve the issue. I called Panasonic and they said it was out of warranty and I could have the camera exchanged for a refurbished one for $180.00 dollars. I will throw this camera in the trash and buy either a canon or a nikon.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Fred L.
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for our trip to Alaska.  Best digital camera I've ever owned and I've owned a few.  I've owned Kodax, Canon, Olympus and now this Panasonic Lumix.  I read all the reviews and I am so happy I went with this one.  NO problems with this camera whatsoever.  And it takes the greatest pictures and video.  You won't be sorry you purchased this.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, horrible "lens protector" mechanism
Reviews.Author: Maxwell S. Dunlap
Reviews.Content: This camera takes fantastic pictures. However the mechanism that covers the lens is very flimsy and can easily be pushed in touching plastic directly to the glass, in my case there was a piece of something in there and it scratched the glass element of the lens while it was in my pocket. So take care of it and keep it in a case or something. Redesign the lens protector and you've got a 5 star camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas D.
Reviews.Content: I just got this simple to use camera yesterday.  I took snapshots all day and there is only one conclusion: excellentThis camera has all the option s to choose from , easy dial for personal choice and preference. The camera is simple to use, just press record and it starts filming. This is not a camera that only professionals understand. On the easy to use display you can see the results immediately. Well, I am not going to say more about it. It is so far the best camera I ever had!

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera
Reviews.Author: chold
Reviews.Content: I'm certainly no camera expert but this little camera is everything and MORE than I need. Everytime someone sees the pics or uses it, they want one just like it. My Mom played around w/ it last fall when we were in Bar Harbor,ME and she said "I want one". I really wanted to buy one just like it for her but I really couldn't afford to, these are very expensive. There are other digital camera out there w/ more powerful zooms which means a lot to me but I also have a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ28 which has,I believe, an 18x zoom. Although I have a bigger more powerful Lumix than the DMC-ZS7, I use the DMC-ZS7 more often just because of the compact-ness and portability of it. It even has a GPS on it! But be aware when using the GPS it uses more of the battery so I rarely use it, but it's there if I want. It has way more features than I need but I love it. I've had Sony, Kodak, Fuji, Minolta (not digital) and a couple other name brands I can't seem to remember and I am sooo partial to the Panasonic Lumix cameras. Keep in mind, I'm not an expert on cameras, I just love to take photos and want good quality ones!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: bhd
Reviews.Content: this thing was great for long distance shooting, small, fits in pocket. unfortunately it didnt survive a dip in the ocean!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, no support
Reviews.Author: Melinda
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, but I needed to reinstall the operating system for it (to transfer video to my Mac) and couldn't find the DVD that came with it.  When I went to Panasonic's website for support and typed in the model number, the result was "NO RESULTS FOUND".  I just spent an hour on their website trying to find some way of getting a replacement DVD and finally dinged them on Twitter in the hopes of getting some sort of response, but I'm not hopeful. Seriously, when you visit a manufacturers website and a search of their own model # gets no results, it doesn't exactly inspire confidence. Based on this frustrating experience, my next camera will not be a Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Joseph Jackson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend and she absolutely loved it.  she didn't find anything wrong with it.  Loved the pictures it took.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom and pictures but video sometimes show vertical streaks
Reviews.Author: Happy r/c
Reviews.Content: PROS:- 25x zoom at the lower 5megs photos.- fast burst shootingCONS:- vertical streaks when shooting bright contrast areas like facing the sun.- Shutter lag is very slow from the time you turn it on to the time that you can start shooting video that you missed the events that you want to capture.- indoor pictures are dark compared to SONY11/1/2010 UPDATE: My ZS3 LCD screen lasted a year so Panasonic replaced it by giving me this new ZS7.8/1/2012 UPDATE: The ZS7 lens cover malfunctioned after a year so I just ripped out the lens cover so I can use the camera.  Next, the ZS7 screen now shows a black spot on the left side of the screen which shows up in my videos.  Seems Panasonic is not reliable anymore. My first Panasonic LC-33 lasted 6 years, ZS3 lasted 1 year, ZS7 lasted 2 years.8/15/2012 UPDATE: I bought a SONY HX20V with 20x optical zoom and super low light ability at 12k ISO instead of Panasonic's 3k ISO.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, good value refurbished equipment shipping was as promised. Only had this camera a short time but so far so good

Reviews.Title: Lovin' this camera!
Reviews.Author: shyannie51
Reviews.Content: A friend had this camera, and all her pictures looked like postcards, so I bought one of my own.  I have NOT been disappointed.  The colors are accurate, the pictures are sharp, the depth of field is wonderful. I took some pics of flowers around the neighborhood and when I got them printed, I had to sign a form stating that I took the pictures myself, and that they were not pictures I took of professional photographs! The automatic focus tracking feature is pretty amazing. Focus once on an object and the camera follows it, keeping it in focus if it moves. There are lots of features I haven't explored yet, but all the basics are great. Just what I wanted in a point and shoot. I read a lot of reviews for the Lumix models and was convinced that this one was the best. I think I was right. Great little camera. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: expect to replace it in a year
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I've owned one for about a year.  It had met expectations well; compact, nice zoom, image stabilization helped but wasn't perfect, controls, once you got used to them were fairly easy to navigate.  liked using grid to compose pictures.  took ~ 6000 pictures with it; most of the pictures came out nicely.  even bought extra batteriesunfortunately this past month, I noticed a dark patch in one corner of the pictures and LCD.  it is worse while max zoom.  I cleaned the outside of the lens several times.  finally checked web and it turned out that the camera is "dirty" on the inside, with dust on the sensor.  How it got there, unknown because the lens is sealed.Panasonic service no help; barely returned an automated e-mail.....unless I am shooting a dark picture, now every picture shows the smudge, in some way or another.  I am now looking to buy another camera for my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Hans "-Pete"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera. It takes pictures as good if not better than my Nikon D60, but is much smaller and easier to use.

Reviews.Title: Best camera under $300 I have ever seen
Reviews.Author: Kristofer L. Takach
Reviews.Content: For under $250, this camera has TONS of features.  I have taken over a 1000 pics with this camera and under 3% of them are NOT of excellent quality.  I have taken pics at night, in sun, close up, far away all beautiful.  It makes taking beautiful pictures idiot proof.  My only small issue is you have a wait a few seconds before snapping another photo.  Oh well, i still wouldn't trade this camera for the world.

Reviews.Title: automatic lens cover broke after 8 months, second time
Reviews.Author: AZFAST1
Reviews.Content: great camera to use, but second camera to break automatic lens cover, wont open which makes it not able to be used, takes 10 days from reciept of replacement center in Texas, not a friendly process if you need a camera fixed on a time constraint, requiring you to buy another camera

Reviews.Title: Pay a little more for a better camera!
Reviews.Author: Vikki
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for about 6 months now. I had a Cannon that finally went out after 4 years so I decided to get something more up to technology. I did about a month of homework and decided that this was the one. Read many reviews, saw about 10 out of 100 that was negative so I figured, hey even out the odds right? Needless to say.... after a few months I HATE this camera. GPS is off half the time so don't get too happy about that. Picture qty isn't something that will wow you. My sister n laws $60 camera takes better qty pictures. Video sucks so bad. Esp. if its dark it makes it even worse. After the reviews I read and research I done, I am very disappointed in this camera. Does what a camera is meant for but for the pic, video, GPS & zoom quality... get something better if your going to pay this much already. I have to live w/this camera but cant wait till I get a replacement!

Reviews.Title: Camera not new
Reviews.Author: Biff Henderson
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is quite good as one of the best of the "pocket super-zoom" cameras, a category Panasonic invented. Overall better than the ZS-10 which is the newer model.Be aware, however, that at this point this product is not new but returned stock. Condition appears new but clearly repackaged, potentially refurbished, though the description does not say so.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Camera and Value
Reviews.Author: Online Junkie
Reviews.Content: When I was shopping for a new P&S;, I wanted HD Video and I wasn't deterred over the 720p video versus the successor model, the ZS8. I was more interested in getting a low price and when Amazon lowered the price to $199, I jumped on the deal.The image quality is excellent, the Image Stabilization works great and 12mp is plenty... more than my Nikon D200's 10mp which is also plenty of megapixels. Now, I hardly use my D200 away from home.The only annoying issue as mentioned by others is that occasionally I activate the video function by accident. Otherwise, this camera functions beautifully.Interestingly, the ZS7 is higher rated than the newer ZS8 and the ZS7 is selling for more than the newer model and even used, the prices are higher than the amount I paid. This is definitely a sign of a great camera.I have to admit, I did drop my camera about 4ft onto a concrete sidewalk and there was no visible scratches and it performs as new. I bought a Lowe Rezo 50 padded case instead of the smaller 30 which some complained of the 30 being too small. The Rezo 50 works fine, but the flap on the case is a bit bizarre. Love this camera and would buy it again and I did recommend it to a friend and she bought one too!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Patrick Perkins "Prism24"
Reviews.Content: I have had this about a year now and I am not a professional photographer, but this camera works great for me. It has a lot of settings that you can tweak. I just leave it on auto and it does a pretty good job. The movies it records come out great but the record button is kinda hard to get to, so also check the icon to make sure you pushed it. Battery life is OK, but it takes a special battery, that is its only drawback really.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera, and the GPS is fun...
Reviews.Author: Benjamin M. Bethel "Owner/General Manager - T...
Reviews.Content: I'm a panasonic fan... I love this camera, my favorite Lumix yet - I get a new one about every year.  The GPS is great, I just went on vacation to Japan, and seeing the pic locations on Picasa is wonderful.  No other problems with this camera.  I never care about megapixels, as I save pics at either 2 or 5 megapixel settings, I never print pictures, but what I do care about is wide angle lenses and low light capability... and this does a great job at both!

Reviews.Title: video playback
Reviews.Author: Jaise
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great camera, excellent daytime photos and should be great value for money. Viewing still photos is not a problem.The point interest to make, is this camera has the ability to zoom in and zoom out in video mode as well still photos, most cameras do not have this function. My biggest issue is that i can not easily view the HD motion video i have recorded. I have not yet been able to view any videos i have made with this camera. Lack of software for viewing recorded video's is this cameras only fault.

Reviews.Title: Professional Camera in a Pocket
Reviews.Author: Phil King
Reviews.Content: I shoot professionaly for monthly Old City Life Magazine, and have a new book out filled with quality pictures. This camera is excellent for both wide angles and telephoto needs. I can shoot a church with a high steeple with the 26mm equivalent wide zoom or take distant wild life shots with the 300mm equivalent telephoto zoom, all without changing a lens. Plus the image stabilization is wonderful. I am continually amazed at the sharp vibrant colors produced by the Leica lens and advanced electronics. This camera has served me well. Unless you want to impress people with the size of your lens and name on your Nikon, this camera is great. One problem I have found it the video button in a bad place. It can start a video which can interupt regular shooting. tape over the red button is important.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rivero ".:DRH:."
Reviews.Content: I haven't tested it very well yet, but so far I'm satisfied with this camera. This camera was one of the few options I had because I wanted a camera with GPS. I'm very bad for remembering names so is a big plus for me to have a camera with GPS and moreover, a camera with a build-in database of 500.000 famous places around the world.The picture quality is good, the stabilization system has improved compared to older models of Panasonic cameras I have had. The GPS works well in open spaces. The menus are easy to navigate and it has plenty of options to take pictures and videos as well as some nice editing features for pictures. The Zoom is great, its 12X go beyond the current limit of most cameras of this size. The battery looks small but I think it would last at least 200 shots.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: droth
Reviews.Content: I wanted something relatively small with a superzoom feature.  This is only a little bigger than a pocket 3x zoom but has 12x zoom which works great! the newer version is even better with a 14 or 16 x zoom.  The pictures are very good and all the automatic modes work well. Would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: fabulous panasonic camera
Reviews.Author: cindys
Reviews.Content: fabulous camera-always had canon cameras-but always wanted leica lens-and the best part is the gps-just returned from antigua with some beautiful photos (450)!!

Reviews.Title: Wonderfull
Reviews.Author: Arma71 "arn..."
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product, meet my expectations. Excellent image quality, easy to handle and a powerful zoom. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: excelente camara por el precio
Reviews.Author: Roberto Salazar
Reviews.Content: La camara panasonic-lumix DMC-ZS7 es excelente en su desempeño, no soy un fotografo profesional pero por el precio pagado certifico que es una camara de alta calidad.Compre la camara en amazon junto con una memoria de 16 Gb transcend SD (la cual es reconocida por la camara sin ningun problema) mas una pila adicional de litio Maximal power para panasonic DMW-BCG10E de 1000 mAh esta pila funciona muy bien con la camara y es reconocida por el software de la camara panasonic DMC-ZS7 sin ningun problema.Los tres articulos comprados camara mas memoria 16 GB mas pila de litio maximal power funcionan muy bien.Excelente compra efectuada en amazon

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: BAX
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon 40d with a back pack and couple telephoto lens with flash.  I needed a camera I can take with ease on my Honda Gold Wing while touring.  This Panasonic camera was just the trick.  It does most everything I was looking for in a small package.  It also has a GPS feature which I can use with my apeture apple program to edit my photos. I haven't had time to learn everything yet!  But, looks like the perfect package for me.

Reviews.Title: BEST CAMERA EVER !!
Reviews.Author: H. Ponte
Reviews.Content: Best camera i ever owned !!Not the smallest but best quality and zoom is amazing - this is my 3rd - dropped first in sand :( second gave to dad - who loves it also !! Would never buy any other !

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Sunkey1
Reviews.Content: Purchased this just prior to vacation and love it so far.  Am still learning about all the features and having fun with it.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: PS
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best cameras I had. I love the quality of the pictures. I love the ease of use. The close ups are great for this little camera. It is great!

Reviews.Title: Excelente Camara
Reviews.Author: Cris
Reviews.Content: Tuve un modelo anterior a la lumix ZS7 y volvì a comprar la misma, solo que este modelo agrega GPS y algun otro atributo màs. Es una excelente càmara, alta calidad de fotos y videos, un zoom òptico x 12 y lo màs importante: gran angular!!! lo que permite sacar excelentes fotos de interiores . Lente LEIKA, que està posicionado como uno de los mejores. No mucho màs para decirles, simplemente una maravilla!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: It is the best camera that I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: daisymae
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed using this camera so far, and we have bought it for vacation so we will see how things go then.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with camera
Reviews.Author: Marceronm
Reviews.Content: Camera is very good quility and takes very good pictures.  Easy to to take with you on a trip.  We are happy with the overall purchase.

Reviews.Title: Quality Pictures
Reviews.Author: Baobabas "doodayDoo"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Mom because she really liked mine (the same unit) and she's enjoying taking pictures with it.  The pictures are  very clear.  For a good price, i think this was business done well.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic improves on a winner!
Reviews.Author: JitenG "Technophile"
Reviews.Content: Panasonic has done a great job putting a plethora of useful featuresincluding the 12x optical zoom and 12MP into such a sleek body. We had theolder TZ-1 which had a 10x zoom and was much bulkier. It also had a plasticlens cap which was kinda cheesy. This model does away with that and shutsautomatically when the power is turned off. In the previous model the modedial had to be turned in order to shoot a movie but this one has a separatemovie record button on the back that makes it easy to start shooting rightaway- good move Panasonic! The gps is also really handy for travelers andcan take the guesswork out of where the pic was taken. The quality ofpictures are excellent and the 720p movies are cleaner than many minidvvideo cameras. The battery life is decent but I did buy an extra battery forthose long trips outdoors. So far we love this camera- it does everything weneed and does it well!!!!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Nelson1
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that I could use automatically, as well as manually. I haven't used the manual side of the camera, (have a class starting soon), but the automatic pctures have been excellent.  Love the zoom. Low light pictures have really turned out nice.

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot I've ever tried.
Reviews.Author: Arvinder
Reviews.Content: I bought this because a coworker recommended it.  I also read a lot of reviews and settled on this one.  I have not been sorry.  The camera is great at everything.  The zoom is amazing.  The intelligent mode is excellent.  The HD video quality is great for a point and shoot.  Its not as good as my Sony HD camcorder but that was to be expected.  Static video quality is excellent.  Moving objects and fast panning don't look as good. The picture quality is excellent but not as good as a Digital SLR.  Again - this camera cost me $ 212.  The DSLR was over $600 and the HD camcorder was $1000.I love this camera because it is so portable and easy to use in all situations.  I find myself not carrying around the camcorder and DSLR because they are so much bigger and heavier.The GPS feature is actually very nice but it is not hard to add location info to pictures using software.  The GPS does drain the battery quicker so I usually only turn it on when I really need it (have to be outdoors).

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Sancho "sancho"
Reviews.Content: It has a lot of functions that others do not have (e.g., you can zoom while shooting a movie). Battery life is ok, and I could get a pair of cheaper replacement batteries that worked fine (skipping Panasonic protection):"Lumix POWER KIT DMW-BCG10 (Includes 2-1200mAh batteries and pocket charger) for the Panasonic DMC-ZS1, DMC-TZ7S, DMC-TZ7T, DMC-ZS3, DMC-ZS1K, DMC-ZS1S, DMC-ZS3, DMC-ZS3A, DMC-ZS3K, DMC-ZS3R, DMC-ZS6, DMW BCG10E, DMW BCG10P".Only con: I could not manually set the name of a location for the GPS to stamp it on the pics, and the names that it shows are sometimes wrong or non-existing.

Reviews.Title: I love my camera
Reviews.Author: St Lauren R. Kim
Reviews.Content: Great optical zoom. Size is a little bigger than other compact point and shoots but the quality is unmatched. Colors come out great, especially when there is plenty of light.

Reviews.Title: A Complete Dependable Camera
Reviews.Author: Snellville mom "Mac & Kiko's mom"
Reviews.Content: We already had this digital camera for the last 4 months. We like almost everything on this product, easy to use, nice to hold on your hands, great picture quality, and most of all is the HD video feature which is awesome!...results were smooth, vivid colors, cristal clear and you can zoom it with full auto focus (we had our last 2 digital Sony cameras with not so great video capability). This camera is also loaded with features like the GPS tagging that I'm still not very familiar with. Otherwise, this is a complete all you need digital point & shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: FZ 40
Reviews.Author: William V. Gale
Reviews.Content: Camera is terrific. Great photo's great video, excellent image stabilization, nice feel. Wonderful camera, especially for the price. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: A quality camera
Reviews.Author: Henry Santana
Reviews.Content: Solidly built with easy to use controls. Feature rich which includes GPS. The only thing I would have wanted that it doesn't have is an EVF, even at the expense of smaller LCD. The flash is weak, range is a about 5' but useable for flash fill. The macro is spectacular. The recomended case is not very good, too small and has no room for a spare battery. A good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Lumix difference
Reviews.Author: Caner
Reviews.Content: High quality Lumix lens allows to take quality pictures. Its very easy to use and direct video recording button is a good feature. In other words highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: Quality in a small package
Reviews.Author: Bob Le Knob "RTK"
Reviews.Content: I own a Sony A100 DSLR and a Canon EOS 650 film SLR, but since we are planning to go to Britain this spring for a wedding, I wanted to buy a compact point and shoot digital camera so that I wouldn't be taking up weight allotment on the flight with a full size camera with its compliment of lenses and also, not to drag same around London and a wedding. I also didn't want to trade off too much quality and capacity for the sake of convenience. In the Panasonic Lumix ZS7, I believe I have found a good compromise. By comparison, it weighs almost nothing and is small enough to be carried in the palm of my hand. The picture quality it has produced is excellent. The zoom capacity and focal length is more than adequate for my purposes. The 25mm equivalent wide angle is better than most regular lenses as is the 300mm equivalent telescopic length. It has more bells and whistles than I'll probably ever use, but the flexibility of its controls is outstanding. If I have any criticisms, it would be that the zoom mechanism is not very easy to control, but that may improve with practice and I would have like to have had a viewfinder in addition to the LCD moniter.One criticism I have of Panasonic, but is also applicable to other tech companies these days is that they do not supply a paper, in depth, operating manual. You must either rely on going to your computer and downloading it, or taking an hour and a sheaf of paper to print it from the download. And then, you are stuck with this unwieldy stack of 8x11 paper instead of a compact, bound manual that you can carry anywhere. Also, I understand that it is financially beneficial to Panasonic, but I wish that they had not made the power source (Battery) and USB ports proprietary. If either is lost or damaged, you don't always have the option of buying Panasonic products.After all is said and done, the Lumix ZS7 is probably the best choice in its price range of digital point and shoot cameras.

Reviews.Title: Happy camper!
Reviews.Author: Bunny
Reviews.Content: Extremely happy with the camera. Picture quality is out of this world! A little heavy so can't really call it a compact, but the features over shadow everything. Best in its class I'd say!

Reviews.Title: John
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic DMC-ZS7 was delivered quickly, and with all advertized components. The camera is awesome in so many ways. The photo quality in adequate light is outstanding. The low light photo quality has some grainyness, but you can control the ISO which improves quality (albeit a darker image is the result). The manual controls are many. I especially like the high speed setting (max resolution of 3 MP) which makes catching that quick shot very easy. The video quality set at 720p looks groovy on my 48 inch HDTV. The GPS hasn't yet locked onto a satelitte at our house, so I can't comment on that feature. The 3 inch LCD has a setting to brighten the screen in direct sunlight. This LCD has 460,000 pizels which has twice the resolution of most camera LCDs. The images on the LCD are true eye candy!PROS: Small, versatile point and shot that fits snuggly into your shirt pocket.  Excellent picture and video quality with good lighting; modest picture  in low light settings. Great manual control options (once you get over the  slight learning curve). Superior high speed shots with emphasis on either  speed or image quality.Cons: Although other reviews have rated the battery life as short, I played with  the camera non-stop for about 2 hours (images and video), and the battery  still had 1 of 3 bars remaining. The GPS has some difficulty locking onto  a satelitte signal, which makes this feature a challenge to use.Bottom Line: You will not be sorry you bought this camera.

Reviews.Title: beautiful HD video for YouTube but editing software does little
Reviews.Author: Canyon Birder
Reviews.Content: We are using this point & shoot for uploading video to YouTube and we've had a steep learning curve with using the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 HD video for a few reasons. 1. The non-printed manual that's included is hard to read, complicated, sketchy and not written in an intuitive fashion. 2. The video management software, Photo Fun Studio 5.1 only allows the user to clip out parts of the video. It does not even have a function for combining clips together. 3. The HD video recorded by this camera (and the mpeg2 conversions that PhotofunStudio can produce) are too complex for video editing software like Windows Movie Maker.  This then requires acquisition of new software to deal with the videos produced by this camera.In conclusion, we are using this camera for digiscoping (photographing through telescope) and it works fine and does take beautiful photos and video that we are happy with but the video editing is taking away the fun & usefulness of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Very good pic/k
Reviews.Author: Lippi
Reviews.Content: Looked for a camera that will remind me where I've been. The GPS is accurate showing coordinates but fails to find the right name of each location. Comparing to an added feature it's quite the same quality.The photo quality is excellent though I use 5M only, the stabilizer works as expected and the menu is very easy to handle.a bit heavy for it's size. Very happy with the HD video and the ease of direct connection to computer or TV.

Reviews.Title: Video Notes
Reviews.Author: Jon B
Reviews.Content: First of all, I agree with all of the positive comments about this camera's ability to take still photos.  Here, I wanted to add my experience recording and editing video.I bought an 8GB class 10 SDHC memory card on Amazon for about $12.I use Corel Video Studio X2 to edit videos and write them to DVDs.After trying the various settings for AVCHD and Motion JPEG, I obtained the best results with AVCHD using the Low setting.  This setting produces about 60 minutes of 720p HD video on a 4GB card.I tried using the Pansonic software to copy the video files to my PC but found that the software caused the video to studder.  On the positive side, well, the supplied software has no positive side and is not needed anyway.Finally, I imported the AVCHD files directly from the camera to my PC using Video Studio's import function.From this point on, Video Studio allowed me to edit, render (for DVDs, not needed for Blu-Ray) and burn.This camera really allows you to take good quality photos and video.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is as good as my DSLR
Reviews.Author: C. Xiao
Reviews.Content: Got the camera yesterday and tried it out right away. The picture quality was amazing and very close to my Nikon D5000 DSLR. My kid loved it and I'll borrow it for some occasions.Nothing to complain at this point for such a wonderful compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Only one minor problem
Reviews.Author: Mary Shellenberger
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.....easy to use takes great pictures.  I went on a cruise and the pictures I took looked wonderful.  Only problem is you have to be careful not to cover the flash with your finger when taking a photo.  I took lots of pictures without the flash and they looked great too.

Reviews.Title: A State-of-the-Art Gem
Reviews.Author: Mel C. "Mel Paris"
Reviews.Content: I replaced my Canon Surehot with this Lumix.  It's smaller, more functional and takes much better quality photos.  I have a digital SLR that the Lumix does not replace.  However, for a point and shoot, it is terrific.

Reviews.Title: I really love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Kay E. Rikhof
Reviews.Content: The responce time of this camera is much quicker than other cameras I've had. The picture quality is super.I photograph children often and they are so quick to move and change expression that catching the moment isoften difficult. This camera makes the job much more satisfying.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: jlmcguire
Reviews.Content: It does everything it says, except taking 300 pictures on a charge- if you use it a lot, I would get a couple of extra batteries- see my other reviews for a good deal. Other than that, it takes great pictures, I leave the flash off all the time, and the pictures are outstanding

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera
Reviews.Author: Oliviasgma
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for the money. Gave it to my daughter for Christmas. The original purchase was defective and I received a new one immediately without any hassle. The new one worked perfectly and my daughter is very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Photos Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: George Washington
Reviews.Content: It's been a pleasure using this camera.  I am thrilled with the photo quality, speed of camera, portability and ease of uploading photos.  I would recommend this to anyone wanting something with a good zoom and great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for travel
Reviews.Author: Sara Oliveira
Reviews.Content: I loved my Panasonic ZS7 camera, is perfect!!! If you are looking a compact digital camera for travel, you have to buy this camera. The leica lens produces a high quality image or picture, the videos have a great performance with hd video.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable little camera
Reviews.Author: S. McMath "Macpix"
Reviews.Content: I haven't taken a lot of pictures yet with this camera, and have yet to adequately exploit exposure compensation, but for the size and price it's pretty remarkable. Add in the capacity to shoot HD video, and it's amazing.So far I have only shot mpeg video, because my computer doesn't have the capacity to edit HD, but the mpeg is pretty good. Powerful stuff for a camera I can carry in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: Excelent value for money
Reviews.Author: Adriano Maccari
Reviews.Content: Excelent point and shoot camera and also with lots of setup possibilites. Performs well even in low light conditions. Good construction and body. Excelent video recording. I don't like the dedicated button to switch between play and shoot, it could be on the on/off button (three options:off/play/shoot).

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS7 Camera Review
Reviews.Author: calcareer
Reviews.Content: This camera has one of the longest zooms in the point and shoot category. With the addition of HD video, is hard to beat when compared to others in this category. The full zoom can also be used in the video mode. The Leica lens provides excellent picture quality in all modes. I also purchased one of these cameras for my son and one for my daughter and they are amazed with versatility and quality of this device.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: CharmedOne
Reviews.Content: I don't know much about photography and how the quality of the photos should be. But our old camera is a Kodak Easyshare which is 4-5 years old. We rely much on our phone cameras which is not that great either. I don't also know how long it should take you before you charge your battery again.Not every single photo of the camera is perfect. I took some crappy ones. But I know that it has a lot to do with me than the camera. The automatic mode is awesome. The manual settings are just right.The GPS does drains out battery. But you can definitely set it to OFF. I have the battery fully charged Christmas, took around 300 photos, played around it a bit, New year came, then January 8th took some pictures at a Baptism when the battery ran out. It's just always a good thing to have a back up.I am very happy just to have a camera with so little lag b/w saving the pictures to the memory card. A camera with a fantastic zoom. And a camera which takes nice photos and videos of my children!

Reviews.Title: my new camera
Reviews.Author: bigM
Reviews.Content: I really like the new TZ7 panasonic lumix point and shoot camera.  It is smaller and lighter than my TZ3 and the quality of the pictures is much better.  It even takes great pictures in dark settings.  I will be traveling with it this this month and look forward to a good performance as well.

Reviews.Title: Magic Man
Reviews.Author: Maria Mannarino
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 is a great solid camera, and I am very pleased with it. The large 3-inch screen is a plus and easily takes wide angle photos. The Intelligent Auto mode makes it easy to shoot photos with mininum effort.  The 12x optical zoom lens is very impressive on this compact camera, and the advanced video recording is stunning.

Reviews.Title: Lighter and better
Reviews.Author: Lucia Romero "LR"
Reviews.Content: It is a bit slimmer than the previous model, and also a little lighter.The GPS feature would drain your battery ultra fast. Not really a great feature, because if you do not remember where you took a picture, it is because the place was not that memorable.The video quality is very good and for concerts the stereo sound is excellent.

Reviews.Title: It's hard to find a better camera that fits in your pocket
Reviews.Author: Francis Tapon
Reviews.Content: PROS:- Fits in the pocket (without a lot of wiggle room).- x12 optical zoom.- Can take photos with 15-60 second exposure.- Excellent value.CON:- I wish when you select the self-timer, the interface lets you easily pick "take 3+ photos in succession." Instead, you have to pick the Burst mode along with the time. It's a minor inconvenience.CONCLUSION: We'd all love to have a camera that fits in our pocket and takes photos like a $5,000 SLR. Most people who whine against this camera aren't being reasonable or realistic. Picking a camera is about compromise and trade-offs. The good news is that with this one, there are few trade-offs considering the price and size.

Reviews.Title: Lives Up To All Expectations
Reviews.Author: BKB
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with picture quality and incredible optical zoom function. Was surprised to discover GPS feature included with camera. Don't recall it being mentioned in product description. Really enjoy large viewing screen that remains clear even in bright sunlight.  All 'round terrific value.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: stacy.mckinney
Reviews.Content: Keeping it short. Great camera!!!! Operation is easy and good quality pictures and video. Best camera i had yet small enough to put in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great bit of Gear
Reviews.Author: Bigga
Reviews.Content: I found this camera excellent particularly the GPS function once it is set up. The pictures are fantastic and clear whether the subject is still or moving.

Reviews.Title: Perfect pocket camera
Reviews.Author: J. Smith
Reviews.Content: The combination of picture quality, size, features and ease of use make this the perfect camera for vacations, parties or any time you need a high quality snapshot or video. Favorite features are image stabilization and face tracking. No optical view finder but the large view screen is very bright. GPS feature is a great way to tag photos. Love the built in lens cap. Fits in my pants pocket. Buy an extra battery.

Reviews.Title: An excellent option for your day by day!
Reviews.Author: Mocita
Reviews.Content: THis is one of the best options in digital cameras for the day by day, for all ocasions! Specially if you don't have money to buy or even enough knowledge to use all the resourses a professional camera could offer you.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Flower
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera and takes wonderful pictures! We are happy with it.  It also record HD videos and you have custom options so you can set the best way for take a picture.  It's easy to use and it's small for the zoom that it has.  It also take Panoramic photos with the same memory stick.We give this camera 2 thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Krabby Patty
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera takes great pictures and has most advanced functions of a high priced DSLR. It's also capable of naming the location where the picture was taken using GPS.

Reviews.Title: Travel Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul T De Long
Reviews.Content: The camera takes good images and is easy to use.  It does not do as well as expected when set on night images.  Had to get a 8gb chip because the 12.1 MP camera fills the 2gb fast.  The battery lasted 7 days on a recent raft trip.  We've had trouble with Cannon lens sticking in the on position and are counting on the leica lens working for many years.

Reviews.Title: DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: c-amazon
Reviews.Content: The DMC-ZS7 is an excellent camera that takes excellent pictures.  I have really enjoyed the GPS function and have found that if you leave it in airplane mode it does not use much of the battery power.  I really like bringing the pictures up in Picasa and being able to see exactly where the pictures were taken.  Once you turn the camera on it will register your gps location fairly soon after being powered up.  I have owned the camera for approximately 3 weeks and have taken many pictures and not one of them has been bad.  I have taken pictures both inside and outside.  The zoom capability on this camera is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with the purchase
Reviews.Author: Usman Mansoor
Reviews.Content: To describe in one word........AwesomeLots of improvements over TZ5 which was my previous camera.The only drawback I found is the indoor pictures quality but for that I mostly use my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: DC Converter Not Available!
Reviews.Author: D. Isburgh
Reviews.Content: I love to use this camera, but after buying it last May, I discovered that one essential part that goes with the AC Adapter is not available, and the AC Adapter cannot be used without it!  I refer to the DC Converter.  I have called the Panasonic Parts store regularly, but they just tell me that the part is under review for pricing.  I am really disappointed in Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: richwolfepfd
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to use.  Picture quality exceptional, especially when using the various scene settings.

Reviews.Title: Aperute Settings?
Reviews.Author: Oklahoma Sooner "Norm"
Reviews.Content: One of the main reasons I bought the DMC-ZS7 was so that I could use the Aperture setting to make pictures, featuring a person's face in the foreground and a blurred background.  So far, I haven't been able to get that to work.Other than the Aperture problem, I think it is going to be a very good camera and I expect to have it for a long time.

Reviews.Title: am loving loving lumix
Reviews.Author: Debra A. Kulka "debk"
Reviews.Content: Still Learning to use, the zoom helped me get my grandson at his new job, the feature that follows your subject around allowed me to keep track of him as he was jumping from one place to another This was at a very hectic grand opening in a very crowded store... I even put my pics on my facebook page... I am still in the learning process because my old camera was really old.  I purchased this one on top of another but this one makes the other camera look like a toy.  Great value.. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Problem w recorded image
Reviews.Author: martmart
Reviews.Content: I received my DMC-ZS7 just about 2 weeks ago.  I had not had much chance to use it, but in the small amount of time I've had to play with it I was quite excited about it.  Loved the extra zoom feature and the picture quality appeared to be quite nice.  Haven't actually printed any photos yet so not sure how the quality will translate to print.  Today while taking pictures I noticed a thin blue line was being included in the top center portion of the images.  After trying different settings, different memory cards, etc. I found this was occuring in all photos.  An email response from Panasonic suggested I reset the camera, and if that didn't work to send for repair.  The reset did not work.  I don't know if this is a software or a hardware issue, but now I must pay to have it shipped for a replacement.  The seller only accepts returns if within 7 days.  Also they require all warranty cards to be returned, so if you order any item be sure to save those cards and read all the fine print.  I do like the camera and hope the replacement will provide many years of trouble-free use.Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: acruzjr "acruzjr"
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon D90 and always have a point and shoot(p&s;) when I do not feel like bringing the BIG camera.  After going through several Canon p&s; cameras that broke on me, I decided to search my other options.  I read tons of the reviews here, focusing on negatives, less on the positives.  I found that people's complains and dislikes about the ZS7, did not matter to me.  Thank you to those who gave this great camera the positive reviews.  I ordered and have been playing with my ZS7 for more than a week now.  I really like it and the pictures are much sharper than my previous p&s.;  I find the night shots to be OK(mostly so-so) but still much better than previous p&s.;  Again, that is why I have the D90 for those night shots when I want better results.

Reviews.Title: A fun "spy camera"
Reviews.Author: Tennessee Grandma
Reviews.Content: This camera is a lot of fun to use, especially for "older" eyesight. You can zoom in on birds, buildings, etc and see much more detail than with normal vision.My only complaint is that the camera usage booklet needs to be downloaded and printed from your computer. Would be much nicer to actually have a little compact booklet.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for travelers
Reviews.Author: Richard D. Wolfe "Wolfman"
Reviews.Content: The Lumix ZS7 is a fully featured compact camera for photographers who like to travel as lightly as possible. The camera has a terrific zoom range and is very useful when photographing in foreign countries where a wide angle lens is often necessary. I particularly enjoy the GPS feature of the camera as it identifies where my photos were taken. I don't plan to buy another camera without GPS. Used properly, the camera provides excellent quality photos. I've posted photos on my website: [...] (Cinque Terre, French Riviera and Provence galleries)using the Lumix ZS7 and the Lumix LX3 where you can click on the "Map It" feature and see where photos using the Lumix ZS7 were taken. The video and sound capabilites of this camera are easy to use and the quality results are outstanding. I've recommended this camera to friends who have also purchased it and they are very pleased with how easy it is to use and the quality of the photos.

Reviews.Title: zs7 reveiw
Reviews.Author: mario
Reviews.Content: I am not an expert on cameras but compared to other cameras i have used the zs7 is awesome it takes very good pictures and the video quality is equally goodThe camera is also very durable, i dropped it two times once on tile floor and the second time on a concrete side walk both times the camera froze but worked like new after i took out the battery and put it back in. I also used it a lot in the rain while in mexico and on hikes took it most everywhere and is still working like new.Another bonus is the amount of features on the camera from the 16x zoom, the the shutter priority mode which helps take decent pictures at night, another cool feature is the built in gps that tells you where the picture was taking.overall i have nothing bad to say about this camera i have had it for about a month i took it on vacation and have taken around 7.5 gigs of video and pictures with this camera and its still amazing me with the pictures can take with it, if your trying to find a better camera for this price i wish you luck, but if i was you i would stop looking the zs7 is one of the best at this price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: SMG "SMG"
Reviews.Content: Purchased  Lumix DMC-ZS7 camera after reading reviews & am not disappointed. I am not a professional photographer but my pictures are awesome! The camera has a lot of features that I am still learning, but auto intelligence is for me! I did have trouble downloading video to my PC, but found after using Panasonic's software it was fine. I love the fact I can see the LCD screen in bright daylight,a feature my old Kodak could not do.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Gregory A. Stallard "Gregg"
Reviews.Content: This camera does what it says it will do.  Good small camera to carry when you do not wish to carry larger camera such as Nikon D90.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Shashank
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera.. and is really tough... I dropped it from 2nd floor on a concrete floor and it is still alive and functioning.

Reviews.Title: Excellent pocket camera
Reviews.Author: KEN BARBER
Reviews.Content: The DMC-ZS7 is an excellent pocket camera.  Photo quality is excellent and the high resolution video is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: The ultimate travel zoom
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "E W"
Reviews.Content: This is the camera I was waiting for to take the place of my camera and video recorder.It's a little big for the pocket but fits in a pouch nicely. The pictures are sharp and bright. The Optical Image Stabilization helps when using the 12X zoom keeping the image in focus without a tripod.It is a very well made camera loaded with manual and auto adjustments and with the GPS feature which is desirable when traveling.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: L. Hu
Reviews.Content: We bought this to replace a Lumix ZS3 that was stolen (apparently thieves like the camera too).  It is essentially the same great camera.  Slightly better megapixels but not really a noticable difference.  Takes amazing shots using it iA (autoset) mode so it is super simple to use, but has the option for much more control for those who desire it. The optics are really terrific.  The 12x optical (NOT digital) zoom is really crystal clear.  The movies it shoots in HD are also crystal clear and unlike most other cameras, you can use the zoom with the movie function.  Battery life is okay unless you use the GPS (new with this version) in which case it stinks.  The GPS is pretty cool though.  If you download with Picasa (maybe it works with others as well), you automatically get the google map location with it and it will pair it with a POI.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Ultra Zoom Travel Camera with GPS
Reviews.Author: Travis Good "Travis Good"
Reviews.Content: Light weight and long-range zoom are prerequisites for a travel camera but you don't want to sacrifice image quality. While not the quality of a DSLR and without RAW option, this camera produces very acceptable images. This may sound less than complimentary but as my other cameras are DSLRs, this actually speaks pretty well of the camera. What I really appreciate about the JPGs are the saturation and the lack of flaws. The 12x zoom starts at a respectable 25mm equivalent and the image stabilization makes the extreme telephoto practical to use. The blow away special feature is the built-in GPS. I've been laboriously geo tagging images for years but with this camera it's all automatic and so much fun! Admittedly the battery drain takes a toll when GPS is on all the time but with a couple after market spare batteries it's not an issue. I've really enjoyed traveling with this camera for all the reasons above but especially, because it's small, I always have it with me. And you know what they say about the "best" camera? The best camera is the one you have with you because otherwise there's no picture-taking.

Reviews.Title: Good light weight camera
Reviews.Author: dean
Reviews.Content: Great portable still camera. The zoom is a delight. I was able to take pictures of my wife from 1/2 mile away, using a tripod, and you can clearly see her face. I was pleasantly surprised by the GPS feature. I was only looking for a good pocket zoom camera, but the GPS is a neat feature. So far, it has done a good job of tagging the picture locations.  The HD videos are adequate, but the sound recording is not, and there is no ability to add an external microphone.

Reviews.Title: Impressed with my new camera!
Reviews.Author: M. T. Mallari "happytm03"
Reviews.Content: I took lots of photos with my new cameraand photos are better thanthe ones taken from my oldCanon 7megapixel camera.I love it and it is very easyto do point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: One of the best compact camera.
Reviews.Author: J. hui
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a compact camera with decent video recording, this is one of the best.

Reviews.Title: Amazon is great !
Reviews.Author: M. Ellis
Reviews.Content: I was shopping this model for months, so when Amazon sent me a $50.00 gift code for it - I purchased it right away !Great Camera - Great Price !!

Reviews.Title: Lumiix HD AVCHO lite
Reviews.Author: Chas
Reviews.Content: This is an great camera. It works well and is easy to use. I have never had a camera I liked so much and I have owned a lot of cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with lots of features
Reviews.Author: Guru H "GH"
Reviews.Content: Best of the point and shoot cameras.To begin with, Some of the settings are quite easy. GPS feature is pretty good. iAuto is great, recognizes macro and changes to it automatically. Macro pictures are very good. I shoot a lot of macros and wish it had the capability to shoot something in the range of 1cm. Currently its at 2-3cm. Videos are good but disk consuming. Again battery life depends upon video and how long its kept on. I also bought Nikon S8000. Macro shooting for this is 1cm but the photos are soft and lack details when compared to the shots under the same lighting conditions. its still 2-3 days i have started using it and some of the photos are great. Zoom feature is very good and wish it could go to 24x.  Haven't tried the other modes.Pros:1. Solid construction - Made in Japan.2. Ease of Use.3. High quality photos.4. Sharp and highly defined images.5. Face recognition.Cons:1. Medium battery life.2. Less megapixel (would have been good if it was 14 megapixel).

Reviews.Title: love my Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: kelly
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a 10-y/o Nikon Coolpix -- hobbyist, love always having a camera nearby, so was looking for smaller size but still wanted specific features, did most of my research online.  This camera has everything I wanted except viewfinder; Intelligent Auto pics are EXCELLENT quality, much better than my attempts thus far at custom settings, and the optical zoom is great; would have liked higher optical zoom, but didn't want the tradeoff in size.  Digital zoom isn't bad, but does look pixellated when zoomed TOO far.  Wasn't really looking for video so that's a bonus, and I'm surprised and pleased at the avchd quality in HD playback on my TV, using the included HDMI cable (love that cable -- easy to show pics to all my friends!); haven't tried the avchd software part yet, but it's great to have the option of avchd or mpeg mode.  Video quality in mpeg mode isn't great, but probably fine for emailing.  Miss the viewfinder, but not too much -- LED screen is surprisingly good and easy to see even outdoors.  Lot of features I've reviewed but not yet used -- almost too many features, but Panasonic has done a good job keeping the important (easy) stuff readily accessible through quick menu and easy-to-locate buttons & dials which aren't too small for my fingers.  I'm glad I printed out the user's manual -- it helped!  After 3 weeks, 500-plus pics, 4 or 5 short movies and 1 brief trip to Alaska, I'm VERY, VERY happy with this camera!  BTW, it wasn't available locally -- was very happy that Amazon had it, great  price, arrived in only 5 days (standard shipping).

Reviews.Title: Outstanding product!
Reviews.Author: painterg
Reviews.Content: Really excellent purchase. Only downer is that when you turn the camera for a vertical you can't see the image. Literally shooting in the dark!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Ferguson
Reviews.Content: I bought a Panasonic DMC-ZS7 from Amazon a little over 1 year ago.  My conclusion: Panasonic may bring great ideas to life but their customer support over the phone negates all of that. They are rude, clueless and incompetent.Never again will I purchase a Panasonic/Lumix product...from here on it will only be Cannon.Craig,Houston, Tx.

Reviews.Title: Good camera lousy photostudio software
Reviews.Author: Nick "nicksmac"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera the very next day it came out from Amazon. I was impressed with the GPS, zoom as well as the video quality. I thought I could replace my flip and my canon with 1 device. The good news is the product works. The bad news is the software is worst user designed interface I have used. Flip is like 1000 times better.a. It does not give you the option to delete pictures and videos after download to PC. So you end up with duplicates everytime and my disc space if now full. I have no time to go look at what I uploaded previous vs this time as I have a 16Gb memory disc.  Or at least offer "these 25 videos have been previously uploaded, do you still want to upload?"b. The MTS is virtually useless, you have to manually convert them to MPEG2 so other sites like Picasa and Facebook can view them. In doing so, you totally lose the MTS Hidef. So now my disc usage is twice because I have to store MTS and MPEGc. When you create a folder say 2010-Apr-Baby, it automatically creates another subfolder 100419 and put it there. I want to put it in the top folder and it won't let me do that.d. There is no easy upload to Picasa, Flikr and Facebook. You cannot share the onto appletv or boxee on TV.Lousy software, you gotta to be kidding us in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: RUN, DON'T WALK TO COSTCO
Reviews.Author: RichA "RichA"
Reviews.Content: I am a firm believer and customer of Amazon, but if you are considering this camera run, don't walk, to Costco. As mentioned in an earlier review, the price is the same but Costco also gives you a case and a 2GB card (keep uit as an emergency spare). Yes, you still need to pay the tax at Costco but here's the important part. Costco has a 90 day, no questions asked, return policy (Sorry Amazon - your's is only 30 days). If you are like me and not 100% sure about the camera, buy it and run it through its paces over the next couple of months. The sale runs through March 31st but it is limited to in-store inventories. Hopefully, my next review will tell you about what a great camera I purchased yesterday.

Reviews.Title: It was a hard decision between the ZS7 and SX210
Reviews.Author: Deal Hunting Cow "MCT"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get a camcorder for our newborn. After many researches and testing of 2 other camcorder in $300 price range(Sanyo VPC-FH1A, Panasonic SDR-H100) I've decided to get a travel zoom type camera with good photo and video quality. And as long as photo is descent, I was mainly interested in better video quality.SX210+Pro+longer zoom+Bright Viewable video in low light with only 2candle on a table.+Excellent user control and menu and spinning control switch, I loved the menu and control.+I would say about 25% longer battery life+Manual focus option+Better flash light exposure/light handling+No motor noise during zooming in video.-Con-Soft/fuzzy lens. Not sure if unit I got was defective or all of them are alike, it is 1of2 main reason for not keeping Canon. General won't realize this unless you do a side by side comparison with a sharper image.-High noise video. Even in bright indoor lighting condition. The 2nd main reason for not keeping Canon-The weird...or lack of ergonomic design, which one can get used to with practice. Hard to operate with one hand.-Sound recording is lacking, when replayed on my pc, sound felt distend and tinny.-Highlights pink/magenta color.-Its got great flash exposure, produces nice looks flash photos, but in auto mode, it would lean to use longer exposure/higher ISO over flash...no idea why...ZS7+Pro+Beautiful video, the video is over processed, but video looks great.+Sharp lens, takes sharp photos and videos+Wider angle, and the i-zoom is very usable.+Great sound recording quality, what you hear is almost what you record.+Ergonomically friendly to handle with one or both hands.+When in full auto modeCon-Image is over processed...I really don't like it...look too unnatural to me, Even customization to tune everything down in setup does not help much. However, most general users will find the image beautiful, but that's because some of the details are gone, and colors are adjusted. A image taken of my wife with ZS7 will show her with smooth skin with light makeup, but when taken with SX210, you'll see the reality of wrinkles and no makeup. However same would apply if you want to take image to show detail...there will be no detail of fine scratches/fine dusts/fine particles...-Video taken with 2 candles, and background music in the room to emulate cake cutting, was very dark. However, if you can adjust the brightness and contrast on the player you use, you'll still be able to see most things that was captured by Canon. So the data is still captured...just too dark to be viewable.....wish this was adjustable in camera.-The menu control is not as innovative and easy to navigate as the Canon, is not bad, but can really see some improvement.-In auto mode, it leans towards using flashes....which does not offer as good as exposure when compared to Canon.In the end I kept the Panasonic and returned the Canon. It was a hard decision for me until I realized the fuzzy image Canon was producing, because I simply can't stand a fuzzy video or image. My wife is happy with the wrinkle removing feature...and I will revert to my DSLR if I wanted to take photos of greater detail. You will not notices the fuzzy images unless you pixel peep at 100%, it really doesn't matter to most users who print at 4x5. But from that, I know the Panasonic have a very nice lens, and I love good lenses.I'm a Canon fan, but in this line up, Panasonic did a great job.

Reviews.Title: You dont have to out run the tiger, you just have to...
Reviews.Author: Indian "Indian"
Reviews.Content: Imagine a tiger is chasing you and another person, to survive you dont have to out run the tiger, you just have to out run the other person; I think that is what ZS7 does to its competition in this segment. I own a Casio 6MP EXilm which I was planning on upgrading, earlier I bought Nikon S6000 a few months back and returned it as its video quality in bright incandescent light was Horrendous. I then researched the Travel zoom category in detail. SX210 has a design flaw with flash popping up where you place your finger and no GPS, Casio FH100 although doesn't have GPS, thought was a tough competitor but you cant optically zoom in video (huge drawback) doesnt make sense to have long zoom when cant use it in video. didn't want to go back to Nikon s8100 with its video issues, but I am very impressed with its still picture quality and color reproduction (nothing compares to that). Samsung HZ35W the closest to ZS7 interms of features but I dont think its video quality is not as good as ZS7's in bright light. Then we have Sony HX5 probably has better lense than ZS7, especially regarding the purple streak issue that ZS7 has when pointed at bright light sources, but the image quality is not as sharp. I bought ZS7 for 199 and had it for few days now.Good : Great sharp pictures in bright light and also white light (florescent/tube) it automatically used ISO160. I was able to get nice depth of field in this point and shoot.Bad : but when it comes to incandescent (yellow) light it has some issues automatically uses atleast ISO400 gets little grainy. These issues are exaggerated in Video mode (not sure what happens with the video mode same issue with Nikon and Panasonic the screen automatically becomes a tad darker than it was in picture mode!!. Setting the AWB for incandescent light(auto white balance helped a little but does not alleviate the problem completely).Ugly : The s/w that came with it is horrendous, I still have to figure out how to download AVCHD lite videos to my computer with out the silly s/w (which I am planning on uninstalling) that was provided and also in which s/w I can play that, The manual is not a selling point either.The compromise : I had a previous bad experience with Panasonic with another electronic product I own, I seriously did not want to buy this brand. but as I mentioned earlier ZS7 did out run the others in the things I was looking for. I will experiment with it for few more days and then decide if I want to return.. but then what else is in the market that could beat this??????. Good Luck.Update on 05/01/2011, I have had this camera for a while, low light condition best to use IA auto mode to get best results bot in video and picture mode. I am down grading my rating to a 3 from 4 coz' of big missing feature. Automatic time-stamp on the picutre is missing. I couldn't believe that it was not there!!. WOW come on Panasonic you have good camera here is there there a firmware/software we can download to have this without lowering the picture quality to 3 mega pix. Please Do something. If that was there I would have increased the rating to 4.5

Reviews.Title: Beware - Software Uploads Photos to Internet Automatically(!)
Reviews.Author: Savvy Shopper
Reviews.Content: So far, camera works great.  But the "Photo-Fun" Software requires you to "register" each folder.  Actually, it quietly uploads all photos from that folder to the internet.  When I turned off my wifi, the "registration" stopped, and I could edit photos.  Too bad, because the software is apparently the only way to convert Panasonic's proprietary AVCHD-Lite format into regular MPEG2.  Would love to hear any work-arounds, and how to ensure photos are not uploaded.

Reviews.Title: software issues with windows 8 might render useless
Reviews.Author: R. M.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from a retail store just three years ago.It's very easy and fun to use, and with all it's features it readily takes good, sharp photographs.  The camera is small enough to fit in a shirt pocket, and I especially like the descriptive GPS information (i.e., "San Francisco City Hall") and other information that can be displayed on the viewing screen and later transferred to the photographs if desired.There are, however, a few drawbacks to be aware of:- the metal camera body is untextured and very slick and easy to drop, and so using the hand strap is a must;- in bright sunlight on a beach or snow-cover, it's literally impossible to see what is on the display screen in order to focus on or even see what you're trying to take a picture of (this is my first and only camera with a display screen, and this problem might be inherent in all cameras with a display screen);- it can be very disconcerting taking pictures at night, especially at a parade or other event with moving objects, as every time you move the camera every light source will smear and leave a bright, jagged trail across the display screen until you momentarily hold the camera stationary again (and this, too, might just be the nature of the beast for all display screens.)THE BIGGIE PROBLEM I saved for last:  this camera (and perhaps later versions as well) uses what I believe is Panasonic's own proprietary CD-installed software, called PhotoFunStudio, to download images from the camera to your PC.  This software also allows you to do a few very basic photo editing functions, including adding the date, time, GPS information, etc., to your photos and also then allows other photo editing software to be used to further refine your photos.However, the PhotoFunStudio software was written for older versions of Windows and might not work properly or at all with Windows 8.  When I try to install it on my brand new Windows 8 PC, I get a pop-up saying "there was a problem installing this software and it might not work correctly" (which, coincidentally or not, coincided precisely with the time I suddenly began to - and still do - have problems with my hitherto very reliable internet security software; I wonder if PhotoFunStudio corrupted my operating system, because complete uninstalls and reinstalls of my internet security system do not resolve the problems it now has.)I've been in contact with Panasonic customer service, and they were of absolutely no help; they said the software was written for an older version of Windows and might not work with Windows 8, but they are NOT going to update it.  When I asked if I can use my newly-purchased-from-Amazon Photoshop software (and rather expensive purchased user manual) in lieu of PhotoFunStudio to download photos from the camera, they said no, only PhotoFunStudio will work to download photos and to transfer display information (i.e., time, date, GPS) to them.  They suggested I try to install PhotoFunStudio in "compatibility mode" (which they didn't say how to do, and, me not being a PC person, I still haven't figured out how to do or found anyone who knows how to do) to see if that will work; that was the extent of their "help".So at this juncture, I don't know if I still have a fully functional camera, a semi-functional camera, or just a pretty expensive paperweight.  In any case, I resent Panasonic's utter indifference to this problem that will sooner or later affect every other owner of this camera as well, and thus I would not recommend this camera or any other Panasonic camera if they use PhotoFunStudio software.

Reviews.Title: Compact, yet powerful.
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Rennells
Reviews.Content: This camera takes pretty good quality pictures in both indoor and outdoor settings. You can use it as a point-and-shoot or you can have a bit more control with it. Because of that, it's allowed me to learn a bit more about the art/science of taking good pictures. Not that I'm that knowledgable, just more than I would've been with just a point-and-shoot. The size is perfect for taking with you, and the camera fits well in your hand. The zoom is more than sufficient for my needs. As for what I use it for: pictures of my young nephew, including birthday parties & trips to the park, as well as a chronicle of my semester abroad. I took some truly stunning pictures, without a great deal of effort or experience (the GPS came in handy when I was traveling too). The video feature was also great - the picture is high quality, the audio is better than I expected. Since my uses don't demand a lot video-wise, I have no reason to buy a dedicated video recorder - this camera works just fine. Another great thing is the camera's sturdiness - I take very good care of it, but my 2 year nephew has gotten a hold of it a time or two, and I've dropped it a couple times. It's seen a light bit of rain and gotten sand all over it, yet works as good as it did when I bought it about a year ago. Furthermore, the case is still in excellent condition, showing almost no signs of wear. I find that it deals fairly well with motion - my nephew rarely stays still for a pic, and I was often walking and snapping pictures at the same time while abroad. It dealt with it very well.I'll confess that the color was a factor in my purchase decision, I'm obsessed with red, and this is a beautiful shade of it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: tiffany.r
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for two years now, the quality is great, people would ask me what type of DSLR I was using. The battery life lasts an extremely good amount of time. The HD filming is great. although  all movies I have taken since I have owned this camera did not save, since the file (AVHD) is not compatible with my computer (MacBook), so you need to manually change the settings from AVHD to the other option. The zoom is the reason why I purchased this camera, and it was definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera - Not shirt pocket size
Reviews.Author: Horace'sWorld
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. The telephoto aspects of this camera are a huge plus. I can lock into my kids face during a school graduation 75 feet away with full HD video clarity. I love the GPS feature. It actually works well around the country. The picture quality is typical. Slow moving good light are excellent. Of course quality drops proportional subject motion and lighting. Overall very good camera - The lens is everything on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: onlineshopper
Reviews.Content: I bought this within the past year to replace my older canon point and shoot and have been fairly pleased.  I'm not a camera expert by any means, but I did read tons of reviews and comparison articles before deciding on this camera and I haven't been let down.  I get compliments from everyone about how my pictures look so great when I post them online and I tend to agree, as long as they are outdoor photos... I am having a hard time with indoor photos being fairly grainy and the flash not being nearly powerful enough.  Can't even take a photo across my living room without the overhead light on.  Outdoor night time pictures are just as bad.  I'm hoping maybe I just need to read the manual some more and figure out what to do differently in those situations, but with ample lighting this camera takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: LookRich
Reviews.Content: This camera is more than I could have hoped for.  I wanted a camera that could provide the usability of a point and shoot with the sophistication of a D-SLR and I really think this is it.  I can fit the Panasonic in my pants pocket and use any of the automatic settings (intelligent auto, sports mode, candlelight, etc.) but if I have the time, I can choose to manually focus, increasing f-stop and shutter speed.The pictures turn out great.  I have been very impressed with their quality.The only drawback with this camera is that it does so much.
