I've owned it for more than a year, and I still don't have all of the controls down pat...they aren't intuitive.  But this is a great camera, don't let the options scare you away.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for video!
Reviews.Author: Diana F.
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for just about a year now and can truly say I love this camera! It was about $250 when I bought it off Amazon...I usually keep it in a sandwich bag to prevent dust from getting in it when keeping it in my pocket/taking it places or when it's not in use.  It did at one point have a speck of dust that would show up in pictures but I was lucky enough to have it shake out without having to do anything invasive on the camera.  So now I use a simple sandwich bag religiously to keep dust out and it does the trick.I specifically bought this camera for recording video at live music events.  The quality (HD) is excellent, has great zooming capabilities (crystal clear at 12X zoom) and the sound is usually great (minimal distortion by things like loud bass).  The only negative is that the microphone on top of the camera can easily be covered with a finger by accident while recording if you're not consciously thinking about avoiding it.Picture quality is fine for me and I usually use the auto settings.  Some pictures do come out a little blurry and dark but like I said, I bought this for the video not the still pictures.  I know a lot of it is because I often don't use flash (because not allowed at the venue, don't want to be disruptive, etc.).  I can't really comment on the different manual settings because I'm not a skilled enough photographer to know what to do with the options.I initially bought an 8GB Transcend and an 8GB Sandisk SDHC memory card.  Both cards work fine for the HD videos. I've since upgraded to a 32 GB transcend card and never have to change the card/stop in the middle of a performance because of the storage.The battery life is almost perfect for recording HD for average 1.5 - 2 hr events (with stopping in between songs).  I always carry a spare battery and sometimes switch the battery at a convenient time anytime in the middle of an event and I'm fine for the rest of the night.I'm still very satisfied after a year and would recommend this to anyone looking to record good video!

Reviews.Title: It just gets better and better
Reviews.Author: H. Tam "fish-in-the-pond"
Reviews.Content: I bought it just when ZS-10 came out.  I went with this one after many reviews said ZS-10 was not as good as ZS-7 in picture quality.  Since then I take pictures indoor and outdoor using iA setting and the picture just came out great every time.  The zoom lens allow me to take creative protrait pictures with zoomed in as well as normal background.  I still have Sony DSC-W7 bought in 2005.  It still take great pictures and was highly recommanded at that time.  I can see the improvement of photograghy technology when I compare the two pictures side by side.  I think the Leica lens just beats the Carl-Zeiss lens hands down.  The video quality on ZS-7 is superior.  The icing on the cake is that I bought it for only $200, which is less than what I paid for DSC-W7.  I am sure I will enjoy it more and more after exploring all the options.  My next camera will have to be DSLR if I want to be more satisfied than with this one.Update: After borrowing my friend's ZS-10 and compared the same pictures taken at the same setting, I am glad I did not get the ZS-10.  Everybody could easily tell the picture quality of ZS-10 was worse than ZS-7 when the pictures were magnified.  Sorry for upsetting my friend.  I guessed the reason is the processing of image must cut corner in order to conserve the battery power given the new features added to ZS-10.  I am hoping they will improve it in the next version, say ZS-13.

Reviews.Title: photo-aholic's camera review
Reviews.Author: Joan L Garstka
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera, bag and water safe camera container for me three weeks ago. (I have had a history of dropping, losing and damaging my cameras in the past) First,the camera is fabulous!  Even I can get some amazing prints. Secondly the bag, supposedly made for the camera, is quite a tight fit.This can be a real annoyance when/if I am trying to quickly  get away from the swarm of bees I have been photographing.  Putting the camera back into the bagtakes patience and care, neither of which is a talent of mine. Third, the waterproof bag is/was just a precaution as we live on Cape Cod and there are 365 ponds here, to say nothing of the fact it is an island. Our transaction with Amazon.com was excellent and the camera is also. I highly recommend both.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera with GPS function
Reviews.Author: JJ "DIY"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera at a very good price from Amazon. After trying it out last night and this morning, I found it's easily the best pocket camera(for the price) that I have ever used. I have been liking and using the Fujifilm P&S; for years, but I just found this Panasonic ZS7 is better in most areas except the lower light and macro shots. Its auto(iA) mode works really really well and the GPS function exceeds my expectation. It picks up the signal and tracks the location very well. The video quality is very good at 720p. For the previous reviewer who has problem to view the video, K-Lite Codec Pack could help.The Fuji P&S; has less noise in lower light and better focus in macro. The package of Fuji 10x ones is smaller and more portable. This ZS7 is better in features and video quality. The ZS7 has better outdoor pictures while the Fuji ones are better indoors.With installed FastStone image viewer and Google Earth, the image viewer could launch Google Earth to show where you were in the picture. It's truly an amazing and eye-opening experience.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera with big camera features
Reviews.Author: MaggieM
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take with me to Europe.  I have a bigger Canon but wanted something smaller that would fit in my pocket or purse and still take good quality pictures.  At first I was going to buy another Canon brand camera because I was familiar with the interface, but read the reviews on the Lumix DMC-ZS7 and decided to go with it.  I also liked the zoom feature on the Lumix. I have not been disappointed in the quality of the pictures and the features.  And the interface has been easy enough to learn.  Some people might think this camera is a bit large or heavy compared to a pocket point and shoot, but I wanted something sturdy enough to hold onto.  The grip area makes it easy to hold onto. For me, it is a perfect combination of size and function.  Fits in my purse and takes great pictures with just the Intelligent Auto setting, but if you want to get more technical and customize settings, the Lumix gives you the ability to do that. The one downside is no printed manual.  I had to print off all 180 pages on 8 1/2 x 11 paper.  My Canon has a little instruction manual which I find handy to carry with me for reference.  But in all fairness, this is not a drawback unique to the Lumix.  Many cameras are coming sans instruction/user manual as a cost savings.  Also, the PhotoFun software could be better.  But, all in all, I am very happy with this camera and think it could become my main travel camera. I would recommend it to anyone who wants good quality pictures without going to an SLR.

Reviews.Title: Astounding and well worth the purchase
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this little camera because my sister has one. She can take the most astounding pictures with this little camera. I love the zoom on this. We were sitting side by side and saw a tiny bird out the window and both took a picture of the same scene. Her camera zoomed in on the bird until it almost filled the screen, my camera zoomed in showing the whole bush and a tiny speck which was the bird.I had to purchase an extra battery and a memory card for it but now I'm set. The battery came with a charger, so I have one battery being charged while I use the other.I'm still getting to know this camera but the little instruction booklet is easy to use and very informative. I LOVE this camera and I feel it was well worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Chung
Reviews.Content: I have been tracking this camera since December 2010 and Amazon finally got a sale going on since Panasonic released ZS8.  One of the biggest concern I have was the low light video taping and the noise that appears on the video.  This camera had no problems recording in low light.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Henry Holmes
Reviews.Content: I purchased this intending to buy a higher-end point-and-shoot as I have been disappointed by the performance of many other point-and-shoots. This camera is amazing! Worth the price hands down. I took it with me on a trip to Florida. The entire week I never had to charge the camera once. I took some 300 pictures and a few videos. Fantastic battery life.  While on the road I was goofing off with all the scene settings. There are a total of 29 scene settings so you are covered no matter what the situation calls for. I am not a professional photographer in any sense, but I am a graphic designer with an eye for quality pictures. I have yet to see a camera whose end-result comes close to the ZS-7. I have played with most of the popular cameras available for sale here on Amazon and they don't come close. Of all the scenes I took pictures in, the only setting that the ZS-7 was not well equipped to handle was night-scenery. I tried to take pictures of the Miami beachfront and skyline. The water was invisible in the beachfront image and the skyline was very grainy and of low quality. Pictures taken indoors in complete darkness came out perfect however.  Another point I want to touch on is how "quick to the draw" this camera is. What I mean is you could turn the camera on and in literally under 2 seconds, this camera is ready to take pictures. The focus is also blazing fast. This was very helpful when, on the road, I saw an attraction that I wanted to capture and had only moments to do so before we passed it up. Not only that, I was able to take a high quality picture in under 4 seconds- no joke!Pros:-Long battery life-Many scene settings to choose from-12x zoom-Very quick to use-High quality picturesCons:-Night scenery photography-I've read many reviews about the monopoly Panasonic has on its batteries. The manual mentions it but I don't know of this firsthand

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: Teruo Fujinaga "Trek Tyro"
Reviews.Content: I have an older Panasonic Lumix model which I liked but this is quite an improvement.  It's quite a bit easier to use and has the GPS feature but the best of all there is almost no lag time on flash pictures...which is the one thing I really didn't like on the older model.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Edward Woods
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about a month ago to replace a Canon SD900 point and shoot that I liked a lot (I had dropped the Canon while on vacation and broke the LCD).As per the other comments I've read the ZS7 takes very high quality photos.  I can't complain about that at all.  I like the number of settings and options you have, but the automatic mode seems to work quite well.  The menus are easy to navigate.  The GPS feature is OK.  Nice to have, could be better.The only complaint I have is it will eat up batteries quickly.  If you buy one, get a second battery pronto.  I got one from an Amazon vendor that works fine.  Overall, I'm happy so far.

Reviews.Title: Incredible little camera! LOVE it!
Reviews.Author: Susan VF
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after comparing reviews for several cameras in its class and price range. I am so glad I did. This camera is quality from the appearance and external materials to performance at every level. My only complaint is that annoying shutter delay that plagues digital photography, but even that is better than most. I actually purchased this as a second camera after buying a larger hybrid camera, also a Panasonic (DMC FZ40). I like to have an easy to use camera handy at at all times and also prefer a smaller camera for hiking. After using and comparing the two cameras, I anticipate using this one the most. It is so easy and the quality is impressive! This one is definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: jdmunoz
Reviews.Content: I love this camera...it is amazing....I think it has been the best choice..The video quality is much better that I was expecting. The pictures, zoom and the overall performance is great. I would recommend this camera to everybody.

Reviews.Title: USED FOR TRAVELING...BEST DEAL EVER!
Reviews.Author: ALVARO RODRIGUEZ PEREZ "ARP"
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible piece. I bought thinking about a big zoom camera but without a clumsy size for my travel to Europe.I got this and used with the GPS system...my iPic on my MAc loves the function so It made very easy to classify my pictures.LOVE THIS!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the average joe
Reviews.Author: B. Cole
Reviews.Content: love...love...love this camera! In October 2008 I had purchased a Nikon S60 (the Ashton Kutcher camera...ya know the cool looking red one) and I HATED it. It took terrible pictures and so when I left it out in the rain I had a good excuse to buy a new one. After major reasearch on Amazon I purchased this Lumix DMC-ZS7 about a month ago and so far it has treated me really really well! It is easy to use and takes great pics. The 3.0 inch display screen is fantastic. Consider this camera if your in the market and are searching for ease of use and decent picture quality. Oh and by the way I paid $150.00 more for that crappy S60 more then 2 years ago...what a jip. Lovin my panasonic!

Reviews.Title: For 200$...
Reviews.Author: Cold Pea "Pickled Pear"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for 200$! I feel like I'm getting great bang for my buck. I also own a canon DSLR rebel eos that can take mind blowing pictures but why do so many reviews compair them to this point & shoot? When you buy a car for gas efficiency like a honda or toyota prius... you dont take into fact that this $130k mercedes can parallel park itself while the heated seats massage you. Sounds like most people expect to get more than they are paying for. This is a great lil camera that can do alot. Macro shots are so easy yet you can really zoom in on detail. Great buy imo!

Reviews.Title: LUMINIX
Reviews.Author: CHOCOLATEART
Reviews.Content: I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS CAMERA, THE PICTURES ARE EXTREMY SHARP, HAS A VERY GOOD LENS, IF YOU DON'T KNOW WHICH SMALL CAMERA TO BUY I DEFFINITLY WOULD RECOMMEND THIS ONEYOU WILL NOT BE SORRY.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic lumix ZS7
Reviews.Author: John J. Smith
Reviews.Content: This camera does take great pictures and focuses fast and accurate.  It does it's best in more available light.  However, I have found that for flash pictures, to get the best result, set the dial to "P" (for Program mode) and then set the sensitivity (or ISO) to Auto.  That usually gives you good results for low-light situations.  You can also try the intelligent auto mode as well.  What is interesting in the playback mode, is that you can see what ISO that camera chose (whether you were in P (Program Mode) with Auto ISO selected or just Intelligent auto).  The key difference is that if you get a shot with a high ISO (like 800 or especially 1,000) the image will have more noise / grain.  In Program mode, you can choose an ISO of 80, 100, 200, 400, 800, and up, or you can also set it to 400 Max (which is the Max ISO that it will shoot at.  It's worth experimenting to get the best results.  If in doubt, start out in Intelligent Auto, but then switch the camera to P with ISO setting changed to Auto, and see if you get a different result.  Obviously in a dark room, you are going to get better pictures if you turn some lights on (that's always going to help and will allow for lower ISOs).  Hope that helps.  I've also noticed that the video is very good.  I'm pleased overall, but was even more so after I had done some additional experimenting in "P" program mode.  The wide lens is a plus too.  I recently took a shot of my daughter at her school assembly from a few feet away and was easily able to capture the entire group; while others were having to back up a few feet to get the entire shot, their puzzled looks at me made me chuckle, and I did say it must be the 25mm lens : )Good luck and I think you will enjoy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot EVER!
Reviews.Author: Judy Cook
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I purchased this camera about four years ago and have enjoyed it so much that I have recommend it to all my friends, which 20+ have purchased this camera and enjoyed it also.I am a professional photographer, so I know my camera's.  For a pocket size camera, I believe this one is the best for its optical zoom., quick shutter speed, and easy menu.  The video part of the camera is excellent too.I have NOT had ONE problem with this camera, which I carry around with me and use EVERY day for the past four years!  Neither have I heard of any of the others that I have recommended this camera to.You can't go wrong with Panasonic Lumix-ZS7.  Make sure you get the one with the 12.1 MP!

Reviews.Title: A 9-yard run but not a first down.
Reviews.Author: Builder Bob
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic DMC-ZS7 packs quite a punch for a small camera.  It is rather simple to use while at the same time allows for a range of functional variations in different settings.  The only part that I noticed some discretion was the quality of the digital photos.  The image processing was rather sharp; however, there were color variations that appeared to detract from certain photos expressly indoors.  The image processor's speed is fine for me for I am not a professional photographer but some may feel that is runs a bit slower than a DSLR.  Without that thought, this camera may be small but it contains quite a few features which allows for a range of use in various situations.

Reviews.Title: lumix - zoomix
Reviews.Author: Ajeet
Reviews.Content: Its my first camera... and I am loving it. The only demerit of this camera comes into picture while shooting in low light conditions. But, in daylight this camera's performance is unsurpassable among point&shoot; cameras.

Reviews.Title: waynes  review
Reviews.Author: yaksta
Reviews.Content: The camera was everything that Panasonic said it was. Great crisp clear images and looking fwd to learning more about the manual controls to become more creative.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Emerick Goulart Marconi
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this camera. It's easy to use, nice body that seems almost unbrakeable (of course that is not). A good thing about Lumix cameras is that they have a lot of good stuff not necessarily high-tech, I mean that they care about you, not only with high-tech. One of those smart things is the scenery mode Baby, that puts the age, day by day, and the only thing that you need to do is to put your son's birthday (there are 3 scenes, baby 1, baby 2 and one for those crazy about your pet). Another thing is the landmarks built-in, that appears depending on where your are, if you let your GPS work in a open space for a while.Of course that is not a small camera, but it is in a good size for a 12x zoom camera, with the incredible Leica lens.After all it's a great camera and I'm happy to have a new Lumix camera.

Reviews.Title: Great photos/video, but video boot up is too slow!
Reviews.Author: Brent Winters
Reviews.Content: I love the mega zoom on this camera and wide angle lens.  The HD video quality is fantastic even when displayed on my 110" home theater screen.  However, the biggest drawback that may lead me to buy a new camera soon is that it takes way too long to boot up to the video mode.  I like to take a combination of video and camera shots during a great scene with my family.  Unlike my past camera, this one takes 10 seconds to boot up and activate video recording.  It then takes another 4 seconds or so to save the video and take a photo, then more time to switch back to video.  I can't tell you how many moments I've missed because the camera was too slow.  I also miss my previous compact camera that fit into my pants pocket much more easily.  I will probably buy a new camera this year if I can find one with similar features that addresses these two key issues.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've owned
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: Love the camera, takes excellent pictures the quality is fantastic.  One of the best cameras i have ever owned or used....

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DNMC-ZS7 point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DNMC-ZS7 camera is a wonderful companion for the avid photographer when carrying an SLR is not feasible. It has enough settings choices to enable taking a good quality picture in most circumstances.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic ZS7
Reviews.Author: Michael Monroe "Calsun"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  Takes superb photos, is easy to use and has many controls to be creative.  I use the camera quite a bit for hiking and snow skiing.  It fits into the pocket well.  I love the high powered zoom and the large bright screen.  Easy to see even in outdoors.  Battery life seems to be normal so I purchase a 2nd battery as a backup.  Outstanding camera for around $260.  I have not used the GPS, so I cannot comment on this.

Reviews.Title: Lumix ZS-7 - A winner!
Reviews.Author: Rex Campbell
Reviews.Content: This is a well made camera, just right for "most of us." It doesn't do what the expensive Digital SLR's do, but I don't think it was designed to. The Lumix ZS-7 is what I would consider a quality "point and shoot", that contains more options than I will probably ever use. That said, the "Intelligent Automatic" setting is almost scary when you realize how many things it takes into account before taking the picture. The Leica lens (12X Optical zoom) is considered top rate, and I understand why. After taking a few pictures, you will too.I haven't yet turned on the GPS feature, and probably won't.So many pictures taken over the holidays would not have been possible without the automatic settings, the wide range provided by the long optical zoom, and the fact that the "shutter lag" is almost non-existent. Amazon's price is very fair. (If you shop around, you'll be surprised what others are charging for this camera.)I believe you will agree this camera falls into the "wise choice" category.

Reviews.Title: alot in a little lumix
Reviews.Author: tina Magill "anniecat"
Reviews.Content: After much research I bought the Lumix DMC-ZS7. I travel and love to shoot tons of photos.  My previous, and much loved Canon 790is, camera was great but limiting due to minimal zoom, and a funky spin wheel to access options (never worked easily in a hurry).  I originally thought I'd get a DSLR...but after spending time with one a camera store...I'd have to admit that as great as they are...too heavy, bulky and just too much camera. Also felt the same way about the several 'small' sized not quite DLSR and not compact cameras. I decided that for me a camera that I could carry easily, stick in my pocket and still take great photos was most important. Did alot of research and looked at many cameras. Settled on the Lumix ZS7 due to it's great lens, 'is' in zoom mode and size. It takes great photos, does not appear to have any issues with low light situations as reviews indicate, and is easy to use (the dials for choosing modes and features are much better than the Canon spin wheel). The GPS feature is ok...remember to turn off for airplanes and to save the battery.  It is fun to have the photos 'mapped' on the ipad!  Only two complaints: 1. the wrist strap does not have a slider to secure tightly to the wrist as did the Canon...will either find a better wrist strap or use the Canon one and 2. the battery/SD slot door only closes with a sliding latch (the Canon closes without a slide latch).bottom line...for a stick in the pocket fast, wide angle, 12x+zoom...a great camera.  I'd get it again.

Reviews.Title: great indoor shots
Reviews.Author: A Hamm "foodie"
Reviews.Content: I have not fully tested yet but so far am mostly pleased with this camera.  I had ordered a canon 130is and sent it back.  This has better color particularly on indoor shots.  It has a quick menu for certain thing you want to change altho I do miss the ISO button which did not require going to a menu - had that on my canon 800is which i love for outdoor photos.  This camera had more manual capability than i have had in past and may grow into it but the auto pictures are very good.  Still plyaing with it so will add sometime when get to try great scenery pics in my annual fall trip to the mountains.Peeves.  The happy color ( which I think is like vivid on the canon) only workd in auto which is odd since it onliy works on manual in the canon.it does not go back and forth between vertical and horizon on the vertical picture displays. you have to choose to have the pic diplayed with the horizontal and lose part of it in viewing or set it to only show in sideways long view so that you have to turn the camera each time.You will want and extra battery alth this one last for a reasonable while.More after I use it in more situations.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ive ever owned.
Reviews.Author: BenSMeir
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. The quality of the photos, the intelligent auto mode is incredible. All the scene modes work perfectly in their specific areas. The only part of the camera that i dont like is the performance in low light. But other than that it is the most amazing camera i have ever used. So POWERFUL. get this camera. It is the BEST of a SLR camera, but it fits in your pants pocket!

Reviews.Title: Thought it would be better
Reviews.Author: Chas52
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera last week after considerable research of many megazoom cameras. I will be short and to the point. The camera is amazing in what it can do well. The picture quality is very good with ideal lighting, the same can be said of the video. However, and it is a big however. The camera is horrible in low light situations. Using the shutter speed over 400 and in many cases 400 itself renders the picture useless. I may be doing something wrong, although I doubt it, but when I attempt to use any speed over 400 the pictures come out with a extreme amount of "noise", many times with rainbow, streaky colors, rendering the picture un-viewable. I have a small Canon IXY camera that runs circles around this camera in low light situations.  I will continue to experiment with different settings in low light situations, but I am seriously considering returning this camera due to its disappointingly low light results.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for concerts!
Reviews.Author: J. Detmore
Reviews.Content: I got this for Muse concerts. Takes incredible close ups from a distance and great picture/movie quality with the light show and night time concert venue. Awesome purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but Must Use Proprietary Battery
Reviews.Author: M. Cohen
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black) is small enough and light enough to take with me where ever I go and it still gives me very good quality photos for such a small camera.  The GPS feature sounds cool but I turned it off immediately as it offered me no added value.  The GPS uses a lot of camera battery power because it constantly uses the battery to check the position of digital photos, even when the camera is powered down.  I have not yet tried taking photos inside so I cannot speak to the camera's quality in this regard.  However, it had taken really good outdoor photos under a number of different circumstances.  I like that it is easy to use but still allows me to take manual photos under whatever circumstance pleases me.  The ZS7 allows you to take HD videos, which is not true of all cameras.  I found it easy to upload photos from the camera to my computer or an internet site.  The price for this camera was reasonable compared with other sites.One negative that I found with the ZS7 is that this camera only uses Panasonic batteries rather than AA batteries that you can purchase anywhere.  The camera also has built in software to prevent you from using non-Panasonic batteries, which is a bummer since Panasonic batteries are priced high.  I would recommend buying one additional battery as a back up to the original battery that comes with the camera.  In spite of this battery issue, I highly recommend this camera and I'm glad I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Good versatile pocket camera.
Reviews.Author: Hundred Rivers
Reviews.Content: (Have had it for about 3 weeks now)Pros:Solid buildNice designEasy to usePocket sizeVersatile - can take fairly good pictures and videosCons:GPS is unnecessary IMHOThe Panasonic self's HD format (AVCHD) doesn't play well on PCBetter to use MPEG perhapsOverall: A nice handy camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: M. S. Kennedy
Reviews.Content: This is our second Lumix camera.  We absolutely love it.  We didn't really need the GPS, but it doesn't hurt to have it.  Be sure to check your battery status and order the battery at the same time.  We had a very difficult time finding a battery charger.  Try to order everything all at the same time, to avoid running around later.  This camera is easy to use and wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: Too busy
Reviews.Content: Extremely pleased with this great camera. Easy to use for photos or taking videos. Amazing photos with little effort. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Debra E. Perini
Reviews.Content: My husband got me this camera after he researched Consumer Reports because he was tired of me griping about missing action shots due to the lag time on my old camera. An amazing camera for the price. Can't believe how awesome it takes action photos and it has the burst feature so I can take a bunch of shots in a row and not miss anything. It has a lot of features that I'm still learning to use. Thankfully, my 12 year old daughter is a whiz and just gives me that "duh Mom" look while she shows me what to do!

Reviews.Title: LOVE my new Camera!
Reviews.Author: Sara Nair
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on cameras and ended up picking this one. I wanted one that had plenty of  features. I love it. The lenses is fantastic and I love the wide angle shots. There are numerous scene selections and well as a automatic scene selection. Some say it was hard to figure out, but I did not have that problem. I went to a store to actually "play" with the cameras that I was interested in to see how they actually took shots etc. That along with just playing with camera once I received it was really all I needed. This one was by far the best to me. My other choice was a Canon and Sony, but after playing with them this one was it. Size is great and weight is great. Now I just need a new case!

Reviews.Title: ZS7 Lumix Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Dr Woo
Reviews.Content: This panasonic ZS7 replaced my Sony Cybershot which i loved and owned for 5yrs.  I now have the Lumix and was amazed how clear and accurate the colors transferred.  I view on my 55" Sony TV which makes watching movies or pics very enjoyable.  It's lightweight, advise getting a tabletop tripod for $15, that way the camera will be still when you shoot; and it will give you a more workable handle.  Even in little to no light at night the flash makes the shots still viewable.  Unbelievable quality for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great sound, easy to hold, great video
Reviews.Author: Joshua Calderhead
Reviews.Content: Prior to buying this camera, I only owned 1 other digital camera in my time and it was a very old Kodak.. it was Kodak EasyShare DX4530.I wanted to make quick notes of the major differences between my old camera and this new toy for people who like me either never had a digital camera before or has a very old one.Some things that are different that I love: The lense cap is built in so you don't have to take it off when you take a picture or risk loosing it.  There is a small on and off switch so you don't have to turn the top to the setting you want and wait while it goes through them all, you can keep it on what setting you want and just switch it on.  The battery and memory card are together on the bottom out of sight instead of one on each side.  It shows how much battery life you have left, not just when it gets low and you have to guess.  It's obviously skinner.  The place where you tie on the arm string or neck string is on the side smooth with the camera not sticking out which is nice when trying to put it in a case.It's hard to hold it still when you have it zoomed all the way or close to all the way in and it's not recommended to zoom all the way in when it's dark, it's not the best in dark light but in comparision to old camera's, it's tons better.You have to switch between "record" and "play" mode on the back to view pictures or vid's you have taken, which in the end can be faster than hitting "review" on the old Kodak and hitting it again to go back to taking pictures.. it might be annoying in the beginning, but I like it better now that I am used to it.A problem I had in the beginning, on my old Kodak you could hold it halfway in and then take the picture for a better shot, you still can on this, but you have to push down harder on the button to take a picture, which messed me up a bit in the beginning, some pictures I were taking weren't really taking.I took 162 pictures and 4 video's equal to 11:35 minutes total and I only lost 2/3 (exactly, I watched it go down to 1/3) of the battery life.  I ended up being able to take 650 pictures and the video's before it started blinking.I'm not exactly fond of how it "adds" the pictures to my computer in one big folder with a weird name, but that's easily fixed by moving them and I'm sure I can fix it to start doing it differently.. but that's how it's auto set to do.I do notice pictures don't turn out really AT ALL in the dark, it's better to make a video and take a picture off of that to even bother trying to take a picture.  In the day time though, the picture quality is amazing, it's taken the best pictures I have ever taken.  The sound is amazing to, the concert I recorded sound like they are happening all over!  Great keepsake!So overall I give this camera 5 stars, but if you need a low light camera, this camera isn't for you, I knew going in it wouldn't do well, so I was prepared and don't think it needs docked stars for that, because the sound quality more than makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: DMC - ZS7 - Lumix Camera
Reviews.Author: Lori K. "LK"
Reviews.Content: I waited a year before I bought this camera.  I wanted to be sure it was the best for the price and I am happy with the wait.  It has a GPS feature, but if you leave it on, it drains the battery, so I turned it off.  I don't need it anyway.  The zoom is better than any I've ever had, zooms into micro without changing settings if in automatic mode.  I took it to a wedding after only having it one day and learned a lot while there.  The HP movies were great, even in dark light.  The only problem was with the size being too big to email to friends.  I had made several separate movies and I put the movie on utube then uploaded to their facebook as a present. The next time, I'll keep the little movies smaller.  I was looking for a good quality camera, small enough that fits into my purse, take anywhere, even on vacation (without weighing too much).  This takes care of my wishes.  I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Arturo
Reviews.Content: I have just used it 1 time, but without even investigating the functions properly I was able to take some cool pics and vids, very good deal with Amazon by purchasing the camera with 8 GB Memory and an an additional battery.  Totally recommendable.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: c®c_31
Reviews.Content: Powerful camera in a small package. I'm still exploring the camera until now. I am not very detailed on using the other functions. I usually set it to shoot at IAuto. Well, it produced decent pictures. Note: This is a super zoom camera so it is not intended for indoor purposes, you must go out so you can utilize the zoom capability.It is indeed worth the money.

Reviews.Title: The AC/DC Saga
Reviews.Author: Fr. Nosebest
Reviews.Content: Really great little camera ..... my story is about getting AC backup even though I have an extra battery.  I called Pansonic to order the DC Coupler and was told they were out of stock and call back in a month.  A month later I was told that Panasonic stopped manufacturing the DC Coupler.  I did buy the AC adapter from Bestbatt(a much lower price) in anticipation of getting the coupler.  I called a dozen retailers to no avail.  I contacted my Japanese friend in Ontario who contacted her sister in Tokyo who bought the DC coupler (DMW-DCC5) from Amazon in Japan and airmailed it to me.  I now know why Panasonic stopped manufacturing this product.  After installing the coupler in the place of the battery and sliding open the little door to attach the AC adapter, the doorway is too small to allow the adapter to make a solid connection to the coupler.  Of course, if you open the larger battery door and connect, it works fine.What's the solution?  I took a nail file and filed down the rubber portion of the adapter.  It works fine now!Yours truly,Father Nosebest in Asheville

Reviews.Title: Slow to process
Reviews.Author: milo
Reviews.Content: Only complaint so far is the "delay" from seeing what you want to take a picture of to what picture is actually taken.  Slow.  Love all else.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Ledesma
Reviews.Content: The Lumix Zs7 is ideal for travelers because it has a great lens + HD Video + GPS..  It's great! An excellent choice also for those who want a great camera in small size

Reviews.Title: Works!
Reviews.Author: THB
Reviews.Content: The GPS is  bit erratic, sometimes records exactly, as when we were in a specificchurch in Tuscany, or more generally as only a town or locale. Andsometimes, records not at all... keeping in mind that satellite contact is oftenlost indoors.The zoom is wonderful for the traveller, and at micro, up close is extraordinary.We've already recommended it to friends about to travel.

Reviews.Title: You can't go wrong with Lumix
Reviews.Author: Rob Alfieri
Reviews.Content: I owned an older Lumix and wanted to upgrade to a hybrid with HD video. All I could say was "Wow!" as I put this camera through its paces. There are already good, lengthy reviews here so I won't go into any more detail than to say it delivers beautiful photos and good HD video. Being a photographer, I wanted a compact I could take with me on business trips and quick jaunts without having to lug my professional digital camera. You get a lot of functionality for the money in this camera. I'm incredibly satisfied with it!

Reviews.Title: Great little Camera
Reviews.Author: I. P. Freely
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera just before we went to one of the National Parks.  We used the heck out of it and got great shots and video.  We were able to take some zoom shots that made it look like we were yards away instead being on the other side of a large field.  We didn't make use of all the features but were able to get some great still pictures and some decent video with just the standard settings.  We tried using the GPS feature and were quite excited about it but it didn't quite work (see below)Make sure you buy an extra battery and charge it.  If the charger is still blinking green, it means it's still charging.For video though, we had to buy the highest throughput available (Sandisk 8GB Extreme Card, could have used a 16 GB for all the pictures and video we took).The biggest problem was downloading the pictures, the standard panasonic software did not load onto our Mac (OS X) so we had to just move the pictures over.  I think we may have lost the GPS data when we did that.  It's a pity because we really wanted the GPS information so we could use the information to make our own little sighting map.But the camera was great, would recommend.

Reviews.Title: The manual stinks!!
Reviews.Author: I read
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera from Amazon in May of '10.  Since then I have taken about 1000 photos, mostly outdoors.  I have good results using the "IA" settings.  When I get to use "SCN" things go to pot fast.  I encounter sentences such as "setting may vary according to items" [top of page 21]  Perhaps seasoned digital users don't need to read the manual, but obviously I do.  I am very limited in what I can use the camera for, or what I can do with the camera, as the manual's English just plain stinks.  I can't stitch a panorama with the manual's instructions!  For the price, I think better use could have been made of the good old english language.I have some other criticisms, but not sure they are valid, since there are so many things on the camera I don't understand.Perhaps  need a class in Panasonic-talk.  [I have a Kodak that I do fine with, including stitching panoramas]

Reviews.Title: ZS7 - Not Quite Living Up to the Hype
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "LLinMD"
Reviews.Content: This camera is almost everything that all the pundits and reviewers said it is.  I am personally a little disappointed in the images it takes indoors.  Using the iA (or is it Ai), I thought it would handle exposures better than it actually does.  I always seem to have to increase the brightness with a post edit.  Maybe I just need to find where these types of settings can be changed and set, but the draw of this camera was the "automatic-ness" of it.  Outside shoots have been stellar.  That being said, I do like it quite a bit.  It's easy to use, easy to handle and does look spiffy.  I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Green_Mom
Reviews.Content: I haven't had much chance to use this camera or print out photos, but so far it has taken really good pictures. I love the way it takes pictures fast. It has a fabulous 12x optical zoom. I hope to have a lot of fun figuring out all of the things that it can do. Since I'm not a professional, this is definitely a great point and shoot camera (with some manual features as well).

Reviews.Title: Does many things very well.
Reviews.Author: Harold D. Felton
Reviews.Content: This wonderful compact camera has been my constant companion for the last two months.  It takes really good pictures and incredible video.  I am quite amazed by the smoothness of the zoom while in video mode.  The focus also stays sharp throughout.  Is it possible to take bad pictures?  You bet!  I will have to admit though that every bad picture I have taken has been my fault, not the camera's.  The only very small issue I have is with shutter lag.  It is a little worse than on my Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ20.  Of course the only way to completely eliminate it is to get a DSLR, which would not fit in a small case on my belt.  All in all, I like it a lot and would buy it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Everything in one tight little package
Reviews.Author: EpiChao$ "'Wood Hound'"
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. This is an amazing camera for a point and shoot. The 720 HD recording is awesome. Great zoom capability & with the stabilzer feature turned on, you get great distance shots without the fuzzy edges because of slight movement. Wide angle lens also allows you to get panaramic pictures without ganging photos together. GPS is a new one for me too. Just turn it on and it will tag your photos with where they were taken. You don't even have to program it. It just works. Simple. I'm not a pro photographer by any means, but if I'm going to take a picture, or video for that matter, I would like it to be as clear and vibrant as possible. This camera does all that with very user friendly controls. My only suggestion is to get a high capacity SD card (8 GB or more). That way you can record in HD & take 10 MB pictures to your hearts content. My 2 GB card I had originally could only hold ~10 mins of HD video or a couple hundred photos. Oh, & don't let the price be a deterant. It is a bit more than I wanted to spend for a point and shoot, but you really get so many features it more than makes up for any price issue.

Reviews.Title: Amazingly simple and effective
Reviews.Author: Simone Brunozzi
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect. Quite compact, solid, good picture quality, and the GPS function.What else do you want? :)

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix ZS7
Reviews.Author: KC "Kenny C. Douglas"
Reviews.Content: I have not used the camera much to date but from what I've experienced thus far this is a nifty cam. The pics are very clear compared to its other competition. The weight is manageable and it is small enough to carry anywhere with you. The features for the price is very satisfying. I encourage anyone to try it.

Reviews.Title: The best camera in it's category!
Reviews.Author: Beth H. Porter "you create your own reality"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It is easy to use, and produces top quality pictures.  I highly recommend this camera to anyone wanting a simple to use semi compact camera.  I have taken video with this camera which I was amazed at how good it came out.  This camera will not disappoint!  It is well worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: Pictures hit and miss
Reviews.Author: Grace Y Kim
Reviews.Content: I've had several Canon SD Powershots.  I chose to switch to the Lumix for the higher optical zoom, to try out the Leica lens, and additional manual controls.I haven't quite made friends with the Lumix.  The auto mode doesn't do as good of a job for as the Canon SDs do for the average situations.  With the Canon, I found that the auto mode can usually take a decent picture that I would tweak with the manual mode.  The Lumix auto mode lets you take down right crappy photos.  But when I do get it to work - the photos are phenomenal.  The colors are brilliant (bordering on surreal) and the High Dynamic mode is a simple option to get great results.The f stop and aperture controls are difficult.The button for video playback is small and clumsy - it's hard to hit it without shaking.  Why can't it be the normal button on the top?Overall, a great product, but steeper learning curve than Canon SDs

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Sarge
Reviews.Content: Have owned many cameras SLR And point & shoot. Top of the line to almost bottom of the line.  This Camera Panasonic DMCZs7 out does any point and shoot camera on themarket in it's class  price of $200.00-$500.00. Even the lower priced SLR cameras.I'm  anticipating the New Panasonic DMC Z100 soon to be on the market end of August. I'm very happy to be part of the Amazon family. They do a awesome job in satisfying their customers.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, compact, powerful, feature rich
Reviews.Author: Wendell Geary
Reviews.Content: I really like this machine - great to carry, great for snapshots.  But lots of features - love the HD quality video and the fact that I can hook this directly to my big screen TV and play photos back for family & friends instantly.  A lot of fun.  As other reviews note - the picture quality is not up to DSLR (professional) standards, but for the price, ease of use, and the semi-serious amateur, this is a great camera to have along.  Still learning all I can do with it!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera-Big Software problem
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: This Camera replaced a Canon A720IS (8mp).  We love this camera over the Canon; the pictures are much better and more detailed.  Also, the shutter speed is faster than the Canon.We used the Satellite feature on a recent vacation and noticed that it consumed too much battery power.  While the GPS would include latitude and longitude, and pick-up (generally) the nearby city, it did not provide any location information at the Grand Canyon National Park, which surprised us and took too long to locate the satellites.The camera takes 720p video and it looks spectatcular.  Hard to belive such a small camera can take such vivid video.If I was doing this over, I might go for the ZS5 instead (without the satellite feature).  With the battery issue and time it take to locate the satellites (approx 3-5 min), its just not worth the hassle for the limited time you wish to use it.Our experience with zoom was that it loses quality as you increase the zoomx.  However, still OK.The software that came with our camera was PHOTOFUNstudio 5.1 HD Edition.  When we returned from the Grand Canyon, we had several hundred photos we loaded into our PC using this software.  However, we cannot view several hundred of the pics through the software, we have to go through explorer and use another program.  It didn't lose the pics however, it just doens't show them in when using the software (very strange).  Nor can you find them with the software.  This software glitch is a big problem and it needs to be fixed.Overall I give this camera a "good."  Really good photos generally but it has some issues.  If you decide to buy it, make sure you buy 2 batteries and keep the extra one charged and ready.  I would say the battery life is about 50-70 12mp pics.

Reviews.Title: Oustanding pictures and video
Reviews.Author: S. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small point and shoot that took quality pictures, with at least 8x zoom and had video capability.  This camera fits the bill on all criteria.  It is about the size of a deck of cards, but is sturdy and feels comfortable in the hand.  Picture quality is outstanding.  The 12x zoom is a great feature in such a small camera.  I was really surprised at the quality of the videos.  It takes high definition movies with sound.  The movies are easily converted to MPEG or WAV with one of the many freeware software packages out there (I use FormatFactory).  A great value.

Reviews.Title: I'm in love with this camera!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Rice "jlmatheo"
Reviews.Content: I'm the first to admit that I don't have a clue about most of the functions on this camera.  I was looking for a camera with lots of zoom and megapixels that would fit in my pocket.  After reading tons of reviews I decided on the ZS7.  I'm so happy with it!  Its very user friendly, especially for the novice user.  I've taken some great shots on the auto setting.  I've used it at a dance recital, the beach, a festival and just around the house.  I'm very impressed with the sharpness of the photos.The GPS feature is very cool, but I'm not sure if its horribly useful.Battery life is not as long as my previous camera, but this one has a lot more battery-sucking features so that is to be expected.So far, I'm very happy with the camera and I highly recommed it for other novice photographers.

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera I have owned.
Reviews.Author: R. Briggs
Reviews.Content: This camera has superior features.  I have had cameras from Sony(2), Fuji(3), Pentax(2), Nikon(2).  Short of buying a digital SLR, this takes by far the best pictures.  Great image stabilization.  720p video has caused ther retirement of my very nice Sony camcorder that I paid $900 for just about 2.5 years ago.  Took it on a european trip, loved both the video and the stills.  One warning.  The GPS feature is cool but will greatly reduce battery life if left on.  I couldn't figure out why I kept having to go to the second battery every day or so (thought the teenage girls were spending much time reviewing their self portraits!).  Turned off the GPS and the battery lasted for days before having to be swapped out.  If you want to turn on the GPS, use the camera, then turn it off it is a cool feature.  Wish Panasonic would make the GPS active only when the camera was on, or give us a single button to activate or deactivate it.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've Ever Had
Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great quality pictures and the zoom is incredible. I got this camera to take to concerts so I could get good pictures from far away and I've got great pictures. I wasn't disappointed in any way. And the videos it took are also very clear and you can zoom in and out while taking a video. Its very easy to use. Im not sure what all the settings do yet but its easy enough to just mess around with. The only problem I've had is my laptop wont read the videos. But that could be because I bought an HD SD card to go in it. If your computer is updated like the one in my house then there shouldnt be any problems.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: H.H.
Reviews.Content: I have two Sony Digital Cameras which I like but the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 with 12.1 MP and 12x Optical Zoom is truly outstanding and I can highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Best camera...in the price range
Reviews.Author: amkaberry
Reviews.Content: I was debating whether to go back to high end point and shoot Canon...but then i saw this camera...couldn't be happier. The GPS is an added bonus. Takes Great pics and good video with 720p.

Reviews.Title: No camera expert here, just an everyday user
Reviews.Author: V. Tichy "VT"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera about a month ago and am still learning all the features, and there are plenty.  I purchased this camera mainly based on previous Amazon reviews and reviews online.  I wanted a large zoom and just hoped that great pictures would follow.  The pictures taken outside and in good light are awesome.  We even took pictures on our boat while on Lake Michigan and they turned out super sharp, even using the long zoom.  So no worries there.  However, I've tried to use the camera at 2 weddings and was very disappointed.  After communicating with some of the other reviewers on this site, I was hoping to determine certain settings for low light and then save them in the custom settings.  I have honestly not had time yet to try to put that into practice, but will.  There has to be a way to get decent pictures in lower light areas; not perfect, just decent.  If anyone can give me simple directives, such as a shutter speed, iso setting, etc.,  that would be greatly appreciated.  Since the majority of our picture taking is outside or in a well lit house, I believe we will be fine.  But I would like to come to some satisfactory resolution for evening or indoor theater type shots.  Haven't used the GPS yet, other than to play around with it.  Oh one other thing I'd like to say is that the battery life seems much shorter than my last camera, even with the GPS off.  I will probably invest in another battery for times we are camping, etc.  Other than that, delivery, etc was great!

Reviews.Title: pictures are great... size is small... overall good.
Reviews.Author: Fs0L
Reviews.Content: I am happy with the video unless you need to zoom.  When you zoom, you can hear the zoom motor clicking along.  So that is a con to it.  It sounds like a sprinkler that goes around slow and then flips back "chick chick chick chick chick...."  But other than that, I like it.

Reviews.Title: Low light better than ZS3, manual modes help a lot
Reviews.Author: KP
Reviews.Content: Own a ZS3, recently bought the ZS7. Much better improvement.Like the low light performance, manual modes compared to ZS3.Panansonic has released new firmware 1.1.Found battery life to be less than previous model even with GPS off.Needs some adjustments to get the best photos. Especially with the ISO found good pictures with ISO 200 and 400, anything above that is too grainy.Aperture mode does help a little in low light.It is not SLR, so cannot expect more than the results this camera produces. One of the best ones.Can hold it one hand and take satisfactory photos and videos of my six months old.

Reviews.Title: Lots of great features in a small package
Reviews.Author: Katherine Schultz
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the long zoom. It's all it was promised to be and more! love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Ky
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera buff by no means, but this is a really nice device!Pictures are clean and distinct. The zoom is extraordinary. I have used the camera in several different environments, mostly on auto and the pictures are superb.  One caution, when using the zoom, having something to balance your hand will be most helpful.The video, for a camera, is absolutely amazing.  Again, you will want something to balance (stabilize) your hand while shooting.  I used it to record fireworks at the National Mall with zoom and the pictures are beautiful.  Then at our local firework display.  The ability to pan in and out with zoom while shooting is a great feature.  If  done smoothly, you can avoid blurring.  The sound quality in very good.If I had a gripe, it would be the size.  I was expecting a small pocket size camera and this is not it. That not withstanding, this will serve to document many memories for me and family.If size doesn't bother you, you will not be disappointed....  OK Panasonic, where's my advertising fee  :-)

Reviews.Title: Good Camera weak flash
Reviews.Author: Hussam Almuayad
Reviews.Content: This machine is really good. The reason that I gave it 4 points is because of a weak flash.I bought this for my old man as a gift, he loved it the pic quality is good and the ergonomics are great. I did a lot of research before buying it and i was aware of the flash weakness. I monitored my dad who has experience with cameras and I remember him few times saying that the flash is weak and that he needs to get closer to the object to have good lighting.But all in all it's a great camera , has good night metering and the lens is quite sharp.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: I shopped around for a month or so to see what the best camera for me would be, I LOVE this camera by far!!  Very easy to use, easy to download pics, the clarity is awesome!!  It even has GPS!  I highly recommend. The only issue this camera has it that when it's time to replace the battery, you MAY have to buy a panasonic battery, sometimes third party battery's won't work in this camera.  Other than that, It's a great camera!!

Reviews.Title: Stuck with a refurbished
Reviews.Author: RGA
Reviews.Content: I got this Lumix because of the features and favorable reviews.  I noticed however, that the photos were incosistent, mostly it's yellowish especially in low light.  When I used it the first time, I noticed a small dark speck on the right lower quadrant of the screen.  It also zoomed when I zoom.  I figured it must be a dust in the imaging system so I emailed Panasonic and was instructed to mail it to Texas.  When I got it back, I was very disappointed that it was replaced with a refurbished unit.  This doesn't seem fair.  I paid full price for a brand new item in a box, and I got back the camera and accessories in a plastic bag.  It is still under warranty, so at the very least it should have been replaced if not repaired and returned in the box I bought it with.  Or they should give me a refund to make up for the price difference had I purchased a refurbished unit. This may well be my last Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: FourBoyMom
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for a month.  I have used it in a variety of settings: low light, indoors, super zoom, outdoors bright light, twilight/dusk shots, sports shots.  I have to say in every case I have been extremely disappointed at its performance.  The shots are not sharp.  If I take 5 identical shots in a row - the lighting looks different in each of them - which means.  Shot one the light may fine but kid isn't smiling.  Reshoot and kid looks great but lighting is off.  Take another shot - kid is fine but flash too bright.  Frustrating!!!  My biggest complaint is that the IA setting (the intelligent auto) is SOOOOOOO slow.  Most of my shots are of my kids and I keep missing shots.  I have used a compact digital point and shoot before - I am used to a delay but they delay on the Panasonic is painstakingly slow.  I read countless reviews and felt so confident purchasing this camera.  What a letdown!!!  I tried to return it to Amazon but I was 1 DAY past 30 day return window.  Darn!!!!  Keep shopping around if you want a handy decent pocket camera - this isn't the one.

Reviews.Title: Overrated and Inconsistent Especially For The Price
Reviews.Author: High Speed Writer
Reviews.Content: I have had my Panasonic for a little over a year. I am a freelance writer who also does photography to supplement some of my writing work. While I consider myself a writer more than a photographer over the years my photos have appeared in many articles and books including cover shots. I only point this out to show that I am not a rank amateur point and shooter or someone who cannot deal with manual controls or settings adjustments. I own a couple of Canon DSLRs and also a Canon S3 that I use when I want to travel light. The S3 is getting abit outdated and I hate the fact it uses AA batteries rather than its own rechargeable unit. Carrying a bundle of AAs and/or a charger for them is a nuisance with all the travel I do. I wanted a smaller camera with a rechargeable battery that could take quality photos as well as video. Having video is a plus for some of my website clients. Long story short, after studying the market and the reviews I chose the Lumix ZS7 for the Leica lens, variety of shooting modes and video quality. The long zoom was also a plus. I must say the video is excellent, but the quality of still photos is very inconsistent. I have tried a variety of settings and modes, but none can guarantee a high quality shot. The Intelligent Auto is anything but. I abandoned using it completely. Don't get me wrong, when it works, some of the photos are high quality, but most of the time, I'd rate them as average. Shooting indoors at auto shows, quality is average at best. Forget trying to focus in on a speaker during a presentation/demonstration. Many times photos are blurry because the camera is slow in writing to the memory card. And yes, I do use a high-speed pro quality memory card. My old 5megapixel Coolpix point and shot was way better. Bottom line, this camera is overrated and overpriced in my experience. It's too bad because it is of high quality build and a nice size, altho a bit hefty. I don't usually write product reviews, but felt I needed to in this case to save someone else from perhaps stretching their budget thinking they were getting a superior product and finding out it's average at best.

Reviews.Title: i love this camera. this is the third panasonic digital camera
Reviews.Author: Dino D. Konrai "seirra troutamaster"
Reviews.Content: overall i love this camera. takes great pictures and the movie is pretty good for a point and shoot. pretty hard to beat the camera at this price. great lense.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Emilys mommy
Reviews.Content: I just pulled it out of the box and started shooting...awesome shutter speed easily captured clear pictures of my ever active toddlers in low light with no blurring whatsoever...so far it is everything this mom was looking for...I will update this when I actually read about how to use some of the functions...but for a diaper bag point and click I think it is going to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: Horrible indoor pictures - awesome everything else
Reviews.Author: Alexandre Nassif "A. Nassif"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to go to a trip in South America after a long search for a decent point-and-shoot (I own a Nikon D40X which is awesome but too big and does not take videos, and also an old 2005 model Canon which is starting to give up).I wanted something small, with stereo sound HD video recording and good pictures - nothing else. This Panasonic seemed to be all I wished for - and more. I was very happy to buy it and resolve my endless search (I had been looking for this for almost 1 year).The good pros of my experience:- The videos are incredible for a compact camera. I'd say they rival HD camcorders and are way better than I expected.- The GPS tagging works flawlessly and is also better and much more than I anticipated.- The outdoor pictures are just mind blowing awesome, bright and beautiful.- The wide angle is also superb.- The superzoom works great even though the AF is slow - but completely acceptable to me.- It uses a Leica lens and has the same guts as the V-LUX 20.Now the only con, but a deabreaker:- The indoor pictures are horrible. And I don't mean that by taking the price of the camera into consideration; I bought my sister a $70 Kodak that takes pictures a zillion times better that the Panasonic under the same light conditions (we were taking pictures at the same party, of the same subjects).I don't know what's wrong with Panasonic/Leica to release such a product in the market. How can Leica put its reputation in the line with this????Since I wanted the camera to take pictures mainly in parties/dark conditions of people (over 60% of my pictures are of people in dark conditions), in the end I returned the camera and unfortunately am resuming my search for a good point-and-shoot. I will try the Canon S95 now... and really hope to end my search there...

Reviews.Title: Good camera, but not the right one for me
Reviews.Author: A. Scoggins
Reviews.Content: I spent a great deal of time researching cameras and I thought this might be a good one for me. I really wanted something with more of a zoom than my old camera. I did not expect this camera to do well indoors or in low light, but I didn't realize how poorly it would perform in these situations. My 5 year old 4 megapixel Canon A520 produces better indoor photos than the Panasonic ZS7. I am not a photographic genius, however I do have a basic understanding of aperture, shutter speed and ISO. I am not opposed to playing with manual settings, but sometimes I just want to grab the camera and shoot in auto or P mode. I tried a variety of settings with the ZS7...I must've taken 500 pictures during the past week, just trying to figure out how to get it to produce an acceptable image indoors...a few of those 500 pictures looked pretty good, but it took way too much work to achieve that. I used it outside on a cloudy day, and those images were not great. I also used it outside on a sunny day, and those pictures turned out beautifully. If you're looking for a camera to be used strictly outdoors, then I think this camera is very good. Even with the zoom fully extended, the sunny outdoor pictures were really nice. However, I need a camera that does well in a variety of settings. The main subject of my photos is my family...kids, husband, dog, etc. This camera did not work well for me in that capacity. I tend to take most of my pictures outside, but do a fair amount indoors as well. I don't want to carry multiple cameras with me. I want one camera that is versatile. I do not expect DSLR quality photos, but I do want photos that are consistently adequate and sometimes exceptional, no matter what the setting. I am still searching for a camera that meets my needs. I'll stick with my A520 until I find something suitable (or until it dies on me!). I'm looking into the Canon S95 or Panasonic LX5 next...not much zoom, but I'll give that up for better image quality and versatility.Bottom line is, if zoom is truly important to you and you don't need something that easily produces decent indoor shots, you will probably be extremely happy with this camera. If I could afford to keep this one AND buy something else that is more versatile, I would do it.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZS7 review
Reviews.Author: Hatari
Reviews.Content: Normally Panasonic makes great products but this camera left me very disappointed.The pictures that I took were dull, colorless, not very sharp.

Reviews.Title: Love it, love it, love it!
Reviews.Author: Tech Girl "HDchic"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this yesterday and got it today, thank you Amazon!  Like most people I did a ton of research before buying.  I wanted a small camera that could fit in my purse or pocket, but didn't want to sacrifice picture quality and features.  I have an older Panasonic SLR camera, that I've really enjoyed.  I read just about every review on every model of point and shoot cameras.  I finally decided to go with this one because it had the best positive to negative review ratio, and I'm somewhat familiar with Panasonic.  I'm so glad I did.  I've been playing around with it all day and absolutely love it!  The size is perfect, I love where the flash is positioned on the front, vs on top like some other camera models.  The zoom is wonderful, no picture degradation even when at full zoom.  The picture quality is superb.  I've tried just about all the settings, I've taken pictures in practically pitch black and they are pristine.  The shutter speed is much better than my older Panasonic.  I caught some wonderful shots of birds in flight.  Movie mode is awesome.  The image stabilization on this model is far superior to my older one, which doesn't surprise me when it comes to technology improvements.  All in all, it was everything I was hoping for and more!  I will update should anything happen that changes my opinion.  I have a family member that just got a Nikon S8100, we've been comparing and the Panasonic blows the Nikon away in every catagory.  So glad I got this little thing, can't wait to play with it some more!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful camera but with some shortcomings
Reviews.Author: gwb400 "gwbnyc"
Reviews.Content: We've had a Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ1 since 2007.  It was a good camera.  We wanted a camera slightly smaller in size, and with good image stabilization.  The new Lumix, the DMC-ZS7, is a good looking camera, with nice weight and easy operation.  In the automated mode, the stabilization did not work or if it did it had no perceptible effect.  Worse yet, the camera saw the color red as too orange.  It sometimes saw the color green as white.  We had to return the camera.  The DMC-ZS7 is certainly nicely-designed, but after being disappointed with this particular camera I read other reviews and came across some which also complained of poor color imaging.  I didn't see any other comments about the poor stabilization that we encountered.  Did we just get a "lemon" or does this model have design defects?  I don't know.  Amazon accepted the return without any problems - Amazon does make buying easy, and if a return is necessary Amazon does that right too.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed in the Results
Reviews.Author: Lensviewphoto "Mark"
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to get this camera after reading the great reviews. My Canon SD 1400 IS was dropped and damaged so I opted to "move up" to the Lumix ZS7. After a number of test shots, especially video, I was moved to buy another 1400 to replace my broken one. Now that I have them both here together I have had the opportunity to do some head to head, direct comparison shots. I just do not see the results improved when looking at the Lumix photos. Actually, nearly all the ZS7 shots had to be improved with editing software while many of the Canon shots were great right from the camera, no touch up required. This is same subjects, same lighting same time. I also find the video on the Canon to be much better quality. I want to love the Lumix. The results are just not there. I have not given up. I now have on my wish list a Lumix LX5. Reviews I have read compare it to a Canon G12 or Nikon P7000. I want to give the Lumix cameras one more chance to "wow" me. This model just did not do so. Obviously. I am keeping my Canon SD 1400 IS. As a point and shoot it has provided me with the best results so far.

Reviews.Title: Zoom zoom
Reviews.Author: Picture Taker
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony Cybershot and what made me start looking at a new camera is the zoom feature while you are taking a video. The Sony did not do that and was only 10 megapixel with 3x zoom.I'm finding that the picture quality is not that better than the Sony, which disappoints me a little. I do however, like to feature of zooming in and out while I take a video, and the better zoom while taking still pictures. I do like that I can easily slip the Lumix in my purse and pull it out at anytime. I'm known for taking the pictures at all our events. So for now, it looks like I will be carrying around two cameras. I still have to take some time to play with the all the features. I do miss the touchscreen capabilities of the Sony, but am getting comfortable with the buttons on the Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Good for outdoor pictures in sunlight!
Reviews.Author: Amz Cust "James"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good (ok) outdoor pictures and video (with stereo sound) during bright daylight. It has good zoom in small package which is good. Other than that it has tiny sensor which has 14 megapixel and it uses only 12 of them. Features like iResolution, iZoom, Power OIS, sonic speed AF etc are all marketing gimmick. Manual mode is there but IQ isn't any good, anything over iso 400 is pretty much useless and visible noise exist even at iso 200. Although I got it fifty bucks discount coupon I returned my camera, amazon has good customer service though.

Reviews.Title: be afraid, be very afraid
Reviews.Author: plumber
Reviews.Content: I have had my camera for several months. In the last six weeks, the software has caused my computer to freeze. When I spoke to Panasonic, the technician and I spent twenty minutes on the telephone. Finally he told me that my 64 bit Windows seven software was incompatable! I therefor could not use the Panasonic software on my computer. I could not believe this and asked for a supervisor. After many minutes, I was told that there was a fix and I am awaiting that e-mail. I hope it works. This problem may appear immediately or after many months. It is not only poor software but dangerous to your computer as well. BE afraid both of the Panasonic software but also of their technical support!Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black) Final report: There is no repair. The software cannot be used with 64-bit computers.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket sized camera!
Reviews.Author: Anadem
Reviews.Content: My husband had purchased this same camera a couple of years ago.  He doesn't like to share, so I was hunting for my own.  Very lucky to find this item at a good price.  I take this camera with me all the time.  We live in a beautiful area with lots of scenery and small wildlife so you never know when you will need to take a photo.  Also good for grandchildren activities.  Took it on our recent vacation to the Utah/Arizona canyon country and got excellent shots.  Not an SLR, but perfect for an active grandma who likes to post on Facebook.

Reviews.Title: Decent Point-and-Shoot
Reviews.Author: Truth Seeker
Reviews.Content: After my "giant 35mm SLR" days, I've always just wanted a "point-and-shoot" that would deliver decent quality, not cost a lot, and still fit in my pocket.  I'd owned a few generations of Kodak for this and had always been satisfied.  Until the last one.  We bought that brand-new for a big trip to Hawaii.  When we got back, I was pretty disappointed with how many of the photos seemed to have some degree of blurring (yes, I wait until the viewfinder goes "green" before tripping the shutter).  This was not apparent to me on the camera display while I was taking the photos.So...I purchased this camera for a trip to Rome.  I'm happy to say that, when we got back and I could get our photos on a big monitor, they were quite nice.This is not the most "user-intuitive" point-and-shoot I've ever seen.  It does take awhile to get used to the controls, menus, and such.  But it is not insurmountable.  I use the "auto" setting for most of my shots, and it seems to do a pretty decent job in most situations.  The lens and optical zoom are both quite good.  I like the GPS feature--that was pretty cool to see on the Rome photos.  But get used to turning that feature off when you don't need it--otherwise, it is always on, even when the camera is off, which is a real battery-drainer.  Speaking of battery, you will need to recharge the battery daily if you're using this at all.  But charging does not take too long (2-3 hours?).Oh, I don't do videos much--never remember--but it does a decent job of those, too.  The video format may not be the easiest to transfer between applications, but it is doable.  If you just want to view on the camera, your TV via UBS, or on your computer using the Panasonic software--you will have no issues.  This is more of a slight issue if you want to get into "sharing" your videos.All-in-all, I've used this camera quite a bit for 18 months now and am pretty satisfied with it for what it is.

Reviews.Title: The best camera is the one you have with you
Reviews.Author: R. Dowling
Reviews.Content: I've had the Panasonic ZS7 for almost two years, and because of its small size and light weight, I find myself bringing it with me whenever I'm out and about.  It's not a replacement for a DSLR, but it allows me to capture photos that simply wouldn't be possible with lesser-quality compact cameras (or cell phone cameras).The lens has a 25mm-equivalent wide angle; this is incredibly useful, especially when walking in the city, shooting indoors at home, or taking group photos of family and friends.  It has a 300mm-equivalent at the telephoto end, which is fantastic for capturing wildlife or other distant subjects.  The macro capability is great for ultra close-ups.The movie mode is exceptionally good, and you might be surprised to know that it's actually superior to some of the newer cameras on the market.  Many of them don't allow you to zoom the lens while shooting in video mode, but the Panasonic lets you do that.  The stereo sound quality is excellent.  Panasonic really knows what they're doing when it comes to video.The quality of still images isn't as good as what you'd get from high-end compacts such as the Pansonic LX5, Olympus XZ-1, or Canon S100... but keep in mind that the ZS7's 25-300 lens allows you to capture subjects and scenes that those cameras' lenses wouldn't be capable of capturing.A wise photographer once said, "The best camera is the one you have with you."  An expensive camera capable of stellar image quality doesn't do you any good if it's so big and heavy that you never want to bring it with you.  A camera that's small enough to take it with you wherever you go can be the best camera there is, even if it doesn't deliver technically-perfect image quality.  It allows you to get the shot, and that's ultimately what counts.If you want a versatile camera that won't weigh you down, seriously consider the ZS7.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: kimmie
