Reviews.Content: I love the Lumix camera. I bought one four years ago and recently upgraded to this model. I love this camera because it does everything that I need including video - and all my pictures look so good. So glad I discovered what a gem Lumix truly is.

Reviews.Title: Small, easy to carry at all times
Reviews.Author: Bill Cole
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on 11 May 2010 (20 months ago) so I could have a camera with me in case I'm involved in an auto accident.  I also carry this with me when I'm out hiking.  The GPS feature is grrreat for recording my exact geo co ords of where I am standing when I photograph an outdoor scene. Fortunately, I've NOT had to use it for auto accident photos.I almost always use the 5 second audio recording AFTER pushing the shutter release, & say something about the direction I'm looking at, WHAT I've just photographed, or the names of the people in the photo.  This feature is indispensable - a MUST have feature!Like all LCD screen, it is almost impossible to see what you are looking at in bright sunlight & you need to remove your sunglasses otherwise you won't see anything on the LCD screen.The 25mm-300mm zoom makes this a versatile camera/lens combo; in subdued light conditions you will need a good photo editing software program because this camera/lens NEEDS adequate DAYLIGHT.For me, I use ISO 100 ONLY & the photos quite acceptable.  I've found the photos become grainy at the higher ISO speeds.  Cameras in this price range can't be expected to provide the same high quality resolution at the higher ISO's as the more expensive cameras.At night, the flash is adequate for distances out to 15 feet.This is a good camera to have IF you want a SMALL camera that you plan to carry with you at all times.  And you MUST have a spare battery, just in case.  Pay attention & recharge the batteries at least once a week even if you don't take any photos.  The batteries are small & will discharge through non-use.The optional carrying case provides good protection from accidental bumps & jars.  The stitching on belt loop broke & can't be fixed because of really flimsy material & inadequate stitching.  I'd still recommend getting the carrying case, just don't rely on the belt loop to keep your camera on your pants/belt.

Reviews.Title: 4 month review
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Rolling Along"
Reviews.Content: This is my goto camera, for hikes, biking and general photography. Easy to use with a simple menu system.  Video is excellent at 720 as well. The pictures compared to my other camera ( iPhone 4S, cannon Powershot 560, Nikon 7000) are a touch on the soft side with good color matching and fast camera operation. Low light is not bad it is a smaller P&S; and its light gathering is limited a bit. The GPS option is very handy, I did not know town much use it would be, but with some of the online hosting services having a map it is cool on trips. Recommended

Reviews.Title: Nice digital camera
Reviews.Author: anonymous "anonymous"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use interface. Only downside is sometimes press video record - need to control what your fingers touch. Also purchased LCD screen protector. Battery life is great. Good all around camera.

Reviews.Title: It's pretty much amazing
Reviews.Author: Roonil Wazlib
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about 6 months and it is definitely the best I have ever seen in a point and shoot. To be honest I never even have to take it off automatic mode because the auto photos I take are awesome! Just look in the image gallery if you are skeptical. Another bonus is that you can take awesome videos with this, and the quality of those is great too. In fact the videos have so much detail when taken outdoors that it almost hurts my eyes. Haha. It looks like the price of this has gone up a bit, when I bought it it was on sale for about $250. Now it's up to $350... I say if you want this camera (and you should!) just watch amazon prices on it for a couple of weeks, sometimes prices fluctuate a bit, I think when they get more in stock they lower the price. Overall an awesome camera!

Reviews.Title: First Digital - Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Stewart
Reviews.Content: Bought this last year but felt remiss in not giving a 'high five' review to Panasonic on Amazon. I'm no photography expert but this camera has allowed me to seem like a professional; the features are incredible. So far I have simply used IA mode and it takes some of the finest photos. For many years we used a Nikon and have many travel photos hanging on the walls. But this is the first digital I ever owned. Would highly recommend it to anyone who is interested in high quality images, ease of use and simple features. GPS system is nice also. When first bought I had to film some indoor scenes for business using HD recording. When played they were documentary quality like you might view on HDTV filmed by a professional camera crew; really sharp, with excellent sound. I am thankful for making, what turned out to be, a very good decision in buying this camera. I was reluctant since Panasonic did not seem to me to be a "camera company." They have done a great job with the Lumix DMC-ZS7. Of course, I bought this on AMZN and got an excellent deal (as always.

Reviews.Title: Was good while it worked
Reviews.Author: M. Trout "mctjbuckley"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera Aug 2010. Worked well, not the greatest in low light, but it worked well for my needs.  This month the camera broke, 1 year and 8 weeks after I bought it.  Panasonic does not offer any prorated product but will replace with a "refurbished" model for $180, almost the cost of a new one.  Customer service was not helpful and could do nothing for me.  I should have bought the Canon, they have much better customer service.

Reviews.Title: Be careful!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer St Jean "Jen"
Reviews.Content: As much as I love the Panasonic Lumix ZS-7, I would not recommend it to anyone! I bought mine in February and it is currently back to the repair facility for the 2nd time (in 8 months). The first time the lens would no longer come out, and this time the LCD screen stopped lighting up. The camera is under warranty and they just exchange it for a refurbished one. It's a pain to have to pay to send it back then wait a week for the replacement to arrive. Plus I paid for a brand new camera, I don't really want a refurbished one! When it's working it has a nice variety of settings, takes great pictures and the video mode is awesome. It's just too bad that it's not sturdier.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: ebm
Reviews.Content: I've been searching for a point and shoot with a wide angle that takes good pictures.  Unfortunately, this camera fell a little short. It has some nice features ... the zoom is great and the gps works pretty well.  When it comes down to it, its about picture quality.  I found the image colors to be a little flat.  And overall, the images are not as sharp as I would like.

Reviews.Title: CARDENASTC
Reviews.Author: CARDENASTC
Reviews.Content: EXCELENTE, MUY BUENA CAMARA, FOTOS BRILLANTES, BATERIA RENDIDORA PARA SU TAMAÑO, COMPACTA Y UN GRAN ZOM. RECOMIENDO LA CAMARA. COMO SUGERENCIA, DEBEN INCLUIR EN LOS OBJETOS QUE SE PUEDEN COMPRAR CON EL PRODUCTOS, MERCADERIA DE LA MISMA EMPRESA PARA QUE NO AUMENTE EL PRECIO

Reviews.Title: Wonderful compact camera
Reviews.Author: 'Woody'
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to take on motorcycle trips where luggage space is a premium. It has done an excellent job producing really good images, the best I've seen from compact or sub-compact cameras. The powerful zoom is great but I really appreciate the wide angle lens.The GPS is a neat feature for identifying where the picture was taken, especially when you're in the middle of nowhere, but as the instruction suggest it does consume batteries rather quickly if you leave the GPS active.Good camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera from Amazon!
Reviews.Author: BF
Reviews.Content: The quality of the photos taken by this camera was really good! If you're an amateur like me, you will have to experiment with each of the settings to get yourself acquainted with how to use each setting. I like the setting that makes your skin look better. It kind of gives the skin a softer focus but still maintain a sharp focus on the eyes. The burst setting is good for when your following an active subject. I used it when my nieces participated in a party game. I saved the photos I wanted and just deleted the ones I did not need. Oh, very important: get an SD card that has lots of memory so you won't have to stop taking photos just because you ran out of space. AND get a spare battery. Charge both batteries before taking the camera for long photo shoots. My problem as a techno challenged person is that I do not know how to transfer the videos I took with this Panasonic DMC-ZS7 to a MacBook. When I use the SD card that has a converter to make it look like a USB plug, the videos do not appear anywhere on the menu. :-(If there is anyone out there that knows of a way to get the videos from this camera to the MacBook, please advise me... Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Liked it so much I bought another Lumix
Reviews.Author: Karen K. Little "Littleviews"
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Lumix DMC-ZS7 in October 2010 and have taken at least 10,000 beautiful pictures with it. Unfortunately, I also dropped it hard three times while riding a bike (ooooooh), nicking the mode dial and I've used it in windy situations (oy!).Within the last few months, it periodically failed to focus. The problem was that grit entered the lens mechanism. I've since used a strong vacuum suction on the lens casing, which appears to have corrected the problem.The bottom line is that this camera has received very heavy use in all kinds of weather. I actually used it far more than my darling Nikon 5000, which I didn't think would happen when I purchased the Lumix. That said, because I always have need for a small camera, I recently bought a Lumix DMC-ZS8 from Amazon as a backup. It has a 16x optical zoom versus the ZS7's 12x, but it does not have the GPS (which is *very* handy), or stereo audio that the ZS7 has.No matter what, the non-touch screen Lumix cameras are truly fabulous. Easy? My 6 year old granddaughter takes professional-quality pictures with it (I'm so proud). My only tip is to periodically vacuum the lens casing, especially after a day at the beach.BTW, many Lumix models now have touch screens. As I prefer one-handed shooting, touch screen cameras are not handy for me. Also, I am not sure how a touch screen would respond if it was accidentally slammed against the ground (always a possibility with a small camera). You'll have to find another reviewer's experience for that.If you are interested, you can see some of my photography with this camera on littleviews.com and letsKickScoot.com. Look for articles published after October 2010.

Reviews.Title: Software
Reviews.Author: BT
Reviews.Content: Nice camera,but, the movie feature doesn't interface well with the Mac platform. Their phone tech support is ok, getting through to tech support via their phone menu is below marginal.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Ken "Ken"
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera about a year or maybe a year and a half now.  Its a great little camera!  Did real well on videos at a recent graduation and fits well in a pocket or a purse.  We've been very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: not so sure...
Reviews.Author: skoobie
Reviews.Content: I puposefully bought this camera prior to the birth of my first child - obviously looking for quality photos with a very fast shutter speed.  Overall I have mixed feelings about the camera.  I love the customizable settings and have been able to come up with a pretty good setup for my daughter, and love that each image is snapped with her name and age.  The video feature has also been extremely handy, although I did have to dig around to figure out how to save it in a format that was readable on my laptop.My mixed emotions stem mainly from the color of the images.  In nearly all my indoor photos where a flash is required, the image looks very red or orange.  I have since read that I may just have a faulty camera, which is unfortunate.  I thought initially it was just a quirk of this model and with a newborn, didn't have a lot of free time to research (and possibly return)!  (If anyone has any suggestions on how I may fix this problem, I would love your advice.)

Reviews.Title: The Best Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)The first one I got must be defective, as both the pictures and videos taken were substandard--fuzzy and off colors.  So I returned and wondered those raving reviews must be wrong.  However, the second one is much better--focused pictures and videos in very accurate colors, although a bit distorted around edges.  Having owned quite a few in the past, I must admit that this is the best point and shoot that I have ever owned.  If Panasonic can improve the distortions on the edges in their next version, it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: great camera - recomended
Reviews.Author: neemans
Reviews.Content: Excellent cameraGreat photos and video.Many options - so need to learn a little bit about the various options unless you use the automatic mode.Very much recommended

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed after 2 months
Reviews.Author: B. A. Canright
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with high hopes.  Initially, it fit the bill in everything I wanted in a pocket camera.  The only negative in the image quality is under low light conditions, where it will always use the night setting on intelligent mode and give a very grainy and low quality picture.  The biggest problem I am having with it is that it seems to have a HUGE problem with dust!! Already I have 4 dark spots in my pictures from dust and and little hair of dust that managed to get underneath the lenses.  Unfortunately, I cannot return through Amazon this late and I have a bad feeling that this will be a continuing problem with this camera.  Other than that, this was the best camera I could find in this price range but the dust problem is unacceptable.  I am contacting Panasonic and I hope they will pay for the servicing to get this taken care of.Update: After calling Panasonic customer support, they informed me that I will receive a different unit that is refurbished (great...) and also that I have to pay for shipping to send the camera to their facility, even though the rep. said it was a hardware problem after 2 months. Thanks Panasonic!

Reviews.Title: Not my first Panasonic Lumix.....
Reviews.Author: John C.  Schwartz
Reviews.Content: Previously had a DMC FX33 which I liked very much.  When my sister asked what I would recommend I did some research and told her about the DMC ZS7.  She loved it.  So I decided to get one myself because of 12x telephoto and faster speed.  I haven't had much chance to fool around with it yet, but will be taking it to Argentina with me in May.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Gilman
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It does everything I want/need.  It has a fast burst mode and the zoom is also very quick.  The focus time is standard for most digital cameras. The first picture delay is not very long, but if you have kids it's better to just have the camera on before you miss the opportunity.  The battery life on this is great.  I kept it on for 2 straight hours while taking about 100 pictures and about 5 minutes of video before I had to change the battery.  Great camera.

Reviews.Title: photofunstudio can't find videos
Reviews.Author: penName
Reviews.Content: i need answers about why photofunstudio, software which came with the camera, cannot find videos on my sdhc card. i can play the videos if the card is in the camera, and i can get to pictures when i use the software. but the software can't find the videos. and i cannot find anyone to contact to help me solve the problem. no phone numbers, no email, just faq's about a few unrelated things.Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Red)update: i did finally sift through the web site enough to find a phone number. long wait, as usual, and the technician eventually told me to uninstall and reinstall the software. no change. real helpful.

Reviews.Title: Ease of use
Reviews.Author: D W
Reviews.Content: This was the one for me.  I am a first time digital camera user.  I had owned one other and after reading instruction booklet just gave the whole thing away.  The Lumix was easy to understand. Still have not tried video,but am gaining courage. THANKS, Panasonic for helping me join none film buyers!

Reviews.Title: The best travel camera ever seen...
Reviews.Author: Devosmita Ghosh
Reviews.Content: It's the best camera ever seen on a good decent price....Any day any time it's better than Cannon or Nikon cameras in same range...the picture quality is azaming...However the GPS was not needed ...even if you can survive without it...The best part in the camera is its modes and the german leica lens...Trust me it's a great value for money!!!!

Reviews.Title: It's ok, but it is not impressive
Reviews.Author: Expert User
Reviews.Content: It's a good product ... though if you had one of the old Lumix with Leica lens, you will be disappointed.Not sure why, but the pictures look less sharp than those taken with older Lumix/Leica models.I expected an improvement, but instead I  find myself using my old Lumix.For the rest, it's a nice product, worth its price. Simply, if you are a user that had the opportunity to use  Lumix/Leica camera of a few years back, then lower your expectation in terms of image sharpness.One really cool features is the "baby face recognition software". It really works, once you have saved one picture of the face of your child (with the birth date), each time you point the camera at him/her, the camera will tell you the name of the face and the age. Now, does that really help ? ... well, I rather would have had better lenses. But then again, it's a fun feature and finally I am going to be taking a lot of children pictures anyway.I guess the message here is: it's a family pictures camera that does a good job for a decent price. It's not a legendary Leica lenses camera ... but then again, its price is also not legendary.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Canera
Reviews.Author: MisterA
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of this camera and how great the pictures are. I have been a life long Canon fan, but was ready for a change and Canon did not offer the features that DMC-ZS7 has. I recently went on vacation the GPS option is great to have. Good job Panasonic

Reviews.Title: a good camera indeed
Reviews.Author: Zachary Hoover
Reviews.Content: I really like the pictures produced by this camera, and the battery is good. It will be a great choice for non-professional use and home use.

Reviews.Title: Does what it says on the tin
Reviews.Author: AOB
Reviews.Content: Good camera and performs as advertised. The picture quality on the video is great but sound quality could be better.

Reviews.Title: amateur cameraman
Reviews.Author: Mary Gale Lee "dry skin"
Reviews.Content: The camera is great!  It does far more than I realized when I ordered it.  You can't hardly take a bad picture!  Great value!

Reviews.Title: So far great camera
Reviews.Author: Hunter1
Reviews.Content: I've only owned this camera for a couple weeks and have played around with it a few times.  So far very impressed great quality camera and very easy to use, all i was looking for was a nice point and shoot camera. I will update in a few months.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: SL
Reviews.Content: Pretty easy to use and great pics.  I have had people ask me if I used a DSLR camera and they were suprised when I said no, just my trusty lumix.

Reviews.Title: Picture this
Reviews.Author: M. poulin "unfortunately, bad reviews can get...
Reviews.Content: GPS and Facial recognition are neat fetures. sometimes indoor pictures are grainy.  The selector dial is cryptic, it is strange that the same cryptic letters are displayed on the screen when changing the dial - should be a full description instead.  all-in-all a goo camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: BAD vertical line distorion
Reviews.Author: lsid37
Reviews.Content: I've used the camera only for a few days. I like everything about it BUT the severe vertical line distortion even with moderately high buildings such as cathedrals. In fact, the buildings seem to be "falling". I don't know if this the property of the wide-angle Leica lens, which everybody praises but I find very disappointing. Can anybody give advice?

Reviews.Title: RE: Amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Steven M.
Reviews.Content: I cant really add anything that hasnt already been said about this amazing camera so heres a video i recorded @ a fight :) [...] be warned its a fight, but i think it shows how great this camera is

Reviews.Title: Amazing Clarity
Reviews.Author: crm3066
Reviews.Content: I searched for many months before I decided on this camera. I wanted something with stabilization, easy to use, the ability to zoom when taking movies, take pictures one after the other with only seconds in between and for horses while they are moving. The Leica lens appeared as desirable in many reviews. I had looked at Canons for a long time. I was using an older PowerShot A630 that took amazing photos even on zoom, but that was it. I also have a Kodak C533 which still works well but it's old. I wanted to upgrade. I have a lot to learn about using this camera. There are so many features. I gave Shutter Lag four stars because I was hoping it would be quicker and I am having a bit of trouble with the setting the GPS. I found using the software that came with the camera PHOTOfun not so enjoyable to capture my pictures and movies with and used the transfer default software as I am more familiar with it. Also, the file type for the HD movies, m2ts, I need to learn more about. I haven't found out how to playback movies yet, but it was easy to figure out how to see the pictures I'd taken, deleting, managing them, etc. I do recommend getting familiar with this camera in advance of using it. I went to a large horse show without really trying it out and that was a mistake. I missed a lot of photo opportunities. I also recommend getting an SDHC card with a high capacity of GBs and speed. I ordered a Transcend 8GB Class 10 card so the camera can write to it quicker. I will need to get a larger GB card if I plan to take a lot of movies. This camera is excellent for movies and pictures so I will not need to buy a separate movie camera as I only take short clips. Also, I love the red color. My BB is red too.The one thing that did upset me was that a couple of days after I bought it the price went down about $50 which didn't make me happy.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: Antonio Andrade
Reviews.Content: If you love too much travel like I do and you are looking for a big camera but you do not like the size, this is the camera that you need. You can take the manual control of this camera and the intelligent function is also really good. Be CAREFUL with the battery, it is not easy to find and it is expensive.The delivery was really good.

Reviews.Title: Not up to all the hype
Reviews.Author: gadgetnut
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to add an additional line here after my initial review above.I tried out the different modes in shooting pictures to see what's best for me.I prefer the aperture priority to AI or Shutter Priority. The "A" mode got me the best results overall. I have got especially good photos of closeup shots of flowers. The leica lens is pretty impressive.I have changed the rating from 3 stars to 4 stars.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------I got this camera last week and have been shooting some test shots.Here's my observation:The camera is well built and takes decent stills and video. The problemis that when you play the video, it comes pretty choppy unless you download anduse VLC software. The Photofunstudio software that came with the camera is alsonot very intuitive and userfriendly (for video editing).One other thing, this camera is not a shirt pocketable camera.I also own a Canon PowerShot SD780IS (bought from Amazon). Now, that's what I call atruly pocketable camera. Very tiny but take excellent still and video shots.Overall, this is an ok camera not as great as many raving reviews here and nothingto write home about._____________________________________________________________________________

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Loanie
Reviews.Content: I would totally recommend this camera for those folks who are torn between buying a SLR camera or not. This is as compact and as close as you can get to the quality and the options of an SLR camera without actually purchasing one. They say the downside of the camera is the low-lighting but I have to say I have yet found a problem with it.Another great option to this camera is the "intelligent" option. Which means it'll figure out all the extra options and select it for you without you trying to figure it out. :)

Reviews.Title: Great camera and price
Reviews.Author: rdrangel
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. Takes great pictures for what I need it for and it was a good price as well. The macro-mode takes nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: The best kept secret in the camera world.
Reviews.Author: Patrick L. O'harra "Patrick"
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a long time for a camers small enough to carry in my shirt pocket and still havea great wide angle and telephoto lens. (25mm to 300mm) and still takes great pictures. It has a excellent viewing screen and Very easy to use functions and reviewing. It also has an easy to use video button and makes very clearvideos. (you can change from close up to telephoto and back while taking a vidio). It also has GPS function that labels each picture with location. I have had Kodak, Pentax, Nikon and Sony camers and this is the best one I Have ever had.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Sugarman
Reviews.Content: this camera is everything I wished my other camera's were. It is fast, intuitive, good battery life, great color, easy options for changing settings, great zoom. I'm an amateur at photography but I appreciate good pictures and this camera makes it easy to to take good pictures. The zoom works great- fast or slow - which makes formatting simple. The picture quality/clarity is super. I have not used all the features as yet, like the video. I carry it with me everywhere so I don't miss an opportunity. I would and have recommended this camera to everyone. Smaller would be nicer but then something would have to be sacrificed.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Homer J. Onizuka
Reviews.Content: easy to use, high quality pictures, just learning to use all the features, which are many

Reviews.Title: A worthy replacement for my Canon 850IS
Reviews.Author: Wong Kuan Suan
Reviews.Content: Just received this today ... Delivery was fast.Never expected that the box package would be smaller than my previous Canon 850IS bought 3 years ago.For the price I got for it, I know it was a bargain.Even now, I await the release of the Lumix FZ100 (although I may wait a while before ordering it, want to see the reviews of others first)

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: Marcia Sliger
Reviews.Content: WOW!  This camera's a computer!  I bought it for a friend and he's in "toy heaven" with all the components.  The picture quality at 12.1 MP is outstanding and well worth the fabulous price on Amazon.  It's a little heavy for my purse use but fit conveniently in his pocket.  What a deal on Amazon!

Reviews.Title: video mode question
Reviews.Author: S. Antipas "sa5150"
Reviews.Content: Anyone know when playing back avchd lite recordings that were made on the camera , Can they be played back in windows media player and also recorded on to blu ray dvd ? or DL dvd-r ? the only thing holding me back from buying this is that i read they play back on quicktime .

Reviews.Title: Had higher hopes
Reviews.Author: just us
Reviews.Content: I bought this specifically after reading endless reviews on this and other brands.  I thought it was going to be spectacular.  If you are taking a picture inside even on a bright day, forget it!  People look terrible and grainy.  Frustrating.  It takes what appear to be great scene photos, but I was in it for pictures of my family on vacation, etc.. but people just don't look great unless you are about 1 foot from them and outside. I was excited about the HD video mode combined all in one.  I took videos on vacation and can not get them off of the camera.  You can only get them off if you use their 1 program supplied but the program does not work with all computers.  It does not work on mine, windows XP. Also trouble with Windows 7 I have read. After calling panasonic they did not seem too concerned that this program does not work on alot of computers.  So there these videos are, on the camera and can't get them off.  I want to return it but since I purchased it for vacation the 30 days has passed by about a week.  Little did I know I would run into these troubles after getting back.  Not to mention the extra batteries and high memory card I bought for it can not be returned now either. So now it will just become a waste of money camera to use at the beach outside. You can take a non HD video and download it without the program but it looks terrible. I own a Nikon D300 which I love and read that this camera was the closest point and shoot to an SLR, I would hate to see what the others are like.  The camera looks good, is a good size and takes good up close photos outside.  People look grainy no matter what if at a distance or inside.  The HD video mode is worthless if your computer does not support the only program to download them.

Reviews.Title: Far from perfect, but best from what I've tried recently
Reviews.Author: M. Mostov
Reviews.Content: Just came back from my first trip with this camera, these are my conclusions:When there is plenty of light, I think the quality of outdoor photos taken with this camera is OK, a notch below what I'd get with SLR, but it's a reasonable trade off for compactness and inexpensiveness of this camera.Indoor pictures taken without flash are sub-par, every single indoor photo taken with this camera went to trash can.  However this problem is common to all non-SLR cameras, I haven't seen better results from any other.  I haven't tried indoor photos with flash, perhaps these would come out better.There several problems that I found with indoor and other low-light shooting, at low ISO setting the exposure takes too long, unless subject is completely stationary, the pictures come out smudged.  Particularly with children, I've taken quite a few photos where child would completely leave the frame during the exposure, leaving behind a ghost trail.With high ISO setting, the pictures are too grainy, and I think they suffer from very aggressive JPEG compression - at least this what it looks like to my eye.  And indeed, the size of the compressed 12M-pixel files seems too small to allow good quality.  I have camera set to highest quality compression setting, and apparently it still compresses too much.Another big minus, is long shutter lag, when shooting moving subjects pre-focusing is essential.  if you forget to pre-focus, chances are the moment will be lost before camera finally reacts.I am also not thrilled with physical design, looks and feels far clunkier and bulkier, than even ancient Canon Elph designs from 5 years ago.One thing that I like design-wise is a separate button for shooting video, so I can instantly switch b/n video and photo without tinkering with controls or menusWith all the drawbacks, I still plan to keep this camera for what it does well - outdoor photos.Oh, BTW, I think that GPS feature is rather annoying (or rather distracting) than useful... if I had an option to get same camera without it, I'd take it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome video capabilities!!
Reviews.Author: Alex E.C. "Music and movies"
Reviews.Content: I'm going to be short and direct.1.- The video quality is spectacular the zoom and autofoucs is incredible!!,10 stars to hd video and zoom and autofoucs.2. The software to create videos none. you have to buy one to create dvd.3.Picture quality is awful!!. I bought this camera to repalce my old canon 640, and my canon 640 still taken better picture than panasonic Zs7.4.-I did return the camera and bought the canon s95. the price was 150 bucks more, but I'm so happy with the canon s95.Abysmal better photos,but medium performance in the hd video,compared to panasonic Zs7.So I'm thinking to buy a hd pocket camcorder!!5.-Panasonic Zs7 video part and canon s95 photography part, it will be the most amazing camera ,two in one!!Bottom line,Buy it if you want a so-so photos and a very excellent video with grand useful zoom.

Reviews.Title: My first digital camera
Reviews.Author: Carl Sweitzer
Reviews.Content: After some research I decided on the ZS7,I was looking for a compact and powerful camera.When I opened the box I could not find the SD card.After looking through the instructions I found that it did not come with one,I was a little disappointed.The instructions said that the camera had built in storage.I called my neighbor who is a professional photographer, he came to my house to show me the basics.We found that the built in storage held TWO pictures and to delete them we had to go to the menu.My neighbor said most cameras give the option to delete the picture without going to the menu.With that being said, this camera takes a beautiful picture.It has12MP and 16 times zoom. My neighbor said that the card inside the camera is more important than MP he said that the ZS7 must have a large card to claim 16x zoom.I just returned from a trip to Paris and Amsterdam(the reason I bought a camera) The camera was a joy to use, I just deleted  the pictures in my spare time.I found that the GPS did't drain the battery as much as some of the reviews I read,I could go all day on one battery.I carried a spare with but I didn't use it much.I had to modify the European adapter for the battery charger because they are recessed and the charger plug is flush for compactness.When I came home I could not wait to see the pictures on my 27'' IMAC.Incredible is the word to describe the pictures,I am going to make a movie with them.I made the right choice with the ZS7.I would have given it 5 stars if it came with an SD card.I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: Should've Got It From Amazon
Reviews.Author: J. Ham
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife as a gift to replace her antique Cybershot and she loves it. It is almost fool proof to use and is truly a "Point and Shoot" camera. It wasn't purchased through Amazon(Sorry, I learned saving a few bucks isn't worth bad service)but I highly recommend Amazon to releive worries one may have after a purchase like this. My wife is more knowledgable on the hardware and software end of things so I really cant speak about that. But if there was something wrong or difficult about it, I would have been the first to hear about it, so I'm sure it's easy to use. Her camera did not come with an actually paper manual, a cd which is impossible to refer to quickly when one is at the zoo or in the boat, and I wish we had one. The zoom is great, you just need steady hands or something to prop against and you'll get pictures you think are not possible with a camera this size. We've taken pictures of chipmunks at 10 yds and they look like they're right in front of you. Low light, bright light, no light, it doesn't matter, it automatically adjust for great pictures. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Zoom lens
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The zoom takes great pictures.  HOwever, it could be easier to use.  I don't like where the control for the zoom is.  I prefer Sony's and Nikon's controls for the zoom.  It is awkward to use and is jerky.  I hope I get used to it because the quality of the 12X zoom is terrific.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: DMG
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Panasonic DMC-ZS7 on Sept. 19, 2010. Just returned from vacation ( Dec. 2012 ) and can not take pictures anymore. The camera started taking very yellowy pictures with lines all through the picture. I phoned Panasonic for help with troubleshooting but they could not correct the problem. They quoted a price of $180.00 to repair or replace my camera with a refurbished one.I know that I was over warranty but you would think that a camera would last more than 2 yrs. Very disappointing! Therefore, I will never purchase A Panasonic camera or anything else from Panasonic because their products do NOT last.

Reviews.Title: satisfy
Reviews.Author: R. Yves CELLIER
Reviews.Content: Over all satisfy, GPS is an over kill, Very pleased with the Amazon services but surprised to have to pay US taxes being a resident of Canada

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: Small enough to go in a purse but very good quality if you don't want to take along the DSLR.

Reviews.Title: ZS7 the Best ever point and shoot ever owned
Reviews.Author: W. Frohlich "wolfmanone"
Reviews.Content: This the best point and shoot I have ever owned.  Great shots, ease of use and it has a GPS built on board.  What ore could you ask for in a small camera!!!!

Reviews.Title: Battery life with GPS on is O.K.
Reviews.Author: Blazing Tartan
Reviews.Content: I cannot add to any of the good reviews other than to say I left the GPS on to see the effect on battery power.  Left it for about 3 weeks taking the odd photograph before the battery conked out, so I reckon the GPS doesn't affect battery life significantly.Update 01/07/2013GPS is very slow to recognise change of location. I travelled by air from Abu Dhabi in the U.A.E. to Amman in Jordan and it was at least an hour before the camera recognised that my location had changed.Now, I admit I keep my camera, with no case, in my pocket when travelling.  That said, blotches are now appearing on images thanks to the dust and other particles that have found their way into the lens assembly. There is no way to remove this contamination.  I've carried other cameras in my pocket for years without any problems due to dust particles getting into the lens assembly.Update 01/21/2013 There is still loads of dust in the lens assembly but it turns out it's dust on the sensor that was causing the blotches on my photographs.  Found a couple of videos on YouTube with help on cleaning the sensor.  Camera is good as new again (apart from the dust in the lens assembly but which appears to have no effect on my pix).

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Gabriel A. Pang Chew "Uncle Gabe"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic DMC ZS7 is a great camera and a better than expected video cam. I suggest shooting vidoe at the highest level then comnvert it on the computer. You get a lot more vidoe time out of your flash card. The big fault was the instuctions both the limited paper version and what was on the disk.  The zoom which I bought the camera for was easy enough to hold steady except at the highest magnifications. An all around camera at a good price.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but really poor pictures
Reviews.Author: Dave K.
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 has everything - except the ability to take quality photos.  The camera is a pleasure to hold and a pleasure to use.  It has easy to use and well organized controls and menus, a nice bright and clear LCD screen, a very good movie mode, and a dynamite zoom lens.Too bad the photos are full of digital noise and are inconsistent.  I took multiple test photos of the same subject with the camera in the auto mode, and found that it would come up with a different result each time.  The last thing I want in a camera is a crap shoot - wondering if it will focus properly, or produce a photo with true colors this time.  The auto focus was very unpredictable.  Photos in low light environments were particularly awful.  The flash is completely inadequate.I sent it back to Amazon today.

Reviews.Title: Planned obsolescence
Reviews.Author: P. Clark "Pete"
Reviews.Content: I selected the Panasonic after reading positive reviews and was particularly interested in the large zoom in a compact camera. I have to take a lot of pictures for safety reports while working at height.The sad thing about this camera is the lack of after sales support from Panasonic. After just over a year the lense failed to return so back to the shop and they sent it on to Panasonic. They advised that it was just out of warranty so would cost $80 just to look at it. I gave the go ahead and was then advised it had water damage, (not possible) and it was not economic to repair but for a further $80 they would send it back to me!It is well known, that most manufacturers design and build their products with the aim of them only lasting just beyond the warranty so that you then have to buy a new one. This is pure exploitation of the consumer and governments should step in to make it illegal. I might as well have bought a disposable camera for around $10.Hopefully with consumer pressure, Amazon could collate feedback on how long a product will last, and whether it can be economically repaired. We would eventually know which products are fair and environmentally friendly and which manufacturers to avoid.

Reviews.Title: A very mixed bag
Reviews.Author: W. Webb "WillNYC31"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the GPS.  As there are very few point and shoot GPS cameras, I really only had three to consider seriously.  I chose this one because the other two on my short list produced images that looked heavily processed straight out of the camera.  The GPS is very good and accurate, once it takes its very sweet time to locate where it is.  A recent trip to Lisbon, it took the camera nearly 36 hours and a heavy drain on the battery to determine that it was, in fact, in Lisbon.  But once it figured it out, the GPS worked perfectly.  This is also a problem when traveling shorter distances as well.  Think you can drive to a town two hours away and the camera can just be picked up and the GPS will have determined location?  Not always.  So, since I was purchasing this camera primarily as a GPS camera, I am a little underwhelmed by its capabilities.  If you don't want a GPS, you  can get far better picture quality on a Cannon point and shoot for about half the price so I wouldn't bother with this camera if you don't want the GPS.  Image quality is a much bigger problem here than any of my other point and shoots, even those several years old.  The long range zoom is a great marketing device but picture quality goes down significantly when zooming even half of this camera's range.  Low light photos are worse than on my $89 Cannon.  HD Video?  Essentially another marketing ploy.  The video is fine for email and social network sharing but falls very short of being anything you'd be proud to show on a TV screen of 30 inches or more. Video on the iPhone 4 is better.  So, I gave this three stars just because, to my knowledge, this is the best point and shoot camera with a GPS.  But it needs great improvements.

Reviews.Title: ZS7
Reviews.Author: Mike Meier "farmer64"
Reviews.Content: I waited for a few reviews before purchasing. This is a great camera. Intelligent Auto mode works great. Turn it on and take pictures! The flash cycles much faster than my old Canon. The only fault I have found is a few flash pictures that are "blown". Battery life seems good. Haven't tried the GPS, not really interested in that now. I think you will be very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera, with a good zoom, 3.0-inch LCD display with excellent resolution , built-in GPS receiver, a good wide-angle setting (25mm), can record movies in HD (720p), and a lot more !!!

Reviews.Title: very unimpressed
Reviews.Author: tarheel patriot
Reviews.Content: I have a $100 Fuji that is 3 years old  and decided to get the Lumix ZS7 in order to have better video, more zoom and just all over better pictures.I used the Auto mode for my son's graduation but had someone else get photos with my old Fuji since the Lumix was so new to me..The Fuji photos all turned out better,the flash created a more natural light and the low light photos without a flash turned out betterwith the Fuji .It was interesting to have so many photos taken with 2 cameras with the same lighting,setting ect.Now I am stuck with a $[...] camera that I won't use much.. Urggg

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures...inconvenient battery charging
Reviews.Author: M. Shaikh
Reviews.Content: This is a great, high-performance camera for the price. The GPS function is a great addition, the pictures are vibrant and sharp, and the controls are fairly easy to use. I'm definitely pleased with this camera, and it's pretty easy to carry around, though a tad bulky for some pants pockets. The only gripe I have is that the battery must be taken out of the camera in order to recharge it. I don't mind having to recharge the battery after each full day of use, but having to open the battery door each time and putting the battery in the wall charger, means inevitably you will have a camera without battery power when you need it on the spur of the moment. This necessitates purchasing the optional charging cable/cradle so that the battery can remain in the camera, and remain charged and at the ready. Another consideration is that you cannot use regular AA batteries or the like in a pinch as a substitute.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMZ-ZS7  "System Error (Focus) "
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I too have had the same issue!  "System Error (Focus) " Too bad, I loved this camera for the the brief time it was working properly. The dealings with the service department would yield a whole other posting.Aside from being very protective of my cameras and taking exceptional care of them, this particular camera ( Panasonic DMC-ZS7 ) only had about 100 photos taken with it. For a digital camera, that's less than a days worth of usage for most.Being a retired professional photographer and being asked for opinions and advice on a daily basis I'll being recommending folks to avoid Panasonic products.Anyhoo, I'll not own or purchase another Panasonic item EVER!Regards,Dave

Reviews.Title: THE BEST VIDEO CAMERA I EVER BOUGHT
Reviews.Author: janet
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best video camera i ever bought. My husband and i have gotten more use and fun out of this camera than every other camera we've ever bought combined. The video is crystal clear and the sound "indoors" is very good. the outdoor sound with wind is "not great" but that is the only complaint i could ever have. seriously, my husband and i have made over 100 videos that are currently on youtube and we've gotten loads of complements about the quality of the picture and thousands of views. I wouldn't trade this camera for anything. I love it. seeing is believing. just look at some of the videos we've shot with this camera you can find my husband's videos on youtube at "straighttalkreviews" and and my own are at youtube at "stuffilove", search that and you'll see them all. john does food reviews and i just do products i like alot. all of these videos were shot with this panasonic dmc7. no special lighting, or microphones. all of john's videos are done with just a desk lamp and mine are done outdoors with no lights or reflectors. buy this camera. you will not be disappointed. plus, it has hi-definition video. what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: Pocket Camera Perfected: Rivals my Nikon D5100 in good lighting...
Reviews.Author: John Yoga
Reviews.Content: Hello Folks,This camera is a masterpiece! I have my eight year old take shots with this camera, while I am taking the same shot with the Nikon D5100, and, I'll tell you, there are times when this camera takes better shots. I have taken it all over Ireland and Scotland two years ago, and the photos are amazing.The movies are fantastic, too!This pocket camera is perfection in good light, but suffers high noise at low-light/indoor shots...Regards,Marc

Reviews.Title: waterproof
Reviews.Author: lori
Reviews.Content: just bought this camera - pics are great.  came back from a trip and accidentally dropped it into the washing machine with the dirty clothes - found it in the bottom of the washer, turned it on and it still works great!!!!!  awesome camera!

Reviews.Title: Oh, how I hate this camera! Not worth the $$......
Reviews.Author: Bonnie "chic-lit fan"
Reviews.Content: After much researching on cameras I selected this one as top choice for my needs last Christmas....yeesh, what a headache! I have my dslr but like to have a point and shoot as it is easy to carry around.  I thought I had found the perfect camera with the DMC-ZS7....oh how wrong was I?!Outside it takes incredible pictures but with the so called IA (intelligent auto) I end up with the worst pictures I have ever taken in my life, not even worth saving as they are just that bad---blurry, lighting not good, etc!The intelligent auto a lot of time goes to either macro or night time when I am inside...house can be very well lit inside and the camera automatically goes to night shooting and the photo ends up with a yellow tinge and more often then not blurry!Not only this, when I go back to preview pics where a picture should be I get a blue box with a white exclamation point instead.The flash is one of the worst I have seen, many times I just turn the flash completely off and get better results then with it on.I have had it replaced once and have phoned Panasonic many times.....this camera is more of a headache then it is worth!I have owned other Lumix camers (2 previously) and loved them! My previous camera the Lumix DMC-TZ5 which I gave to my son upon purchasing this one, takes outstanding photos and when side by side the photos on the DMC-TZ5 are much more vivid, clearer and overall just better than this camera.Panasonic removed the "normal" mode on the DMC-ZS7and left only intelligent auto which was a huge mistake on their part as for the point and shoot crowd, depending on IA to pick the correct setting for good pics is just too risky in my opinion.My biggest cons of this camera:-IA (intelligent auto) does not select best shooting mode-Panasonic removed the "normal shooting" mode-pre-shutter delay (slow to take the picture) is ridiculously slow-flash is really in a poor spot as it is by your hand grip-battery life (worst battery life out of all the cameras I have owned)Needless to say, after less than a year and I cannot even count how many ruined photos due to this camera, I am searching for another point and shoot that will actually be worth the money spent on it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Service and product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera and excellent service. Ordered the camera on a Wednesday and had it in my front door by Saturday!

Reviews.Title: Good Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Computer Guy "DEO"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife and she loves it.  Fits in her purse, easy to use and takes great pictures.  As an added bonus the videos it takes are incredibly clear.  Had it nearly a year and it has been a winner.

Reviews.Title: ZS7 is a Mixed Bag
Reviews.Author: Jerry C. Lester
Reviews.Content: The still-image quality is very good.  The video quality is good so long as you don't shoot into a light source.  If you do, you will see blue streaks in your video emanating from the light source.  Not good, but knowing this, you can avoid it.  The video resolution and sound are quite good, otherwise.The GPS function is disappointing: the position acquisition is not as frequent as it needs to be, not as frequent as my hand-held Garmin Venture HC.  So, if you are mobile, car, boat, whatever, the position recorded on the image file may be from up to 5 minutes, ago.  Ugh!  So, if you are in an activity, such as fishing, and changing position rapidly, you need to carry your hand-held GPS and use software, such as GeoSetter (free), that will sync your hand-held unit GPS position with your camera time.  In other words, ignore the GPS coordinates recorded by the camera.  But, if you are in a situation where you do not have your hand-held GPS and you want to record coordinates, you can by going to Travel Mode/GPS Settings/Update. Then you must wait until the update is complete and your current position is established by the camera.  The good thing is that the GPS function keeps the camera time synced with the GPS satellites and makes syncing with a hand-held unit GPS track simpler because no time adjustment is required.I considered returning the camera because the GPS function was deficient, but the 12x optical zoom, the image quality, and the video recording is good and worth the $199 Amazon price.  The LCD is brighter than most and the build quality is good.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Laura J. Wolf
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera and plan to take it to Italy.  Light and takes nice pictures with the zoom.  It took beautiful pictures of Key West, FL sunsets.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Steveo
Reviews.Content: Works great, pictures are great.  I love it.  The battery will drain fast if you leave the GPS on at all times.

Reviews.Title: Really like it
Reviews.Author: Duke78602
Reviews.Content: Haven't used it a lot yet but what I've seen so far it rocks. I like the wide angle lens and the compact size. Haven't used the video part yet but will try it out on my trip to Florida.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic camera
Reviews.Author: Wareor
Reviews.Content: great camera, this is my second lumix, it takes awesome pictures but i prefer some of the features on the old model as far as for setting for special shots ands different light conditions but the 12.1 Mpixels delivers some incredible pictures and the zoom and larger LCD is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMZ-ZS7
Reviews.Author: indylp
Reviews.Content: Great little camera....  The only issue I have it arrived with a little black hair inside the lensei didn't notice it until the 15th day...to late to send it back...what a bummer

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Hey its Me
Reviews.Content: I used to have the ZS-3 but it fell in the sea water. I came straight back to Amazon to order another one and found out a newer ZS-7 was available. Ordered the ZS-7 without hesitation.The main reason I bought this camera was the HD video capability. I did not want to lug around a digital camera and a video camera every time we went out. I wanted the ability to quickly switch between taking pics and capturing video. All I can say is the video quality is amazing. Of course it takes great pictures too.

Reviews.Title: size does not matter
Reviews.Author: papaRon1
Reviews.Content: This  is a compact camera that will do everything that will need to be done!!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic ZS-7
Reviews.Author: Johan Smits "De Mirre"
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera, all my friends want it too, it's handy, easy to pack and has big quality for its size! Little minor thing is the GPS functionality, it's slow. But as a gadget it's fun!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!!!
Reviews.Author: Caryn Luther
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of all of the great reviews and was looking for an easy to use camera that took great pics and video.This camera took great pics, but I always had problems with tranferring the videos (AVCHD) to my Mac. FYI - the software with this camera is not supported on a Mac.Unfortunately, after about 9 months of use, the camera lens would no longer open. I sent it back to Panasonic for repair because it should have been under warranty.  They claim there is a scratch on the front and that voids the warranty. VERY DISAPPOINTED with how this was handled.  They wanted to charge me $200 to fix a $300 camera.  I will NEVER again purchase a Panasonic camera.I have an old model Kodak that I absolutely love, so looks like I am going back to Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Smith
Reviews.Content: I have the previous model and I love it so I bought this newer model for my mom for her birthday.  I would like to trade her cameras now.  It's awesome!  I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: No surprises after carefull selection
Reviews.Author: K. Malkhasyan
Reviews.Content: I have read a lot about this camera before buying. So I was ready to all peculiarities. Works fine. Not expensive.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing camera
Reviews.Author: Ultrarider7
Reviews.Content: This is probably my 7th digital camera.  I currently own a Nikon D300s, my wife uses a Canon hundred dollar point & shoot and now this dog.I've owned a D5000, an Olympus 8080, an Olympus 5050 and an old Sony that recorded images onto floppies.  If I would have purchased this camera about the time I purchased the 8080, I'd have a higher opinion.But comparing this to today's cameras, this thing is junk.  Solidly made junk.First, my individual camera has some type of short in the power switch, and due to my own procrastination, I've probably waited too long to return it.  But that is merely the least of things that bug me about this camera.Secondly, the flash.  My little Instamatic from my childhood had a more powerful flash than this one.  Does this carry all of 10 feet?  I sincerely doubt it.Third, the lag.  Having found out the hard way that the flash pictures aren't very good, I turned it off to use it with natural lighting.  I have a new grand-daughter, and she doesn't sit still.  Even as an infant she can out maneuver this camera.  While I am hurriedly trying to get her to look at me I push the button, and by the time the camera figures out what to do, I have another picture with her in half the frame.Fourth, the color of these pictures look dull.  Now granted I purchased this one with the anticipation of being able to use it as a cheap substitute for my Nikon SLR.  When I take pictures with this one and compare the color to a shot taken virtually at the same time with the Nikon, there is a world of difference.Finally, I would say that my wife's little $100 Canon outshines this camera.  The color is far brighter, the flash actually does work within that magic 10 foot area and it's a smaller, sleeker design.So if I can't convince Amazon to overlook the fact that I've now owned this thing for a couple of months, with most of that time, sitting gathering dust, I will either give it away to some unsuspecting slob or donate it.  I wouldn't recommend this camera to anyone who has an inkling about photography.  You will be highly disappointed as I am.Thanks for reading my rant.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this camera
Reviews.Author: R Francescone
Reviews.Content: Do NOT buy this camera. It is unreliable. Twice it has stoped working. Once, so far, theyt have replaced it with a reconditioned model.Soon after I bought it it would not turn on. I sent it to Panasonic. They replaced with a reconditioned model (of which I am sure they have many. Saveral weeks later when I was on a once in a lifetime trip in the desert of Egypt, it stopped working again and would not turn on. Pansonic replied quickly to my emails telling me their warrantee did not work internationally and while they would repair/replace with another reconditioned model they would not ship it to me in Egypt. (Frankly, it probably would not have arrived anyway since the Egyptian mail system is notoriously unpredictable for in-coming mail). So, I was without a camera and not in a place where one would be available. Do NOT buy this camera. When it worked, it worked well, buit do you want a camera that stops working?

Reviews.Title: smudges on lcd screen on delivery
Reviews.Author: sim777
Reviews.Content: Camera was advertised as being new- however upon arrival no safety seal and lcd screen on back had fingerprints on it. Otherwise seems like a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Good but can not be perfect either ...
Reviews.Author: serhat buldur
Reviews.Content: This is the first camera i owned but i used lots of them from lots of brands. Here are my opinions about Panasonic Lumix ZS7 ;Product quality is above avarage, Leica emblem on the left corner looks cool and also Leica lens seems huge, so it's all about Leica not Panasonic :P the buttons backside are little bit small sometimes hard to use and also zoom ring upside is not solid. 3 inches 460000 dots screen is very shiny and colorful, i like it very much. But don't look for a eye-catching desing like Sony, when you get your camera out of its case anybody says wow :) when they use it that's the time when wows come :DSize of the camera is acceptable, it was hard to find stylish case for this size but it's way to small for 12x optical zoom monster. When you cover the body you know it is at the safe hands, Pana did make a good job here also.Usage of the camera is the best part i think. Manuel controls (i think it's semi-manuel) works like a charm at the limits of photo quality. iAuto mode is really cool feature, it always makes good job. But play switch at the back panel is too annoying, everytime you have to switch it and it is too weak, i dislike it. User Interface is way to easy for everyone, you can easily set the right settings and shoot. Quick menu also helps you about setting iso, pic size and much more in a quicker way.Picture quality is much worse then i anticipated :( i guess it's all about the sensor size and pixel density. Before i bought this cam i read that ZS3's picture quality was good enough, i decided to buy that cam but when i saw ZS7 price is only 20 boxes higher than ZS7, i bought ZS7. I thought that 10MP or 12MP does not make such differance but it does. There is no way you can shoot quality pictures at low light. You have to take pics at longer shutter times but that causes blurry pics. If you set iso to 800 or above this time you get noises. Who wants to carry tripod with that size of machine. Also daylight pics are too dim, i got disappointed with cameras pic quality :(Video quality saves this product, it's too smooth, zooming also too smooth. When taking video zooming becomes slow,i guess that decreases the sound level of the lens engine and also decreases camera shake. But there is a problem i can not find the way pausing a video when recording. There is no introduction at the manuel, i pressedall the buttons but i can't do it.Battery life is good. I can take about 300 pics, and 30 min of video. I have 4GB class 10 SDHC card and it's the limit of the card maybe with a bigger card you can take more i don't have any idea. GPS feature is useless for daily picturing i think, but there is an airplane mode so it spends less battery power.And last in the original box neither case nor memory card included. That's too disappointing, you are buying 400$ priced camera with 16mb internal memory and HD video capturing and you can not take picture or video without buying a memory card yourself.Summary don't buy this kind of product, if you want manuel controls buy something like canon g11, s90 or pana G1, in a compact it is useless, if big sizes is not problem for you go for nikon d5000 or canon rebel ti1 (eos 500D), if you want a small and HD camera go for canon sd780IS (ixus 100) or canon sd1400IS (sd1400is), both two have same sensor size, 100$ cheaper and really small sizes with cool colors and stylish body :D

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Jerry Lee Gothong "just jerry"
Reviews.Content: It is extremely user friendly. Takes great pictures. Its everything I want from a camera.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures, terrible movies, no documentation
Reviews.Author: Robert Stanfield
Reviews.Content: I read all the good reviews on this camera, and was hoping to take some great pictures and some hi-def movies with it.  When I received the camera I took some pictures with it and they were outstanding in quality.  Ok so far so good.  Then I took a 640X480 low def movie and couldn't beleive how bad it was.  It was terribly fuzzy and compressed.  I thought maybe the hi-def movie would look better, and couldn't believe that even it was badly compressing the colors causing jagged lines all over the place.I thought that maybe I had some setting wrong, so I consulted the user manual.  Whoops...there isn't any sort of advanced user manual.  Only the instructions for setting it up and installing the software.  Not even on Panasonic's website is there any documentation on this camera.Another downside is that their AVCHD movie formats cannot be saved onto a mapped network drive, their software doesn't allow it.Lots of strikes against this camera.On the upside, the movie sound is great.Overall I do not recommend this camera.  Come on Panasonic...at least put a user's manual out.

Reviews.Title: Exterior quality is not as good as the zs3
Reviews.Author: Sammy "Sammy"
Reviews.Content: I owned the prior model Zs3 that had gotten stolen. Unfortunately I didn't catch who did it.  So I went on the search for the same camera. And sadly the price had gone up a whopping 100 more than what I purchased it for.  So I settled for the Zs7 instead. Read the reviews and thought. Well its cheaper and its the newer version of mine.  So I went ahead and ordered. Just received it today, I was super excited.  But then that disappeared as soon as I opened the box.  The exterior quality is cheaper, way cheaper than the previous model. It almost feels flimsy. The zoom tab...is plastic, the point and shoot button has a plasticy feel to it. The different modes slot, does not easy glide. The Zs3 I could change the mode with my thumb, sliding it easily. The casing of the camera is plastic, the Zs3 is actual metallic feeling to it!!! and its way lighter than the Zs3.  I liked the idea of having a heavier camera, much more sturdy. I'm returning this bad boy as soon as I get a postage stamp on it. It's unfortunate, the newer model with all the upgrades they did to the piece they neglected the exterior. Which quite literally killed it for me.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing image quality
Reviews.Author: Manuel Roman
Reviews.Content: I have been using a Canon 20D with L series lenses for the last 5 years but wanted to get a compact camera for everyday use. I knew that I would not get the same picture quality so I was ready to compromise. After some research, I decided to buy the Lumix ZS7.As soon as I got it I went out to take some pictures using the fully automatic mode. I uploaded the pics to my computer, zoomed them to 100% and decided to return the camera. I could not believe how distorted the pics were at 100% zoom due to JPEG artifacts and noise (even though some pics were taken at ISO 80)I ended up buying a Canon G11 and the pics are way better. If you have been using an SLR, you will probably be disappointed with the Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Good but loud zoom motor while recording video,wimpy flash
Reviews.Author: David Devine
Reviews.Content: Pretty good.Somewhat noisy sensor.  Noise reduction smears lots of details and makes anything above ISO 200 look awful.  Even ISO 80 you can see lots of noise (even in good light).Using the camera outside was enjoyable.  There are so many different settings to tweak (intelligent resolution, auto-exposure, etc.) you could have a ball.  Usually I just set it to minimum sensitivity, Program Ae, auto white-balance.  Noise reduction -2!!!!!The video feature was the best I've seen in digital cameras (720p, AVCHD Lite).  unfortunately, it had one very annoying drawback......while zoooming during video recording, there was a very annoying sound.  It made it unusable in my opinion.The flash is extremely underpowered.  Taking a picture of my son from 5 feet away forced the camera to use ISO 400 to get a decent exposure.  At this sensitivity, his face looked more like a painting than a photo.  This is par for the course for pocket digicams, so it's understandable. Just warning you, if you're going to be using this camera indoors with the flash, I think you'll be dissapointed.I really really REALLY wanted to love this camera, unfortunately I must return it, even though it was ALMOST a great camera.  There is no digital camera out now with all these features that meets my expectations, so alas I have to wait another year.4-stars, because most people will thing it's hunky-dory.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Damenou
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite camera not only because of its size but especially because it delivers great pictures. Simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed when using with my children
Reviews.Author: Amanda's Mom
Reviews.Content: After much research, I settled on this camera and I'm disappointed.  My primary subjects are my children 4 years and 8 months and it's simply too slow in anything but bright sunlight to capture the "action".  Although I've found a way around this by forcing the auto flash on rather than on the red eye setting, I shouldn't have to override the sensors to get a decent picture.  I've also found that the red eye reduction is so bright and delayed that it causes my girls to squint and I end up getting squinty eyed pictures.  Again, I can avoid this by changing the setting but then I end up with red eye which I have to digitally remove.  I've also noticed that some of pictures, though they appear clear on the camera itself, when I upload them show blurry images.  Another disappointment.  It also doesn't have the standard mini usb outlet which means one more cable to keep track of and to differentiate from the others.I do like the zoom, but that's not much use if the image ends up blurry.  The blurry image problem isn't only an issue at zoom.  (and frankly I'm willing to admit that it's user error resulting in a blurry image, I just wish it looked blurry onscreen so I could see that right away and retake the image rather than being surprised that I have blurry images when I upload them)It's a nice size.It's fairly easy to use with a ton of settings (which is it's saving grace!)Since I've had the camera for 3 months I can no longer return it, but I sure wish that was an option.  I wouldn't purchase this camera again.  Of course, I'm not sure what I would have replaced it with either.  It's too bad my old canon died it was really a terrific little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Looney
Reviews.Content: This is replacing a Canon SD11IS. I wanted the 12x zoom and the wider angle lens.The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures and video.I didn't give it 5 starz on low light because you simply cannot give a P & S camera 5 on this. You just have to have perfect low light pics, buy a DSLR and an external flash!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I haven't had the camera to long but in the short time I have used it it has taken awesome pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good but not enough for me
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I wanted a view finder and a hot shoe. camera is terrific other than that.

Reviews.Title: Does everything a much bulkier and heavier would do
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: Camera is easy to use and feels good to hold.  It does almost everything that my 12x much heavier, and therefore not used, camera.  Big negative is lack of instruction book with the camera.  You have to download and print which makes it difficult to carry with you. The software overwrote my other photo software and it's not nearly as good or user friendly.  I'm still glad to have the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, poor white balance
Reviews.Author: Bigbillyt "A Consumer"
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic DMC-ZS7 is a great little camera in almost every way. The controls are quite good, with a fairly low learning curve. The image qualty is good, but the white balance and color rendition are all over the place. The build quailty is also quite good. If the color balance was even close to consistent, or if you could cotrol it better with the white balance settings, I would have loved this camera. So, after trying this and a comparable Nikon I am headed back to a Canon brand.Sorry Panasonic, I wanted to love you but your color interpretation was just too wacky for me.

Reviews.Title: OVER RATED
Reviews.Author: petee "pfr"
Reviews.Content: Low Light & Picture Quality Indoors are sub-standard. Does not compare to Nikon & Canon quality. Returned after one week.

Reviews.Title: Great overall butt....
Reviews.Author: K. J "Skyman"
Reviews.Content: Really sharp pictures and great features. The flash is so weak it uses a clear lens in front of the strobe. All my pictures had dust halos (white blotches) from light reflecting back into the camera. Indoors and out. The flash pictures were also very dark, except for the subject. Never had that problem with my Canon. I am returning it to buy the new 210IS. Sorry Panasonic

Reviews.Title: Got a dud!
Reviews.Author: CGMusicFan
Reviews.Content: Much to my disappointment, and just my luck, I received a defective ZS7. In 'record' mode the LCD image is purple and distorted. In 'playback' mode the purple goes away and the color looks right, but all pictures have horizontal lines through them. It's not just a problem with the LCD display either, as the pictures have lines through them when viewed on the PC also. Too bad, seems like it would be a decent camera otherwise. Fortunately the seller is Amazon which has a great exchange policy. Hopefully the replacement is in better shape.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera
Reviews.Author: HT
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera for a little over a month.  Picture quality is okay, nothing to write home about.  Seems a little slow between photos.  It meets our needs as the quality isn't bad and it is compact enough for placing in the pocket.

Reviews.Title: average quality
Reviews.Author: panasonic fan
Reviews.Content: Large zoom and optical stabilization is a plus. Metal body which feels solid, sturdy, and well built.Picture quality is average at best. My previous 2MP Kodak took better pictures when compare at 100% blown up picture size. PASM probably can make it better, however, if you practically think about it - this is a pocket size point and shoot camera and people use it to capture spontaneous moments and have no time to play with various settings. Camera performs very poorly in auto setting irrespective of what pixel density you select. Low light performance is even worse.AVCHD is great in needing less memory as well as slower card but that also means you need to buy more memory cards and keep all your videos on it and play it in camera on to your HDTV through built in HDMI connection. I downloaded free software to see AVCHD file on computer but didn't work consistently. There must be sophisticated paid software available that would mean that saving in motion jpeg would be more flexible at cheaper cost.One plus is if you have Panasonic TV then viera link lets you operate camera (in view mode) through TV remote which is probably a great option when you have friends/family gathered and you want to show(off) them pics/movies of event/trip/vacation.** Bad Bad Bad vertical lines in video (not in pictures somehow!) if pointed at even slightest shiny object (sun light reflection from car body - not even glass - etc.)Battery life is short as well. Definitely didn't seem like 300 or so as advertised. Seemed more like 100 or most likely less.

Reviews.Title: lumix zs7
Reviews.Author: ND Quy "ND Quy"
Reviews.Content: I find the camera performs well but rather heavy compared to others of the same class. the GPS function seems to be superflous.

Reviews.Title: LUMIX 16X
Reviews.Author: LIFE IS GOOD "POPPY"
Reviews.Content: RECEIVED CAMERA RIGHT BEFORE A VACATION AND FOUND IT EASY TO USE. LOVE THE ZOOM CAPABILITY, LOVE THE SIZE AS IT IS EASY TO PUT INTO A POCKET. FOUND THE MOVIE BUTTON TO BE IN THE WAY OF HOLDING THE CAMERA HOWEVER AND PRESSED IT UNKNOWINGLY SEVERAL TIMES. THAT PART WAS ANNOYING. ALSO FOUND THE WRIST CORD INADEQUATE AS IT DOES NOT SNUG UP AND SLIDES OFF TOO EASILY. IF YOU ARE PLANNING A VACATION OR SEVERAL HOURS OF PHOTOGRAPHING SUGGEST YOU GET A SECOND BATTERY. I USED ABOUT ONE AND A HALF BATTERIES A DAY.

Reviews.Title: lumix dmc-zs7 shortcomings
Reviews.Author: rescuetwo
Reviews.Content: I would rate this camera as exelent in all areas except longevity...Word to the wise do not let this camera get wet.I had this camera for six weeks, just becoming familiar with its functions, then I was out in some rain (and I don't mean a lot of rain) camera in my shirt pocket  ...and that was the end of that camera.

Reviews.Title: Fairly decent and good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: S. Gifford "NightShift"
Reviews.Content: After reviewing my review,I've decided to change it as I was a bit harsh on the fact that there was no RAW support.  So far I like the camera and it is working as described.  Im planning a trip to Costa Rica hence I bought this camera since I don't want to lug around a large camera this seems like it fit the bill and should do what I need.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Robert M. Dibbs
Reviews.Content: I bought this with the hope it would be a good alternartive to lugging around my Nikon D-90.  The specs seemed good as did many of the reviews.  However, the lag time is completely unacceptable, and the flash is weak.  Also, I made a mistake in that I had not realized how much I prefer having a viewfinder, which this lacks.

Reviews.Title: DELICATE !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Prescott "MilDoc"
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A VERY DELICATE FRAGILE CAMERA!!!! NEVER EVER DROP IT!!!While turned OFF, DROPPED 2 FEET ONTO A RUBBERIZED BUS FLOOR AND THE ZOOM JAMMED when turned on! Would NOT work again! Reported "System Error" on startup and that was it.This is my 4th digital camera. The others were Canons, KEPT 3-4 YEARS, and dropped several times from greater distances onto harder surfaces, with NO problems.Yes, electronics can be delicate, but THIS is ridiculous. I have sent it in for repair as it was only 2 weeks old. Comments later.NICE camera, worked great for 2 weeks. GPS pretty accurate but not perfect. Recognizing the built-in landmarks the same - good but not perfect. Probably the function of the GPS satellites, not the camera. Great photos.BUT IF YOU BUY ONE, GET A NECK STRAP AND NEVER EVER DROP IT !!!!!

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera With Two Big Issues + ...
Reviews.Author: L. Wilson "Lou W"
Reviews.Content: A Great Little Camera With Three Big Issues1. This camera is great in good light.It is not good in low light situations in fact its downright abysmal2. There is a hiss sound every time you shoot a video in all modes.This is very annoying and from posts elsewhere this is a common problem with this camera.3. There are issues with capturing and editing the AVCHD Lite HD (except in Final cut)Luckily you can record HD in .mov format in stereo and edit in iMovie.
