You cannot do this in AVCHDIts not full HD its only 720.Its ashamed this little camera has so much potential but I returned it for a refund.I had an earlier model and it did not suffer from these issues.I will wait for there Canon G12 when it ever comes out - I have a G10 - Now thats a camera but sadly no HD yetI would of loved to give this camera a 5 star but ....... I guess I am too particular

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Review
Reviews.Author: Pi
Reviews.Content: It takes pictures pretty well... but I thought it would be slimmer and that the lenses wouldn't be so fragile.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but pricy
Reviews.Author: SC Guys
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Black)I have been doing business with Amazon since they first went online and have been satisfied with their pring and service. In this case, I believe they are way out of line on the pricing of this camera. I have seen valid pricing of $50 less than their selling price of $313 for this item. I like this camera and would buy it from Amazon if their pricing was more in line with competition. Let's go Amazon, get competitive!

Reviews.Title: hmmmm
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for less than a year and the zoom doesn't work all the time and it has never been dropped (in which I was in disbelief due to having two boys). It was great until the zoom stopped working. It works maybe 1 out 10 times. UGH! Another down fall is when I recorded videos with it and I was unable to find them on the computer for a LONG time and then find out that it has 4 different files to equal one video...very confusing. And I can't upload the videos to send to people because of this. If you're not computer/camera savvy I don't recommend this camera. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: This could be a great camera,,,, BUT.
Reviews.Author: Keith Grove "Keith"
Reviews.Content: I just received a brand new DMC-ZS7 a RED one and it looks great. My wife beat me to the front door when the UPS guy rang the bell but when she picked up the box the camera almost fell onto the concrete path in front of the door.Now how can this happen? you may well ask, the shipping box from Amazon was barely bigger than the actual camera box providing little or no padding and protection. As if that was not bad enough the really outrageous thing was that the shipping box was closed by a fold-in flap at each end that had NO TAPE OR GLUE TO SECURE IT. One flap was completely open and when my wife picked it up the inner camera box almost fell out, she just caught it in time. I called Amazon immediately to complain, the agent was very apologetic and advised me to send a message using a new feature that lets you communicate directly with Amazon shipping. I sent an appropriately curt message with pictures, I will let you know if anything happens.Now to the camera, it looks like a very nice camera but once again the Mfg. has done some crazy things that should get the development engineer and the micro brained marketing people FIRED.Panasonic provides an external battery charger, which is nice and convenient until you realize that there is NO WAY to charge the battery while the battery is in the camera or to power the camera from an external source while the battery is in the camera. Well what's wrong with that you say, well what if you want to do something really far out such as display photos or play a video on an HD TV. If the Battery runs down then you have to stop the show while you remove the battery and recharge it.Ah! said I there is a USB connector surely the camera can be powered from this like so many other devices, NO YOU CANNOT POWER THE CAMERA FROM THE USB CONNECTOR. Now I delve into the manual, there appears to be some sort of DC power connector which plugs into the camera but how. I call tech support and spend a fruitless hour talking to someone who has nothing but a very basic understanding of the camera (or anything else for that matter, I had to explain the difference between AC sand DC) but I did find out that there is something called a DC coupler cable that COUPLES the camera to SOMETHING (the tech. person was not sure what it coupled to). Tomorrow I am supposed to get a call from a supervisor who knows more.I started searching the Panasonic site and other sites for some information, here is what I found.There is an optional device which can power the camera from external AC power, it consists of a DC power source and a plastic box that is the same size as the battery, you remove the battery and insert this box in its place. A cable from the DC power source plugs into a connector at the bottom of the plastic box which then connects to the battery input pins inside the camera. What a total screwup.The battery and DC connector are on the bottom of the camera it is therefore impossible to stand the camera on its base while this abortion is in use, neither can you attach the camera to a tripod because the connector gets in the way.I am not finished with this sad story, after a lot of searching I found what appears to be the part # for this contrivance and what appears to be a list price of, WAIT FOR IT -------- $79.99. BUT, with more searching this does not appear to be the correct device even though it was described as the DC COUPLER FOR A DCM_ZS7. Pictures of the device in no way correspond to the functionality of  the DC COUPLER.What the hell does Panasonic think it is doing, even if you get the right DC COUPLER it is still powered by AC, there appears to be no way to recharge the battery or power the camera from a car adapter. All Panasonic had to do was to tap into the USB connectors 5 V supply and all problems would be solved, if they were concerned about charging the battery from the USB power they could have easily just allowed the camera to be powered by the USB. What is going on?This may be a deal breaker for me.Before I got this ZS7 I had tried the Samsung TL240, another terrific camera that is until I discovered its fatal flaw. The TL240 could be powered and recharged from the USB power supply, Hallelujah, however the TL240 had a strange HDMI port. I had called Samsung about this as their literature was very vague about it, "it's a standard MINI HDMI port" they said "you just need a standard MINI to full size HDMI cable" they said, they lied.When I got the camera I saw immediately that the HDMI port was TINY and in no way could a mini HDMI fit into it so called them, they knew NOTHING about this problem but suggested I call their parts suppliers and ask for a part # they gave me, they provided 2 phone numbers (samsung-parts and J & J International). Neither outfit had any knowledge of the part # or any HDMI cable for the TL240. J & J said that there were probably none in the country they might be in KOREA. I called Samsung back again, they had NO idea what to do or when they might have the cables or what they would cost.I returned the camera.Is it me, am I expecting too much or do these companies employ idiots in their marketing departments, NO it must be me.

Reviews.Title: Great while it worked
Reviews.Author: Ty Davison
Reviews.Content: I had the predecessor to this camera, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS3, which like the ZS7 featured a 12x Optical Zoom that really "made" the camera. I found the camera to be slightly unintuitive at times, but the picture quality was quite good in most cases and the 12x zoom was marvelous for capturing close-ups that my other point-and-shoots (with 4x optical zooms) couldn't get.Unfortunately, the camera stopped working about 6 months after purchase. I sent it to Panasonic for repair and was told that the lens was dented. How this happened during normal usage I have no idea, because I take very good care of my equipment and it was never subject to any sort of drop or abuse. The camera worked, I turned it off, it never turned back on. Essentially, I paid a lot of money for a device that worked well for about 6 months, and Panasonic's refusal to live up to their end of the warranty coverage has me strongly doubting that I'll ever buy from them again.I have no doubt that the ZS7 is a product capable of producing lovely images just as the ZS3 was. I have no confidence that Panasonic will stand behind it or any of their other products should something go wrong.

Reviews.Title: The unexpected
Reviews.Author: khalid
Reviews.Content: After a long research, I selected this camera for its zoom and picture quality. It was beyond my remotest expectation that this camera will not work out of the box. The camera will switch on and the lens will go out and back in like crazy. On top of it, I have not received the replacement sent by the seller yet. I am wondering where are our good old manufacturig quality control and marketing standards.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera with some issues
Reviews.Author: BEDIMAN
Reviews.Content: Everything was OK until I did some video recording and upon playback there was some heavy grainy out of focus scenes and you can hear the motor zooming extremely loud on playback. I did not like the way you had to flip a switch to review pictures you just took. Pictures looked pretty good however, I had to return it.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre Software - Transferring pics to PC a nightmare
Reviews.Author: Dot 7
Reviews.Content: Even though the camera takes excellent pictures, transferring them to your PC is an awful and time consuming experience that I have come to dread. PhotoFunStudio 5 HD Edition requires that you either select the photos you choose to download one by one, or that you select all of them. Now, if you're like me and you take hundreds of pictures and several movies at one time and you choose not to clear your memory card, this can be a big problem. If you select the "All" option the software does not remember which movies have already been downloaded and automatically creates a copy of them in each folder, right next to the original. Unless you clear your memory card this will go on forever until your hard disk is full of useless copies of movies which you will have to delete manually, one by one. Even when you select the photos you would like to download, the software still decides to download all the movies all over again and save them as copy 2, 3, 4 and so forth, in each folder. In addition, the download time is awfully slow.I'm used to my old Canon Powershot software, ZoomBrowser EX. First of all, it gave me the option to download only the new photos, those that had not been previously downloaded, and secondly after clicking the OK button it was a matter of seconds and voila, all done! Unfortunately ZoomBrowser does not recognize the Panasonic movie format, so it downloads only images, otherwise I would be using that. Now I have to use ZoomBrowser for the photos and then go back manually and download the movies with PhotoFunStudio. What a pain! I miss Canon's easy of use very much and unless Panasonic makes some much needed updates to Photo NOT SO MUCH FUN Studio 5 HD Edition, I will definitely go back to Canon.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7
Reviews.Author: rasty
Reviews.Content: Great camera. You ned to have it. In europe doesn't work the HD under PAL; this is the only con I see.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic DMC-ZSC
Reviews.Author: Beverly
Reviews.Content: Battery life is horrible. Photos are good. Lots(too many) of adjustment options. Zoom is good but the instant zoom does not allow you to back out, only in. Camera is more clunky and heavier than I am used to. Too heavy for a shirt or pant pocket. Manual is too involved. I miss my Olympic!!! This camera was a gift....I should have been more specific...live and learn I guess.

Reviews.Title: You cannot get support to use the movie option. Panasonic is pathetic with hours on hold and no help
Reviews.Author: Meryl Nova "Meryl Nova"
Reviews.Content: the camera comes with software to make the clips if this is why you want the camera. It did not update for me and is a bit low quality. I called panasonic becduase the error message you get states this. the agent takes no real information but keeps putting you  on hold for 20 min at a time. the is no reason for it. In the end they do not offer any help for you. they know nothing about the software and keep you waiting for no reason. If you want this camera for the special HD movie feature buy another company where they care about your time and have people who know something. I tried three agents. All the same joke.

Reviews.Title: Unwelcomed Surprise
Reviews.Author: Richard Crane
Reviews.Content: Nothing in the description of this camera on Amazon or on Panasonic's website alerted me to the fact that it would essentially not work with just it's internal memory. As a result, we took the camera on a trip right after we received it and were surprised when after two pictures we got an alert that the memory was full. I read the manual and everywhere additional memory was discussed it was referred to as "optional." I don't think that anyone would characterize this as optional. Rather, it is a necessary addition to have any real use of the camera. I spoke with Panasonic and got nothing but word games.

Reviews.Title: The Panasonic/Lumix camera....
Reviews.Author: Nicholas in Seattle
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 1-23-2011:I am here to update my review after having spent considerable time using and pushing the limits of my new Camera here.1) Apparently I am too used to full length feature film works, because what I have learnt in asking, is that the new camera's of today, are made specifically "for tasks". The camera I bought is for residential, non professional use. However it does take professional quality pictures, as well video's. Of the 15 minutes short take variety. Honestly I should have known better than to think moreso. I do apologize for missing that point. The battery in the camera, works just fine for the SHORT LENGTH VIDEO it does take... and without any troubles. KUDO'S!2) I am still not happy that I cannot hook up to AC Power with it. The battery is it. Some have said buy a second battery, well that's a gimmie now. I will indeed.3) Further study, this camera zoom in STILL "IN MY OPINION" not all its cracked up to be, in fact, the Kodak V seriees Zoom beats the hell out of any I have seen thus far. Mind you what I said " of any I have seen". And I have not seen ALL camera zoom ever made. But of the many I have seen, Snieder Lenses RULE in zoom and clarity.3) The camera does in fact take Feature Film Quality photo's as well video. And again I state the slower moving controllable zoom makes keeping the images in focus from A to Z much better. I would love to see them work on this factor some more.I like the Camera, but I do not LOVE the camera. The V-610 Kodak far outweighs any digital compact I have seen or used since. I miss that camera big time. But this one is absolutely my 2nd choice.Always Nicholas in SeattleOkay, well I am a Filmmaker-Director-Producer- avid photographer throughout my lifetime thus far... 50 years alive and counting...I've been taking pictures since I was 7 years of age. Reported to be one of thee greatest natural photographers in history. Not my personal opinion, but rather thee opinion of professionals in the related field.In using the camera mentioned herein I have found a few things... see them as you like, but these are "my personal experiences" thus far...I purchased this camera brand New through Amazon weeks ago. It is now December 23rd 2010 SO early December it was purchased....#1) The camera is not even remotely "user friendly". I am constantly referring to the manuals to try and figure out "how to" do things with it.#2 ) My greatest PEEVE or disappointment with this camera are two things, 1, it does not seem to have an AC POWER SUPPLY, and one most certainly DID NOT COME WITH the camera in the box. I assume I will have to pay YET MORE for that feature, IF that feature even exists with this camera ??? I will have to RESEARCH MORE IN THE MANUAL to learn this ... and 2, when I plug my camera into my computer to view or download pictures or video's... the computer does not charge the camera at the same time LIKE OTHER FAR LESS EXPENSIVE CAMERAS DO. ( GEEZE with ALL I paid for this ONE WOULD THINK I would at least have something the CHEAPEST CAMERS OUT THERE HAVE??? HELLOOOOOO !!!)#3) When I was trying to get my Camera "interior memory items" into my computer, it was almost impossible to find out HOW TO TRANSFER from internal memory to disc or hard drive.#4) When I take pictures, there are so many settings on the dial to choose from, and NONE OF THEM ARE CLEARLY MARKED AS "TYPICAL OR NORMAL" settings ( again LIKE MOST CAMERAS HAVE ). So I cannot tell what the NORMAL EVERYDAY picture taking mode IS ?????#5) When I take a picture, they are rarely SHARP. And that PROBABLY stems from my lack of KNOWLEDGE regarding WHICH PICTURE TAKING MODE I am SUPPOSE to be in. ???#6) The BRAGGED ABOUT 16X ZOOM feature.... is NOT all it is bragged up to be. I had a Kodak V610 compact digital, which I must say had THEE GREATEST ZOOM and LENSE CLARITY of ANY camera I have seen since. UNFORTUNATELY FOR ME... I dropped it into SALT WATER on accident, and that split second of submerging cost me the life of that amazing camera. While I was bragging it up, a friend told me that Panasonic made a better lens and zoom. So that is why I bought the DMC-ZS7, but I can tell you pointedly, the lens IS NOT AS GOOD AS the Kodak V610 by any stretch of ones imagination. Nor is the ZOOM even REMOTELY CLOSE to the one in my old V610. Ohh well, learn from our mistakes I guess...Video wise however....The video mode of this camera is awesome ONCE YOU CAN FIGURE OUT HOW TO USE IT, *Ugh* I LOVE the clarity of the video, and I especially LOVE the ability you have to CONTROL THE ZOOM IN AND OUT """SPEED"". Which is CRITICAL to GOOD VIDEO FOOTAGE. Focus at the slowest controllable speed is outstanding.I give HUGE KUDO's for that ability.I would suggest that Panasonic/Lumix take focus on making the SPEED OF ZOOM even MORE EASILY controllable, which will enable the shooter to capture consistent STELLAR videography, or video production.Thats all for now. Possibly more later as I dig deeper into the camera's abilities, in attempts to Master this device.Always Nicholas in Seattle

Reviews.Title: Battery does not work!?
Reviews.Author: bigfansue "bigfansue"
Reviews.Content: The first one I purchased right here on Amazon worked fine with my Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7. I ordered a second as I am going on a long trip and for some reason it does not work. Says "battery will not work in camera". The battery looked the same but not exactly. The print was a bit smaller and the box it arrived in had a strange lable on it.  Box all beat up and looked like someone had already sent it back.  I sent it back and hoping for a refund.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel effective recording
12X optical zoom (4X digital/48X total zoom)
Built-in GPS function lets you keep track of your photos by location
3" LCD screen
Optical image stabilization
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD (Silver)
